description:
I think you'll be hard pressed to find another spot that serves a Veggie burger under $7. They've got cucumbers, lettuce, tomatoes, hummus, their own sauce, and onions inside the burger. 

No long lines, lots of seating, and quick service. They've also got free spicy pickles, which is a must. Centrally located with all the little shops nearby.
author: Patty B.

description:
I brought my famished out-of-town guests here for a quick bite in a busy sight-seeing day. I was determined not to have them pass out on the streets of San Francisco thanks to my super nifty turbo tour guide skills. Nope! Not on my watch. I tried to find something quickly en route for our sight-seeing without reading reviews, keeping my fingers crossed this would satisfy their cries of hunger. You'd think I didn't feed them breakfast a few short hours before but all that looking can sure work up an appetite...

Their eyes popping wide open as they took their first bites and the chorus of mmmmm's & this is "damn good" reassured me that this place delivered...phew!!!  Oh wait, that was me saying, "damn good" and accidentally inspiring the 8 year old to repeat it after me...whoops!! But no really, they couldn't stop commenting on how tasty and juicy (not greasy) the burgers were. 

The quality of the food is really good. Y'all may possibly know I'm not the biggest meat eater out there, but this burger was so good, my greedy little taste buds were left wishing that I had gotten the super duper burger rather than the mini burger. However the mini combo was just the right amount of comida for me.  The fries had that nice crispy factor going on. I added my secret stash of pink Himalayan salt to kick the flavor up a notch. 

Pretty much everything  is noticeably good quality from the vegetarian fed meat (didn't say grass fed) to the cheese to the what seemed to almost be house made ketchup. You can select free toppings from jalapeños, pickles, grilled onions, lettuce, tomato etc. For a nominal cost a cage free egg, avocado or bacon add on is all yours. Yes Siree! (No, not Siri!) They serve beer, wine, lemonade, coke in a bottle, coconut water and the usual fountain drinks. Bonus points if they someday switch to cane sugar craft sodas.

Happily, Super Burger saved the day ensuring I could continue to try to cram introducing my friends to all the quintessential city sights in one day...
author: Cyntia Q.

description:
Very juicy and tasty burgers 
Love the franc fries, so crisps 

Really love it







Really
author: Yaron G.

description:
Had breakfast at Super Duper on Chestnut this past Sunday. Awesome to be able to get something so delicious and well-made for under $10.00. Seriously, this location offers a breakfast deal for 7.00 and it is worth it. A better deal than any of the high priced chic upscale places and certainly way-better than any fast food joint. 

Hurray! Donuts have returned to Chestnut Street. You don't have to go all the way to the Marina Safeway for donuts anymore, Super Duper makes them fresh each day. And, they are delicious! 

Coffee was good, service was outstanding and friendly. Yes, I will return, especially for those yummy donuts.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Walked in a little after 10, the staff were really friendly, they took our orders and served us accordingly. Great prices for a great burger.. it was definitely messy, but what real burger isn't? I ordered the super-double with everything plus jalapeños, and requested for grilled onions. I paired it with the garlic cheese fries and oh man they were good. Will definitely be back when I do come back into town, I'm from the east coast.
author: Châu P.

description:
Super Duper! Best value for a premium fast food burger in the neighborhood! Their burgers are delicious and I'm never disappointed with the taste. 

I usually opt for a single 4oz patty with cheese. Very flat all beef patty, melted cheddar, and a soft bun make for a great burger. The fries are just okay here though. The garlic fries taste good but are way too oily and garlicy. The aftertaste doesn't go away for 24 hours whenever I have em.

Plenty of seating inside or outside, they have a little diner style layout. Service is usually friendly and prompt. Decent prices considering the area. Every other burger place in the marina is over $15 for a meal.

Food: 4.25/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Overall: 4.25/5
author: Brian G.

description:
I don't get why Super Duper doesn't get more hype because it's a great burger. I'm from Toronto and have tried the more talked about In-N-Out and Shake Shack burgers, and frankly, they don't really come close to the Super Duper burger. Friends from San Francisco introduced us to this place and we had:

- Burger with super sauce, cheese and bacon: I'm a big fan of burger meat that's ground fresh daily and you can really taste the difference in terms of the quality of Super Duper's patty - it was really juicy, had a good crumble-in-your-mouth texture to it, and defibitely not gainy. In addiction, the bacon was nice and crisp, there was just the right amount of cheese, toppings/garnishes were standard fare, and the bun didn't get soggy from this greasy delight. If I had one quibble, it's that the burger was a bit too salty for my taste. But flavour-wise, a definite hit.

- Double chocolate and chips shake: I was expecting it to be thicker/creamier but then realized it was made out of soft serve. I personally prefer ice cream, but that said, the shake definitely satisfied my sweet tooth as the chocolate flavour wasn't watered down and they had just the right amount of chips to give a good texture (and added chocolatey taste) to the shake. Also, this was a great counterbalance to the saltiness of the burger.

In addition, service was appropriately friendly and quick. And the place itself, while really busy, was clean and had a nice hang-out vibe to it. 

Overall, I would definitely come back to Super Duper. Maybe it doesn't get as much hype as In-N-Out or Shake Shack because of a more limited and straightforward offering, or a more low key approach. Whatever the case, it definitely isn't because of the burger itself, because that was outstanding. I'm from Toronto and my heart will always belong to Holy Chuck and it's daily-ground burgers over there. But when visiting the US, I'll skip the more hyped up burger joints and head straight to Super Duper the next time.
author: David Y.

description:
So good! Consistent with the other locations! I like that they have free pickles. Burger is always cooked right and so juicy. Fries are good, and they have a garlic option.

Casual dining with indoor and outdoor seating. I like to come here when it's a nice day and sit outside.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Nice burger place in the Marina district
Has both indoor and outdoor seating which is convenient when you have your furry friend with you.

Prices are pricey for burgers; my order was 2 mini burgers and fries and the total came to $17

The burger was very tasty, good quality meat. Fries were your average typical fries. 

They also offer soft serve and milkshakes here. 

Overall nice place to drop by if you are craving burgers and fries.
author: Michele G.

description:
After trying In-N-Out, I was on a mission to taste Super Duper.  Was it a better burger?  Is it a major competitor of In-N-Out?  Did I answer my own question? yes and yes.

I wasn't even hungry, but had to stop in.  Got the Super Duper (2 patties plain with cheese) $8.25 fries $2.75 and drink.  Some add on's are extra.  They have reg fries and garlic fries and 3 types of dips for your fries. I had regular.  They have a mini burger, shakes, cones, salads and veggie burger and chicken sandwich.

My burger was juicy and filling.  Enjoyed the meat more than that other chain..  BUT it was lacking in flavor.  I'm a plain eater so it may have needed the Super sauce, but when I asked my guy what he thought of his  "everything with sauce" burger, he said the same.  So that's that on the burger verdict.  Juicy, meaty, not big on flavor.

Fries were ok.  Same deal with in-n-out.  Not tender.  Maybe marginally better than you know where, but they didn't go down good.  I'm not a McD whore, but I have to say their fries are soooo much better.  

More like 3.5 stars since I don't consider myself a 'fan', but with a little help from salt (or seasoning) I could be...
author: Nancy L.

description: Great staff - super friendly and fast. First time having the veggie burger, and it was delicious! Very flavorful and cooked perfectly.
author: Grace C.

description: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to eat that wasn't outrageously expensive and this place was perfect. I got the garlic fries with a vanilla shake and he got the classic burger. Best shake I've ever had. The cheese on the garlic fries tasted like they came right off the block. And he said he felt like was tasting a burger for the first time. Very crowded but for a good reason. Wish there was one where I'm from. We'll come back when we're in town for sure.
author: Hannah J.

description: Phenomenal burgers! Freshest patty I've had on the real! Highly recommend and would also suggest getting the garlic fries.
author: Richard C.

description:
Wow, what a moneymaker, Fast Company cover in two years! 

Located on the main drag of Chestnut Street, this location, one of 10 now operating in the Bay Area, serves up super duper juicy burgers done just right.

Served medium well and offered in two sizes (the 4 oz patty or two patties for a double decker burger), pick your size, add bacon, cheese or avocado (the rest of the fixins like special sauce, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions on request) you order and pay at the register and grab your drinks at the self-serve soda station.

Seat yourself and soon your wax paper-wrapped bundle of greasy heaven arrives. 

Boy is it good!

They have fries, milkshakes, lemonade, ice tea, "the usual suspects" sodas plus beer on tap.

A steady line queued up in constant streams and was quickly cleared with people seated without waiting and served quickly afterward.

Super Duper has got their system down: The menu is simple and the service is partially self-serve and very streamlined. 

Service is expedient and friendly and prices are reasonable and in line with their quality, grass-fed angus beef (or chicken- they have chicken sandwiches too).

They're in the FiDi, the Mission, Castro, San Jose, Los Gatos, Novato and Mill Valley. 

I wish this vibrant, growing restaurant group all success: They have a great product and know how to execute with superior customer service.

A++
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Amazing burger place. Limited menu options but they still make you go wow.

Ordered - 
Vegetarian Burger : small quantity for $7, yet tasted yummy with avacado and cheese. The tomato ketchup stole my heart. Really fresh ingredients for a best and affordable price.
Ambience is cool, lil crowded but it's a well managed place.

Totally worth 5 stars.
author: Ajay C.

description: The burgers are pretty juicy and flavorful. I like that you can add a bunch of  sides to the burger for  free too. The first time I had this was at the Mill valley one. Their pickles were better. The pickles here were much stronger and sharp so I couldn't eat as many.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
We got takeout from here for our game of thrones watch party. I'm gluten free so I ordered a chicken sandwich without the bread. It was good! It didn't blow my mind, but I would order it again.

We also ordered the fries and I asked for it with the cheese, I thought it was a better option than getting the sauces for extra $$.

They also provide free picked which was really good and also their ketchup and mustard are good quality!

Would definitely come back when I need a chicken sandwich fix:). It would be even better if they offered a gf option bread, but I won't hold my breath.
author: Gita r.

description: My wife and I were looking on yelp for a place to have dinner and found super duper burger. It was our first time. We arrived and the line was out the door so we had high hopes. We ordered a super combo with garlic fries for me and I believe it was called the mini combo for my wife. We took our seats after getting ketchup and their homemade pickles. We got all our food hot and fresh, you do have to wait a little bit after ordering because everything is cooked to order but let me say it is well worth it. We munched on their pickles while we waited for our food. Everything was super duper delicious! The meat was fresh and juicy and the bun was perfect to hold everything together without getting soggy. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for affordable delicious food.
author: Cedric B.

description:
This place always appeals as a passerby-- busy, clean and aesthetically, the burgers and fries look appetizing. All the ingredients are fresh. The big BUT is that the burgers and fries are way too greasy, and the fries are served at room temperature. They have an open kitchen and I've sat at the counter three times to observe-- on all three occasions, my fries were sitting there for 5 minutes or more until served and not under a heat lamp (they don't have one). In other words, the fries are made in advance before your burger is ready instead of per order simultaneously. 

In order to be objective and write a fair review, I've given this place three attempts. Same results-- great shake, overly greased up burger and fries, and fries served at room temperature. I'm talking about drenched to the point that I'm going through several napkins in order to tame it down in the artery clogging department.
author: Alex B.

description:
Super Duper Burger, Oh Super Duper Burger. How I...like thee. Not love, just like. If you're going to get greasy food, it should come from better places than your typical fast food giants. That's where Super Duper comes in. There are a handful of locations throughout SF (mostly downtown), but I find myself at this one primarily.

The burgers actually aren't all that super big (or maybe they have just made the burgers smaller over the years), but the prices sure are super expensive. This is definitely one of those places that you have to specify if you want the meat well done or not (a couple times there was some pink still), and the lettuce gets soggy WAY too fast so if you're ordering to-go, just don't order lettuce at all or ask that they put it on the side. Avocado is a must to balance out the savory flavors. 

And now for the subject most people wait to hear about: The Fries. Well don't hold your breath because the fries are a joke, and anyone who 'raves' about the fries just doesn't have good taste. They just don't go well with the burgers and a few times they overcooked my fries. 

Milkshakes (not real ice cream, but soft serve) are pretty good but if you're ordering, have them wait to do the milkshake until AFTER the food is ready because it's no fun spoiling your appetite sucking down the milkshake they immediately make and serve because you're waiting for the food lol.
author: Marquis A.

description:
One of my favorite burger places in the city!

I always order the mini burger and garlic fries because you can't go wrong with garlic fries. Who cares about smelly breaths when the garlic fries here are heavenly???

Usually people order the combos they have on a stand that's located near the registers because you can get the burger of your choice, a side of fries, and a drink. It is a cheaper option if you do plan to get all three items. 

Their soft serve is also delicious. I've gotten it quite a few times and it just is really soft, like the name describes. Their milkshakes are also pretty rich and thick.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Friday, June 2nd, 2017. National doughnut day.

A lovely coworker decided to get the office two dozen donuts to celebrate the day. I walked in around 9am to the yummy surprise. She got all three mini donut flavors: Chocolate glaze, Cinnamon sugar, Sugar glaze. Being the glutton I am, I had one of each! My favorite was the cinnamon sugar. Reminded me of churros which I adore. Especially when still warm since it's crispy on the outside and soft inside. The other two were good as well. Even though I'm not big on chocolate, the donut didn't have a super thick glaze, so I didn't mind.

Fun way to celebrate national donut day. Even though I ate three doughnuts, they were mini, so I shouldn't feel guilty right? They can't be that many calories! Seriously, I do enjoy the donuts from Super Duper as I've had them on many occasions. I may be back to try the burgers at this location.
author: Elena N.

description: Please go back to postmates or offer a delivery option! (I'm pregnant and stuck at home with a sleeping toddler!)
author: Leia V.

description:
This was our second time here - this past weekend and it was just meh. The first time (maybe a year ago) I think the food was better. It's very expensive for burgers and fries. I have a pet peeve about ketchup too. Their ketchup is AWFUL. I have no idea where it comes from but EW.  It's think and has a metallic sweet taste. 

I like that you can sit outside in the fresh air and the service is friendly and fast. The burgers are good, but not spectacular. Get the garlic fries for sure. 

The bathroom was really dirty. I feel like Chestnut Street vibe is changing too - there were a lot of cops hanging around and there were noticeably few people for a Saturday afternoon. Some of the businesses we used to go to are now gone.
author: Wanda G.

description:
Bad service and will never go back here. I was in a long line waiting for my turn and a second register suddenly open, so I was next online to place an order and the cashier rudely ring the guy behind me. So I go to the register and ask him what was about, so he tell me that the guy had placed the order coming from the other door and when the guy (who cut) the line saw me talking to the cashier he started shouting and rise his middle finger. 
That is why I think it is horrible service and the cashier should have handled differently.
author: Keep I.

description: This place was FUEGO! I got a mini burger with an organic egg on top, egg was cooked perfectly. The Garlic fries actually tasted like garlic fries! What?! Anyway this place was fantastic, and it's a great  location in SF. Very clean. Excellent staff, very friendly and welcoming.
author: Alicia P.

description: Amazing I love the burgers and fries very fresh. Friendly service. Quick. Farmed vegetarian beef. The strawberry shake is so yummy. I saved this place as my favorite when im in SF next
author: Chris H.

description: I walked for this place all the way from Golden Gate Bridge last on Labor Day weekend. Burger is phenomenal. The fact that you can add whatever you want to it is solid. It does get pretty pricey pretty quick. I do recommend this place as long as you are OK dropping $15-25 for a burger w fries and soda. Give them a try.
author: Farzan M.

description:
I have been on a 'best burger hunt' for the past 2 months ... True story :P
Super Duper was the third place to try on my Bay Area  burger list and I was impressed. I tried the mini burger with avocado and it was really good ! The homemade pickles and fries are a delicious side dish and the meat itself was very very flavourful. It was also not too heavy after the meal so that was really nice! The staff was super friendly and the whole experience was great. I'll be back for sure and highly recommend it :)
author: Shivani B.

description:
Love their burgers.  The name says it all! We found them on market street a few years ago and discovered this location in one of our favorite communities.

This time - we had friends visiting from out of town.  They weren't too excited about going for "burgers"but accepted the idea because we had limited time (right before fireworks on 4th of July).  Some of our guests were vegetarian.  So..some ordered "regular" burgers and others had veggie burgers.  They loved it!  And...everyone enjoyed their burgers.

Thank u Super Duper!
author: Russ M.

description:
If you're going to call yourself "Super Duper", you're going to have to back it up. Super Burger? Maybe... Duper Burger? Probably. Super Duper Burger. I don't think so. 

I got their double burger with all the fixings, minus onions (because raw onions are gross). I also got their fries with the overpriced three dipping sauces. 

Everything was really greasy. Super duper greasy. As for flavor, the burger was too meaty (next time, stick to the single patty). The bun seemed flimsy, and the whole thing appeared on the brink of collapsing from the first bite, but never actually did. Not sure if that's saying something about the burger or my ability to hold it together, but there it is. 

The fries were disappointing. Greasy, luke warm and limp. Flavor-wise they were fine, but fries are two parts flavor, one part texture, and the texture was off. Plus the sauces were not worth the extra expense (mayonnaise, by itself should not be a "sauce" that you charge extra for). 

Overall, slightly better than a fast food burger (Burger King, Wendy's, etc.) but also more expensive and therefore more disappointing.
author: Denis S.

description:
I didn't think a fast food place would have good burgers but let me tell you about this juicy patty! The meat was high quality with just the right amount of fat. There is no additives to firm up the patty. When you bite into it, it just kinda falls apart in your mouth. Way better than any $13+ restaurant burger!

The strawberry milkshake was amazing! Then you spike it with some booze and it'll complete your night. Now it's not a lot of alcohol so don't expect to get buzzed from it.

The garlic fried are so aroma-full...i know it's not a word but it definitely will scare off vampires. Loaded with a lot of cheese. 

Can't wait to come back or find one closer to me!
author: Helen L.

description:
I was walking up and down looking for a place to grab something to eat quickly  & I saw this place and thought it would probably be all right but it was cheap and fast so I decided to get it. 

Well to my surprise it was delicious!! I ordered the veggie burger, and it the taste of reminded me very much of shake shack's portobello mushroom burger. It was fresh and super tasty, the only thing is it is very slightly fried, which I didn't expect. But I would 100% order this again when in the area again.

I also ordered the side salad and added avocado and portobello mushroom to it. Was a pretty decent size and they give you half an avocado. 

Didn't have any fries or a shake but they did look delicious as other people around me were eating them.
author: Nicole B.

description: To me this burger place is better than In n Out. Although it's on the expensive side...it's definitely worth the money. I would def come back and recommend my friends to go here.
author: Johnny H.

description: Great burgers- west coast version of shake shack. I'm giving it 4 because they only serve breakfast on weekends until 11am. They should extend that until at least 12!
author: Lady N.

description: We were in the city hanging out playing tourist when we came upon super Duper burgers.  We ordered a burger and fry's to split they're outstanding...wished I would have gotten an entire burger.  We will be back!
author: John T.

description:
Pickles...all the pickles you want, that's my kind of burger spot!

We stopped in for a cookies and cream milk shake and it did not disappoint. I have previously had their burgers at a different location and I really admire their hand made patties and perfectly seasoned burgers. 

The staff at this location weren't the most friendly and were giggling to each other while we stood and waited to place out order, not a huge deal but there is room for improvement.
author: Danielle P.

description:
I'm a fan! A little pricey for a burger that size (similar to Five Guys, but more expensive), but the taste and juiciness is real! If I could summarize Super Duper in one sentence: "It's what a burger should taste like." I recommend getting the super size (two patties). 

Oh, and the garlic fries are pretty good too. Definitely prefer those over the regular fries. They're $3.50.

The only thing that was off, was that they put my friend's receipt in the sauce on his bun...uuummm wtf? -___-
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Reminds me of 5 guys but on a more upscale, quality level with vegetarian fed cows. Nice comforting messy burger packed with free toppings, delicious!
author: Soolin W.

description: Super Duper Burgers is amazing! We were in the area, completely starving, and without any background information, decided to stop in. We cautiously ordered a breakfast sandwich, a chocolate donut, a hash brown, and coffee. We were pleasantly surprised - everything was delicious! We ended up leaving with a box of a dozen donuts to go. The service was friendly and efficient - we didn't have to wait too long for our order. We will definitely be back again! Apparently, there's a Super Duper Burgers opening up soon in nearby Concord, so we will definitely have to check that location out!
author: Irene L.

description:
Love the burgers.  A mini is way big enough for me but I know some of ya'll will want the double.   Get it with a variety of fixings like onion, mushroom or even jalapeño.  

Love the fries too but you gotta get em fresh.   Don't do delivery with the fries because by the time you get them, they are soggy and cold.  And who wants soggy and cold, right?
author: Marcus K.

description:
Super duper burgers are indeed super duper
They are super duper expensive too, but what can you do, no In N Out around here
The burgers are greasy but good
Fries are eh
Overall solid burger joint
author: Elton W.

description: Not sure what the hype about this place is. I thought the burger & garlic fries were OK, but I would not want to pay $15+ for this again. It was good, but not impressive like other people have said about this place.
author: rado l.

description:
Bad service and I am not coming back any more.
It's Garlic Fries were served at room temperature two consecutive times, so obvious the cheese were never melted.
author: Osama H.

description: I was craving burgers and I always passed by the marina location. I decided to stop to get food to go. The workers are friendly. The price are reasonable for the area as well. I enjoyed my burger, definitely beats In-n-out burgers. My garlic fries was crispy.
author: Diana N.

description: We were here 3 years ago and can still remember how amazing your burgers were.  It took a little searching but we found you again.  And again....your burgers were amazing!!  Its definitely the meat but you can taste the love too...after all, the secret ingredient is ALWAYS love.  Had the garlic fries....I will taste those all day.  Gum isn't even taking away the garlic smell but it was worth it.  Our meal came with a sugar donut.  It was a nice touch.  Can you come to L.A. and open a place there?  We will be back of we're ever passing thru again.  Staff... you are all so nice and genuinely look like you are enjoying your jobs and work well as a team.
author: Lynette M.

description: Super duper yummy burgers! The burgers is pretty good for a fast food chain. Much better than in&out burgers and shake shack for the ppl that's in the east coast. Had the mini cheeseburger and garlic fries, both were delicious.
author: Christina L.

description:
The very first reason Super Duper deserves 5 stars is because they were the very first of many establishments to open after the huge power outage last week.  It was close to 4pm and having driven from Sacramento on an empty stomach, I was on the verge of getting hangry. Not only was Super Duper open, we anticipated a long wait due to the long line and tables still waiting for their food. However, we were lucky enough to find a table and food was brought to us in no more than 10 minutes. While in line, a regular showed me the ropes and told me about the self serve jarred pickles. Huge shout out to him because I loooooove pickles and I totally would have missed it if he hadn't warned me! Shh, I went back for thirds. But only because I was sharing. :)

Like I said, I was hungry so I ordered the works! A mini burger with combozola blue cheese, a fried egg and sliced mushrooms with garlic fries and a beer.  Ok I lie, I'd order the works on the regular, whether or not I was hungry. That's the only way foodies know how! Anyway, if I had to choose between In and Out, Shake Shack and Super Duper........that would be the utmost torture. No, nevermind, not even going there. I'm not going to make that choice if I don't really have to.  It's just that good! 

I also must add, management is great at this location. It was a bit chaotic but the lady at the register was calm, patient and knew to how to keep the pace going at the same time. My burger was also presented with a smile, literally! Check out my photo. Thumbs up!
author: Yvonne N.

description: I eat a lot of burgers -- I love em! It's the most American thing I do. Maybe I recently had a really good burger elsewhere, or maybe the cooks were having a bad day. All I can say, is that I was unimpressed with my visit this time (not my first time at the rodeo). I order the Super burger combo: double patty burger cooked medium well, fries, and a coke. It was good, but there was nothing spectacular. There's been times where I'm sad when I finish my burger someplace; this was not one of those times. Overall, good for a quick bite and if you're craving a decent burger, but I wouldn't be overly excited about coming here again. Does that sound harsh? Maybe. Give this place a try and be the judge.
author: Roberto E.

description:
This is a great place to find lunch, everything is ORGANIC! fresh home-made pickles home-made donuts (that are to die for!) and great burgers.

Would definitely recommend this place to friends!

Oh and the fries are cooked and salted perfectly!
author: Michael P.

description:
So there are a couple of these in the city - this one is next to the Tipsy Pig... I go in during an odd weeknight on a rainy evening an hour before closing time.

My first time. I'm greeted with high ceilings, some woodwork, two counter/bar areas - one with a view out the window the other toward the grill. Toward the back are tables for large groups.

Music plays just loud enough to keep anybody over 40 years old out. Tourists, regulars and bar goers are here. 

I order the smaller burger combo. Grab a self serve soda as I wait. Although I didn't try it I noticed a real ice tea option. That is something I would normally drink so I appreciated that - I just wanted the sugary cola this night.

The place has few patrons so I get my burger super fast. Its different - this is no Nations burger. The bun has a little something substantial that you can bite into... but still... you could give this to grandma and her dentures wouldn't pop out. Don't worry about though - remember the music a touch louder than what people over 40 would care to hear? She wouldn't be in here anyway.

The meat itself was juicy just as expected. It was cooked just perfectly too. I didn't make any special requests and it had a touch of pink - beautifully done... not cooked to death.

The ketchup had a different flavor from the normal Heinz. Neither good nor bad. Just different. The sauce on the burger different too.... I wish I had tried one of their homemade pickles... the whole theme with this burger spot was that its unique and great.

I see people here on Sunday mornings under the covered patio. Probably a great alternative to waiting for 2 hours at Mommas for weekend brunch. Would like to try their breakfast.

Again, for the time I went and what I ordered 5 stars easily. The 2-3 guys working top notch. Squeeky clean bathroom. Excellent value, especially for this neighborhood. I'm sure even during a busy time the guys working here would push out food in as timely a manner as possible and you can grab a beer while you wait.

If your a senior bring some ear plugs :)
author: Stefan T.

description: Yesterday my boyfriend and I visited this restaurant for the first time.  The food came out perfectly and was way better than we expected ! Our cashier was so attentive and welcoming.  I didn't catch her name but I believe her name was Gabriela if I'm not mistaken.  She described everything on the menu to me perfectly and waited very patiently for me to decide what i wanted , as I am a very picky eater and so indecisive wherever I go to eat . She even caught me walking out after emptying my trey to advise me to have a good rest of my day.  I have no room to complain the food was fresh and the service was great . This is a place I would revisit and encourage others to visit as well.
author: Camille M.

description:
The quality isn't all that bad, but let's be real. This is an outrageously priced burger and it doesn't taste that much better than one from regular fast food places. And just because the ingredients are "locally sourced" doesn't make this magically more healthy.

Edit: I am a fan of their breakfast sandwiches and donuts tho. too bad they stop serving those at 11.
author: Eric W.

description: The best burgers in the world!!!! Thank you for the good service you guys are the best! You need to try it if you are in SF.
author: Stacie W.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here after spending a day at the Palace of Fine Arts. We had been once before, but had had very high expectations after our friends told us Super Duper had the best burgers they had ever tasted. We left a little disappointed. This time, our expectations were set somewhat lower, but our satisfaction was much much higher! 

We each ordered the Super Duper and fries. 
The burgers were great! They were made right in front of us (cool restaurant setup) and were served to us fresh off the grill. The burgers were juicy, filling, reasonably priced, and had a really good flavor.
The fries were not as good-- just fried frozen potatoes. They're the reason I'm holding back that fifth star; they were alright, but didn't quite match the quality of the burgers. 

I'm really glad we gave this place another try. The burgers were amazing and I'm excited for Super Duper to open a location in Berkeley, hopefully with fresh fries ;-)
author: Julianna W.

description:
Update: 7/2/2018

To his credit, manager Kenn F. got back to me very quickly after I posted my review.

When I declined his offer of a gift card, he was very reasonable and issued a refund for the two meals via our credit card. He was even gracious enough to state that he appreciated the feedback.

I've updated my rating from 0 stars to 2, b/c he was a professional.
author: Amanda W.

description:
As a person who absolutely loves burgers and is picky as hell, I was eager to try Super Duper Burgers after my friend hyped it up so much. The location was really nice and there was adequate parking, so right from the start, the experience was nice. The cashier was really friendly when we ordered and did a good job selling me on the 4 cheese burger and I never order cheeseburgers.
Man, my burger was pretty delicious. The cheese just oozed out of it, although the bleu cheese made me a bit sick since I'm not a fan of bleu cheese, but it was still quite enjoyable. I really enjoyed all of the flavors and the juiciness of the burger. It was just right. The fries were really good fresh out of the fryer too. The whole thing was a bit messy but well worth it. Highly recommend!
author: Jenn T.

description:
Super Duper Burgers lives up to their super name! I must admit that in a span of three days, I ate here three times. I had dinner one night (super combo), had breakfast the following day and a super combo again the next day. It's addicting, I'm not even gonna lie. 

The super combo comes with fries and a drink (I got the swirl shake, which was good and had a bit of a malty texture), and the burger comes with double patties and cheese. If you order it with everything, then they add red onions, lettuce and tomatoes. You can also add (for free) jalapeños, grilled onions and pickles. If you like pickles, definitely get their homemade pickles. Even if you don't like pickles, try them. They're really good. 

I really want to know what they do to their burgers. They're soooo juicy! Like ridiculously juicy. I had burger juice dripping all over my hands and it was amazing. It wasn't juicy like from fat because it didn't feel greasy, so that's great. I ate my burger over my fries so they'd soak up some of that amazingness. 

Their breakfast is good and super affordable. For $5.50 you can get an egg sandwich on an English muffin, a mini donut and a drip coffee. For a couple of dollars more, you get to add bacon or sausage to your sandwich and you get two extra mini donuts. Of course, I got the "deluxe" combo and got bacon on my sandwich - because, bacon. Their sandwich was yummy and I stuffed in some of their pickles for umami perfection. Their mini donuts are really good. Fluffy with a lightly fried exterior and I preferred the chocolate glazed over cinnamon coated. 

Overall, everything was great. I always stopped by the Marina location because they were opened the latest from all the other locations, which best suited my needs. 

Thank you SDB for ruining other burgers for me and please consider opening a location in LA so you can show them what a juicy burger is.
author: Jonnathan B.

description: The burgers are incredibly fresh and cooked perfectly. I had the chicken sandwich. Ciabatta was soft, chipotle aioli was delicious and chicken was tender and juicy. The garlic fries are excellent and the homemade ketchup was a great touch. Take all the dill pickles you want.
author: Julia P.

description:
If you've read my last review of Super Duper you'll know that I'm definitely a fan of their burgers and the consistency behind them. What I didn't know until this past weekend is that they serve breakfast sandwiches too. Amazing. 

I was on my way to a completely different restaurant on Saturday when I saw the breakfast sandwich menu which stopped me in my tracks. I'm a sucker for an english muffin sandwich and wasn't terribly hungry so, this was a perfect stop. The menu has three different combos where are all super reasonably priced ($5, $6, $7) and they all include a cup of four barrel coffee. I mean, brilliant. Our local chain of burgers (Super Duper) has partnered with my favorite coffee roaster on planet earth...mind blown. 

Pro tip: The cup of coffee is only $2.25 making it the cheapest/best cup of coffee in the Marina. 

On to the sandwich. Nothing crazy, pretty basic but, fresh and flavorful. You can customize it to your liking and I opted for bacon and avocado which were solid choices. I opted out of the donut that comes with most of the combo meals and that was a huge mistake. Needless to say I'll totally be back for the combo soon.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
* Disclaimer: I originally gave them 2 stars... but I think they were having a bad day.

-----------------------------------------------------

When you name yourself Super Duper, you are totally setting yourself up because with such an egotistic name, people will expect something that is not just super, but super duper. I sure did... sigh... 

I mean, it's not as bad as places that have lame banners saying that they were "voted-#1-burger-in-the-city" or that plaster their interior décor saying that they were "voted best by the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel" like the arrogant bastards at Five Guys. But like an overhyped movie, Super Duper Burger felt more like a Super Dupey Burger... and in my case a Super Salty Burger. 

So contrary to its name, my experience with Super Duper Burger was anything but super duper. The main issue that I had was that whoever cooked my mini-cheeseburger overseasoned it with way too much salt to the point that it was super duper salty. After just a few bites, I needed to refill my soda because I could feel my kidneys failing.

Maybe it is because I went with the mini-cheeseburger, but I observed no "juicyness" to my burger as Super Duper claims. They claim that their burgers are juicy because their cows are fed vegetarian diets etc etc etc... But yea, my burger was dry. Then again, maybe all the salt in my burger dried it out the way salt shrivels up snails. 

As for the fries - wait for it - they were also overseasoned. Too much freaking salt. Tossed them after eating only a handful.

The best part of the meal had to be the not-so-salty pickles. The bonus being that they are complimentary. 

For being in The City the prices aren't too bad. And I suppose if you like salty food, you will like this place. 

However, I can't really say that my experience was supercalifragilisticexpialidocious. More like dociousaliexpilisticfragicalirupes or supersaltyfreakingmakingmethirstyatrocious.
author: Richard K.

description: Excellent burger and garlic fries! That's all there is to say! This place was great!!
author: Brittni B.

description: Went back to the Marina location a couple days ago, and I'm happy to say the burger was just as good as the last time I was here. The burger was juicy and the garlic fries were hot. I dare say you don't need to spend upwards of $14 to $20, if you include tips at some other restaurant. Just go to Super Duper in the "Marina."
author: Anthony W.

description:
Awesome burgers!!! 
My boyfriend and I come here all the time as we live walking distance from this place and each time we walk by we say how we can't wait to go back. 

I get the cheeseburger which is juicy and cooked just right (who wants to get an over cooked burger, not me!) These burgers Melt in your mouth with the cheese. The fries are great also, Tasting fresh but also with salty goodness! To top it off the milkshakes are heaven! I suggest the half chocolate and half vanilla. 

I normally opt for the burger here but thought I'd be Adventurous and try the chicken sandwich. It was great! Normally chicken sandwiches are dry but I didn't find that here.

Lastly, the staff are always very kind and friendly! Quick service!

Highly recommend!
author: Kayli G.

description:
OMG
I was craving a burger like crazy.
Super Duper on Chestnut turned out to be the perfect call.

I ordered what they call the "mini" burger.  

4 oz. patty.

I'm a girl.

With the works, though.  Lettuce, onion, tomato, pickles...
Wait.
I think there were pickles.  
There must have been, right?
I ate the whole thing so fast that I can't say for certain.
Don't quote me on the pickles.
And I added bacon & cheddar.

I have to say, this burger was all juicy & delicious goodness.  It turned what had been, up until then, a very generic, black & white kind of day into a bright, vivid, technicolor kind of one.

That's pretty hokey to say, I know.  
But it's true.

This could be the best chain burger at this price point in the city.  

Props for having kid size shakes.  Sometimes an adult (I mean me) really wants a shake, but doesn't want to commit to a whole one, for chrisakes.

Kid size.  Genius.

Since this was a no french fries supper for me, I can't comment on those as of yet.

I'm trying to avoid potatoes. 
And, yes.  I know I had a croissant today for breakfast.
Avoid potatoes (starch, which means sugar), but eat pastries?!
Yep.
Explanation that's logical?  
Nope.
I'm a girl, remember?

Mini burger w everything, plus bacon & cheddar.  
$6.50.

Great deal.  Great burger.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
One of my favorite places to get a burger! Consistently high quality and delicious.

I got the super burger with cheese ($8.50). It has this amazing super sauce on it and the meat is so juicy and savory. They also sell mini burgers ($6 w/ cheese) with only one patty instead of two which might be a better option if you're not as hungry. 

I'm a huge fan of their garlic fries ($3.25) that are completely covered with garlic and cheese. It's up there with some of the best fries I've ever had. I also got their vanilla ice cream dipped cone ($4) which was coated with a thick layer of chocolate. 

Overall if you're craving a burger in the Marina, this is the place to go! It's not as cheap as In-N-Out but the quality is well worth it.
author: Linda X.

description:
One of the best cheeseburgers I ever had and the cheese and garlic fries were perfect. The outdoor setting really added to the ambiance.
I didn't know it was a chain but I will definitely be going back next time I'm in the area.
author: Michael A.

description: I really appreciate the great customer service I received after posting my last review - happy to say that after returning last night, I enjoyed a great chicken sandwich (red-meat free!).
author: Catherine S.

description:
Good tasting....the first time. I liked it here for a bit, the burgers were tasty. I am a local to SF, so I have gone with friends. After about my second time coming here I started to notice something. I was getting horrible cramps for hours, followed by diarrhea who's volocity could only be rivaled by Niagara Falls or an industrial grade power washer. I was surprised, not originally connecting the food to these symptoms. Later, after having my third meal here, I talked to all my friends about my symptoms. They had all experienced the same thing after our last outing to Super Duper. If you think this is your only option on Chestnut, you are wrong. There are  many healthier options like Blue Barn, or anything else.
Good Luck.
author: Gigi S.

description:
I went here because it has Zagat or Yelp ratings so I thought this must be a good burger joint. The burgers are GREASY..Yeah way to greasy for me. My fries were cold. This is what I remember as my experience. I mean the service was fast and friendly. The place is crowded, but the food was not good. It seems people enjoy it so try it out for yourself...

As for the environment. It is in a great location. There is seating both indoors and outdoors.

 2nd visit - I don't understand how this place has a 4 star rating. This place is packed with people too. Either this must be these peoples 1st visit to this place or they have never had a really good burger!  I decided to give this place another shot. It is close to my house and I was being lazy. I talked myself into going by saying 'Maybe I was disappointed because I had the mini (4oz) burger the last time. If I get the super burger it might be more enjoyable.' NOPE...I ordered the burger and all it was was bigger. The hamburger seems to be 'gooey' like it isn't cooked. I took a few bites and it has literally has the consistency of the hamburger you use to form a hamburger patty prior to it being cooked.  This made me think back to the saying they have posted under the menu when you walk in- Our burgers are juicy so they may be messy- something to that effect. I wouldn't say they are juicy, but the hamburger is a mess and not a good one. The meat has no flavor. You can't even taste any freshness in the meat. They do use cheddar cheese as I could identify this flavor.

No improvement in the fries- Cold.. I won't be going back and if you haven't tried this place save your money for a really good burger a little farther down on Chestnut!
author: Angela M.

description: Not worth the value. $7 for a crappy veggie burger. They actually ruined 10 years of vegetarianism for me by putting BACON in my veggie burger accidentally. I will never go here again or recommend it to anyone.
author: Katherine C.

description: Top 5 Burger joints in the Bay Area region. Food is prepared to perfection. Highly recommended by locals.
author: Jose R.

description:
Not my first choice, but I'm glad I stopped here. I was impressed with the quality of this cheeseburger. Very well assembled, very tasty burger, lots of cheese on it and the fries were cooked perfectly. A limited choice of beers, but they had beer and really, that's what counts. After all this walking, I needed it!

The joint is just too small for the crowds here. I was fortunate to get a good table outside under the awning which was helpful. Other people looked a bit lost as they tried to find a spot.

I'd have a Super Duper Burger again. It was definitely super!
author: Bruce K.

description:
Boyfriend and I decided to try this place after bickering about how he thinks Habit is better when he did not even try Super Duper!

I have tried Super Duper a multiple times, but the only thing stopping me from coming here too often is that I think it is a bit pricey for a small burger. However, the burger is sooo yummy! Their patty tastes so good and it's super juicy. Fries are ok but yet again, pricey.

I would give it a 4 star but it's a 3 because I asked one of the girl for a side of ranch and when she tried to hand it to me, she spilled it on her finger, and accidentally dipped a small part of her finger in it...and had the audacity to ask me if it's ok or if I want a new side of ranch.... I was like...?????!!!!! FOREAL?

She ended up giving me a new side of ranch because I was grossed out about it but cmon... did you really have to ask me that..? Now I can't stop thinking about what they do with other food if they ever drop it or something...hm
author: Elaine C.

description: I've visited here a few times now, the burgers are nice and juicy and very flavorful every time I've had them, and the staff has always been super friendly. Also, the donuts they serve in the morning are to die for - the classic glazed one is my all time favorite!!
author: Sonya H.

description: Super Duper is dangerously close to my apartment, so it has become one of my favorite spots to satisfy a burger craving. I love how juicy theirs are, and the toppings are just right. I'm also a big fan of the fries (definitely better than In-n-Out's) but you have to get the three dips with them!! The shakes are on my list to try :)
author: Holly L.

description:
Seriously,  two things:

a) This was a seriously good burger. 
b) I'm now daydreaming about garlic fries. Why do we not have garlic fries in Australia? Its a travesty!

I found this place while traipsing around the Marina via Yelp. Did not disappoint. I love that I could get a mini (1 patty) cause usually 2 patties is OTT for me. A+++ Best burger I've had this trip so far!
author: Zvezdana O.

description:
Great burgers! Service was friendly and the tables were cleaned and wiped down often. 
Our garlic fries could've been more garlicky.
author: Liz N.

description: I just keep coming back...I have tried most of the other "must-have" burgers in the marina, but for me this burger would be my choice hands down, every time.  Besides the price point they serve some pretty solid beer choices, serve the food fast...and those pickles...ER MER GERD.
author: Mike R.

description: my son's love this place & the service is awesome! Byron, Ken, Laura & the crew are so nice & friendly we are there sometimes twice a week! thanks team SD!
author: Hank M.

description:
I'm pretty bummed to be lowering my rating to 3-stars. Let me be very clear... I'm a fan of Super Duper Burgers and the restaurant group behind this chain. These guys have the Midas touch. Every restaurant they open turns into culinary gold (eg Lolinda, Starbelly, Beretta, Uno Dos Tacos, etc.). 

That's why my recent Super Duper visit was such a disappointment. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't a bad burger. But they completely botched my order, and I was literally the only one waiting in line (so it wasn't like the kitchen was slammed or anything).

I was particularly hungry this day, so I opted for the Super Burger (Two 4 oz. patties, with Super Sauce) to go and requested all the toppings (lettuce, tomato, onions, jalapeños, pickles, etc.). What I like about Super Duper is that they cook all their burgers to-order, so you know you're getting something hot off the grill. 10 minutes later, my sandwich was ready and I was on my way out the door. Unfortunately, I was already on the road when I unwrapped my burger, only to discover that my burger had none of the toppings I requested. It was just 2 over-salted beef patties, a wilted piece of lettuce, and a tomato. No secret sauce, no condiments, no pickles, no flavor.. nothing. By the time I discovered how dry and barren my burger was, it was too late for me to drive back. Not sure how the kitchen botched this one. Perhaps something was off with their POS system. I don't know. 
At the end of the day, it was just $8 out of my pocket (so not a huge loss). That being said, there are plenty of enticing burger options in the market right now. For example, I could've easily gone to In 'N Out and ordered a Double-Double (animal-style) for half the price. So yeah, I was a little bummed out by my burger experience. I'm going to chalk it up to them just having an off-day (which we all have). And I will definitely give them another try down the road.
author: Kevin B.

description:
My burger may not have been the best but it wouldn't discourage me from trying the place again.
Menu was easy to read and understand.  I purchased a Super Duper Burger which includes all the basic works, two 4oz patties and I added bacon and cheese at an additional cost.
The burger was good but the amount of grease that was dripping off the burger was a bit much. I'm not opposed to grease (and it's to be expected on a burger) but being able to collect it on a plate is another level. 
The fries were really good and they either use a ketchup that I've never tasted before or they make their own. 

Give it try!

Super Duper Burger, fountain drink and fries ($15.01)

Pros: Good ingredients, cook to order, fast, friendly staff
Cons: Gressy, drink selection, variety
author: Miguel M.

description: Great Tasting Burgers even the pickles, jalapenos and ketchup are on point. Only reason why i dont give it 5 stars is due to the amount of grease the burgers have. Burgers are so delicious and I love their ketchup.
author: Realize B.

description:
A friend turned me on to Super and I have to say, I was surprised by how much I enjoyed the burger. It was amazingly fresh.

4 instead of 5,  because of a few things: 1. the pickle situation, like it's the only thing they don't put on the burger for you. Inserting oneself, especially how they are sliced, it sloppy. 2. A lack of non sugar alternative drinks. Soda or milkshakes are pretty much the choices.
author: Bulldog W.

description:
Super Duper all around! We had mini-burgers (they're quarter-pounders!) and fries and they were awesome! The quality of the patty here is really good, juicy and obviously fresh. The topping choices are great. I love blue cheese, but don't usually get it on a burger because it overwhelms everything else. Problem solved here: the blue is Cambazola, mild and melty and perfect.

The other toppings were very fresh, and those pickles! They are serve-yourself from a pickle jar, so you're given the opportunity to fully load up. Take that opp; the slightly-sweet, not-too-sour, extra crunchy pickles make a great addition to your burger or a palate cleanser in between bites.  

Fries were great, and we had a side of the chipotle sauce which was an excellent addition. The spice level on the sauce was just right, enough to give the fries some zing but not so much that it killed your taster for that wonderful burger. 

This was a great stop. Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Patties were greasy
French fries were afew pieces for $2.75
Typical sf style
We came here out of desperate for food

Patties were greasy
French fries were afew pieces for $2.75
Typical sf style
We came here out of desperate for food
author: GQ G.

description: This place rocks!! Great customer service...they misplaced our order and immediately the manager took care of it and gave us a gift card!  It was unnecessary but quite a nice surprise.  The beef is amazing...cows are vegetarian fed and the beef is ground DAILY...HUGE DIFFERENCE!! THEY also HAVE GREAT VEGETARIAN BURGERS TOO!!! ALL ORGANIC AND THE PICKLES ARE TO DIE FOR.
author: Cali M.

description: Super Duper Burger was pretty super. Great quality lots of food, very filling. Seating is tough. We scored an outdoor table, which was fantastic to people and dog watch. :)
author: Veronica G.

description: Came here last weekend from Sacramento annnd I was so excited! The line was out the door but it only took about 10 minutes to get to the cashier. Took about 15 minutes for us to get our burgers. Even though finding a place to sit was a bit of a challenge, it wasn't a hassle. A small burger, double cheese burger and garlic fries came up to about $15 which is pretty good. The burger tasted fresh and juicy. Then the fries were nice and crispy! Everything was amazing! Will definitely come back next time I'm in sf!
author: Alex L.

description: Where to start I'll start with the donuts  man they are delish will melt your mouth once you try them they are freshly made everyday not too sweet just right! The burger was great everything was fresh tasting the fries were bomb too I'm def going back staff was friendly clean place great job !!!
author: Eve G.

description:
Are the burgers really that super-duper that you can never take phone orders during dinner time? Every other burger place in Marina answers the phone. 

I just don't understand it. I always have to order from other places because the last ten times I've tried to order I get the playback message..... "We're super sorry! but we're super busy!" 

Take online orders. Do something. I want to eat a super burger thing.
author: Alex P.

description:
The place is small but it is lively and they have an outdoor patio. My family and I can see the cooks do their creation on their burgers. It was very fun to watch while were waiting. I don't how long our orders got here but there were 5 orders and it felt it came in just 5 minutes or so. I got normal French fries which was amazing because it was not too salty but it had a little bit of salt. Felt like I got the right kind of French fries I wanted. My choices for my burger is a super burger with cheese with lettuce, red onions, and tomatoes with a finishing touch of an organic egg. This was the best lunch I ever had that day. When I ate the burger, it felt like melted in my mouth. I applaud to those who worked so hard that they to give the best food and service. Thank you and I hope to visit again in another time!

Sorry, trying to get my photo on.
author: Joshua L.

description:
Pretty tasty! You order at the counter, and then grab your seat. Condiments, napkins, etc. are located on the wall.

The burgers tasted fresh, well made, of decent size. The garlic fries were pretty good as well, and everything was fairly priced.

We made it just before a lunch rush, so there wasn't a wait for us, but by the time we left, the line was peaking out the door.
author: Michelle H.

description: Best greasy thin pattied burger in the bay area. Love the pickles they have to offer and also a plus being able to add a farm fresh egg or cambazola cheese.
author: N K.

description: So, we have had their burgers by food services delivered many times. Delivery from Super Duper, or and burger place is not optimum by far. Delivery food in general can be hit, or miss. However, we have always had a good experience getting our burgers in house nice and hot! I think Super Duper Burgers are great! As well if you have any issues with bad food services that failed on delivering a proper order from SD. They will take care of you! We received food vouchers worth over what our delivered meal had cost us. Thanks SD!
author: Kirk M.

description: Ain't nothin' better in the Bay  (Seriously. When I want a burger, I only get SuperDuper.) Every time someone comes to visit, I always take them to my fave burger joint, and it's even become a tradition of mine to have it before every Giants game at the Market stop. Juicy, fresh, uh, so delicious I finish it in less than 5 minutes, and although it's usually hella busy they're pretty fast and honestly it's always worth the wait!!!
author: Justine K.

description:
Good. Fast. Greasy. Yummy.

Parmesan Fries: Fresh garlic on fries with a delicious shredded cheese.
Super Duper Burger: Two patties. Moist, had a good texture. Loved the special signature sauce. Cheesy.
House Pickles: Fresh and yummy and free!

Only 12 dollars for all of the above!
author: Chelsea B.

description: Great needed a good meal from the neighborhood. Fresh everything loved the hot pickles. Burgers and fries at a great price!
author: Venese D.

description: The were the best tasting organic burgers I have ever had.  The meat was juicy and delicious. The crisp apple wood bacon and sharp cheddar cheese were were dancing the tango of flavors in my mouth. The lettuce was good greens not cheap iceberg. I'm very impressed with this establishment. The owners seemed to be in tune with current consumer demand.  Great quality food at a fair price.
author: Sam P.

description: Great place to eat a burger. Superb customer service. The quality of the food can't be any better. This is my place to go whenever I want a juicy, big, and tasty burger. Byron, the manager took good care of me. He is a true professional.  Five stars for sure!
author: JDiego S.

description:
With all the upscale and trendy restaurants lining Marina's Chestnut Street, you just can't go wrong with a simple burger with all the traditional fixings! We came here for lunch on a typical Thursday, but the line out the door made it seem like it's always Friday night here! Thankfully the line goes by fast and the cashiers help to move it efficiently, yet are still kind and helpful with you. 

While there is limited seating indoors and the order area is tight, the menu board is clearly visible even from outside the door and there is plenty of seating outside, which is what we did.

Our food came out fairly fast, and the cheeseburger I had was melt in your mouth delicious and not overly greasy. The best part of my meal however was ordering their GARLIC FRIES. Not too strong in flavor, not greasy or messy at all, it was the perfect portion and actually had passersby noticing it and wanting some themselves!

Overall, this place certainly puts the Super Duper not only in their burgers, but in their service, prices, and clean atmosphere. :)
author: Kyrie S.

description:
I feel a little bad in saying that I really wasn't feeling Super Duper.. don't hate me. Firstly, my Husband and I were overcharged, then when we pointed it out we also realized they had got our order completely wrong and then they overcharged us again. Once we thought all was ok (expect for being charged more than we should have been which we let slide) we sat down and waited for our food only for it to arrive and find out that our order was wrong again. Whatever, we wasn't going to cause a fuss.

In the end I had the smaller of the Burgers plus Cheese and my Husband the larger Burger plus Cheese and Bacon with one side of Fries to share which totaled $28 or so. The general consensus was that the Burgers really were not all that and lacked seasoning, my Husband also didn't appreciate that to have his cooked Medium was not an option, everything is well done. 

Everything is open plan and you can see into the Kitchen (a + for me) and seating is limited. Complimentary Pickled are located next to the Soda machine.
Sadly, I doubt I will return.
author: Emmalouise B.

description:
Fresh, fried on the grill beef. Homemade buns, leaf lettuce, fancy housemade ketchup, medium-thick cut fries and excellent shakes. 
A solid burger experience.
author: Boyo I.

description:
I'VE NEVER HAD A SUPER DUPER BEFORE.. there is one location at a food court in San Jose, but I was skeptical of it. My cousins have pointed it out the last time I was in the Marina. 

It was so good. I loved the bun, it isn't like a typical bun from IN-N-OUT (typical but soggy, even though I love it there), or FIVE GUYS (typical), this had a bit of crisp and oomph to it. 

Now the cashier was totally sweet and genuine and whether he is paid or not: at least he doesn't make up stuff (like at Smitten to get a tip), so I tipped and I came here first. He was super nice and helpful: totally good vibes.

I got the mini burger which is the right size for high cholesterol. I got Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions (everything on the left side anyways), and avocado for $1. The avocado wasn't cold, it was warm: it was good, but not what I'm used to be honest.

But I would definitely do a do-over here again.
author: Lilian L.

description: Update : So even though the food was crap last year when I went, the customer service is great from Kenn !
author: Desiree J.

description:
Used to be good but has completely gone down hill. Burgers are dry, over cooked and way over salted. Don't bother with cheese because it's calories/fat with zero taste. Last time, and my last time, I ate half and threw it away because it was inedible. 

From 1 Star to 4. Really nice of the manager to send us coupons after a few disastrous meals. The lesson is that Super Duper is good when you eat there, but awful when you use a delivery service. Will continue to go in person because food is decent and service was surprisingly outstanding.
author: Nancy R.

description: I love this place. Love the special burger and their chicken sandwich. You can add bacon to your burger or double up on the patty or both!! Their chocolate milkshake is decadent. Definitely gonna be a regular here
author: Ashmita V.

description:
Holy smokes!  Went here the other day for the first time for lunch and boy am I glad I did.  This is my new SF lunch spot.  Everything from the meat, to the ice cream is organic.  Except for the ketchup (more on that later).  I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was the best ckn/sanmiche I have ever eaten, hands down!  Customer service was great as well.  

Now the ketchup. Super Duper Burgers being mostly organic, I was surprised to learn that they were using Heinz Ketchup.  This ketchup has lots of very dangerous chemicals in it.  On top of that, Heinz's tomatoes are 100% GMO.  NOT GOOD!  Had I known this before I ordered my French fries, I would of not ordered them. But speaking with one of the employees, he told me that they make a special organic sauce for dipping fries in.  So I will try that next time.  But definitely at all cost, stay away from Heinz ketchup.  I hope Super Duper trashes Heinz and gives us customers a more healthy organic ketchup.  Looking forward to my next visit.  6's.

Update:  I have been meaning to update this review for awhile now.  I went back to Super Duper a couple of months after my first vist.  To my surprise, I noticed that they changed their ketchup from the poisonous Heinz, to an all organic, non GMO ketchup (Sir Kensington's Ketchup).  Very healthy, and tasty.  Huge difference in taste, and even looks like real tomato ketchup.  It has texture!  Not a creamy paste.  I must have eaten there a hundred times since.  Thank you Super Duper for listening to your customers and giving us a healthier choice.  You really are SUPER!
author: Michael G.

description:
I ate here for the first time after running the San Francisco marathon on July 23rd. I loved everything about it, and it was the perfect lunch for after the race!

Everything is organic, and I'm pretty sure this place had one of the best veggie burgers in the city. The sauce they put on it is so good! The milkshakes are also amazing. I only noticed after I ordered that you could get them spiked, and I'll definitely be doing that next time!
author: Melissa R.

description: Horrible... ordered a Super Duper with Bacon. I guess it was my fault because I didn't actually request that they cook the bacon!!!! It was raw bacon on this $12 burger that I had to throw away. I tried calling, but no answer.... I guarantee that the health department will be taking my call.
author: Joel D.

description:
Their super burger was really good. The bacon was better than expected too. Thick and juicy. Not the thin, half inch kind that most put on.  The cookies and cream shake coulda been better...

$30 for two super burgers (2 patties), bacon and one shake. Kinda steep, yea?
author: Joshua F.

description: This is how fast food should be done. This place is run with military precision. The flat top burger is smashed for that extra crispy crust. Simple and fresh is what makes this burger tasty. Love the jarred pickles. The garlic fries are a little greasy but tasty.
author: William B.

description: Food was perfect, customizable, appropriately priced and the young woman at the counter was beyond lovely and accommodating. A++
author: Brian C.

description: This is a delicious burger place! Juicy and flavorful. Next time I want to add some blue cheese (it's not on the official menu) and maybe get a soft serve ice cream.
author: Phill B.

description: This was a really well made burger. Slightly above average fries, but the burger (and the ketchup) were phenomenal. Highly recommend it
author: Carter L.

description:
I used to go here a lot back in the day when it was a Johnny Rocket location.

I had been here only once before by myself, and really enjoyed the burger. I came back with the whole brood in tow, baby mama and 3 kids, 7, 8 and, 12, last Saturday to put the place to the family test.

SDB is BUSY on a Saturday, and we were concerned about getting served and seated in a timely fashion - kids are impatient. We were surprised. It was busy, but we the cashier line was only two deep - with two cashiers manning the registers.  We ordered 4 burgers w fries, a salad, and drinks - part of the combo (I had a beer). The tables were busy but the counter was open so we sat there where it curves so we could see each other and talk. Perfect.

Food arrived fast, and everything was delicious. We were very happy. Service is fast and friendly. These people work HARD.

For burgers in the Marina, go here
author: Massimo M.

description:
WONDERFUL BURGER.  You will get a juicy fresh burger here with homemade pickles.  The prices are GREAT!!!!! 

Just watch out for MEL'S DINER down the street.  CARLOS will rip you off and then give you nasty food served by his hateful waitress, KARLA and then they will both tell you THAT'S NOT MY JOB.
author: Marianne J.

description: This place is underrated and should definitely be up there with in n out and five guys! Can't wait to try their garlic cheese fries next time.  Their chicken sandwiches are delicious, too!
author: Erika R.

description:
Nothing beats ending the work week with awesome burgers at Super Duper. I went here a few nights ago on Monday night (my "friday") and the burgers were particularly salty in an extremely tasteful way. I got the Super Duper special - comes with 2 patty burger (they're small in-n-out type patties), fries, and upgraded to Racer 5 on tap. 

I love that these burgers are really reasonable in price and so tasty. They always satisfy my burger craving. And the Racer 5 on tap just really puts the cherry on top!

GOOD BURGERS HERE!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Affordable and tasty burgers in the Marina? Super Duper to the rescue!

Not a big place - a couple of tables, window front seating, and street-side chairs. Which is great for people watching. Marina girls galore.

Right, the burgers. My CHEESEBURGER ($5) was meaty, juicy, and came with a nice spicy sauce - just excellent. So were the fries. No complaints in that department.

I can honestly recommend the SPIKE MILKSHAKES - love your milkshake with a little  bit of booze? You got it. 

Okay, and now back to the Marina girls.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
This place is my typical go-to burger joint when I am in SF, particularly in Marina. It always has a line when I come in, but that can only tell you that the food is amazing. The seating isn't a lot, but I seem to always score a spot so I can't really say I've been forced to wait for a spot (there's also some seating outside). I like the environment, and I also like how the kitchen is open and you can pretty much see everything being cooked in front of you. It is a bit pricy, but it's understandable for this type of food, and also the fact of where it is located )The Marina is a very well-off area of SF). Parking may be difficult since Chestnut is the main food drag, but I always suggest people should park a few blocks north where you can park without a permit during the weekend (or for 2 hours during the the day).

The burgers here are so juicy and delightful; will continue to patronize this place as long as they keep up the good quality & service.
author: Andrew P.

description:
This was the second super duper location I've been too. Not sure if it's a franchise or individually owned but this location is definitely not as good as other locations. 

The reason for my rating is....

 although there is a line and staff standing around they wouldn't start another register for a while. 
Fries came out cold and bland. They're busy enough to keep putting in new batches into the fryer yet they fry them and let them sit. 

They tried to give me a glass for water than looked dirty. Ask for a to go cup instead. 

They got an extra star for making me a custom milkshake. Happy about that 

If you want a burger go to nearby Umami Burger. You'll be happier.
author: Kirk R.

description: Went for dinner tonight on our trip and oh my goodness so AMAZING! The burger was one of the best I've ever had! The bacon and the patty were both cooked perfectly and all the toppings were fresh. You have to add their homemade pickles! Yummm! The garlic fries were fresh and so good! They were packed and not one seat available because it is kinda small, but we planned on taking back to our hotel anyway so that didn't matter. Fast and great customer service, definitely a must try!
author: Cherrelle E.

description:
I think Super Duper might just be my favorite burger joint. I'm a usual at this location and I usually go for the super burger with cheese + avocado with an order of garlic fries. On days I want to spoil myself, I like to throw in a fried egg on that burger too :p The burger is a bit on the greasy side, but hey, whats a burger without a little grease here and there? It can get a bit overwhelming at times as other yelpers have stated, but for the most part, I do enjoy a little "grease" to keep my patty moist (not to the point where my bun is soaked though.)

On another note, the garlic fries are HEAVEN. They're definitely more on the cheesier side in comparison to ballpark fries but thats what I love about them. Apparently they use 6 month aged cheddar so that's pretty cool. Anyways, I'd say definitely stop by Super Duper if you're craving a nice juicy burger- they do get pretty busy around dinnertime so stop by early if you can!
author: Marny N.

description: Was torn between trying Umami Burger vs Super Duper which apparently won out when we asked 3 random strangers where we could find the best burgers in SF. My thoughts? Tasty, but certainly does not deserve the "best burger ever" award. Their burgers are basic with a limited choice of toppings to add and patties are thin. We also tried the garlic parmesan fries which were indeed very garlicky (you'll need a mint after). Satisfied my burger cravings but still wished there was something more "special" to it.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This is still my go-to burger spot with nary a bad experience.

I recently got back from Japan and after two weeks of delicious Japanese cuisine I couldn't wait to get my hands and mouth on a classic American cheeseburger and fries.  Of course, I went to Super Duper in the Marina and I was not disappointed.  I ordered the double with bacon, fries and the dipping sauces.

Did I mention they have beer on tap?  They have beer on tap.  I got a Racer 5 to go with that double, yes I did.
author: Vince F.

description:
I went to super duper burger after a long walk through Sam Francisco and got the "super combo" for $12 plus tax. It came with fries, a burger and a drink. This was plenty for me although I wasn't especially hungry.

The fries were OK. They were cut thin but not as thin as say McDonald's. They weren't as salty as most but that was easily remedied with ketchup and the sachets of salt in the store. I liked eating them but I wasn't impressed -- they were of completely standard quality.

The burger on the other hand was fantastic. The vegetables on it were fresh and in just the right ratios. The red onion was especially good. The patties were tasty and extremely juicy, so juicy that the toasted bun was pretty soaked on the bottom. This made for a delicious but very greasy burger. 

This great burger had two flaws. First and most importantly, the sauce wasn't quite as flavourful as it could have been. The flavour it did have was very nice and added a little complexity to the taste, but it wasn't very strong. I added ketchup to my burger to make it a bit flavourful. The other quibble I had was that I had to manually add pickles to my burger. The pickles were scrumptious and really improved the burger. My complaint is that I'm sure there are customers missing out on this because they don't realise there are pickles in the store.

The drink was just a standard fountain drink. I wanted root beer but they didn't have a very expansive selection at the fountain so I got coke zero. Oh well.

All in all, it was a great meal let down slightly by the somewhat forgettable fries. I highly recommend super duper burger's "super combo" for lunch or a very casual dinner.
author: Zachary G.

description: So yummy. So juicy. Focuses on the basics and keeps it fresh and delicious. My kids compare all burger to Super Duper - and SD always comes out on top! This is a favorite neighborhood joint for us.
author: Amber M.

description: Really great burger - tasty, affordable, and quick. Plus the heated outdoor seating makes for great people watching on Chestnut!
author: Ana M.

description:
Finally getting around to writing this review.

Super packed for a rainy day, but then again it was a small store, and you get your burgers relatively quick. My friend and I sat on the counter and witnessed the patties being cooked beautifully ^^

I got the Mini and deeply regretted not getting the Super Duper (which was just an extra patty I think). I added avocado and cheese and it was SO JUICY, I have dreams about it lol

Loved everything about it haha
author: Elaine T.

description: Totally great burgers. Make sure you have a paper towel beneath your chin when you take a bite because Burger juices will be flowing down. And don't be a p****, go for the garlic fries, you will not regret it. Super Duper has been my go to Burger place in San Francisco .
author: Frederick C.

description: Every time I'm on chestnut this place is packed so decided to come in the evening and the crowd died down a bit. Ordered the mini burger which was a good size, toppings are free but if you want the "also free" items made sure you ask for them too or it's not added to your burger when you say with everything. Reasonable prices and good
author: Kristina R.

description: They don't answer their phone so you have to wait. Lame. The burgers are OK and the cheapest in the marina I just wish they would answer their phone so that I don't have to wait around with my dogs in the car.
author: Jesse S.

description:
While I'm usually not a fan of burgers, Super Duper hits the spot! Don't be fooled by the "mini", it's actually a normal sized burger, and a tasty one at that!
