Super Duper's artisanal buns and sustainably-farmed vegetarian fed beef (ground daily) comes with a TON of free toppings, including: lettuce, tomato, red onions, jalapeño peppers, and grilled onions. For an extra $1: you can add avocado or roasted portobello, and for an extra $1.50: a fried egg! While I did need more than one set of napkins to contain the juice that spilled out of my burger, it tasted amazing. It's like a fancier In-N-Out with more options, such as chicken sandwiches, veggie burgers, and salads. For the hungrier folks out there, you can double the meat patties for a Super Burger! 

While the price tag of $5 for a mini burger ($5.50 with cheese) is a little high by fast-food standards, it's a great price for a quality casual sit-down. If you do stop by, I highly recommend trying the garlic fries which come topped with melted aged cheddar, as well as a kid size dipped and swirled organic soft-serve cone to end your meal!
author: Christine L.

description: Delicious burgers great service and they have the most satisfying service for a fast food place they have not disappointed me to this day
author: Tony V.

description:
Bottom line: Tasty burgers in a fast-casual atmosphere.

Context: I have visited Super Duper numerous times, by myself or with a small group.

- Burger is good.  Don't skip the sauce.  Mini-burger is a sufficient size.
- When I first started coming here, I LOVED the garlic fries.  Nowadays, I still get the craving at times, but not as urgently.  Perhaps the novelty wore off?  I think the change is with me, not with the fries.
- Generally not a fan of the ice cream.
- Have tried the veggie burger and the chicken sandwich.  They were fine.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Amazing burger a must stop every time I am in the Marina. The burger are hot and fresh. The staff is always amazing and helpful. Great for a quick bite or a full dinner!
author: John D.

description:
This is a delicious burger place! Juicy and flavorful. Next time I want to add some blue cheese (it's not on the official menu) and maybe get a soft serve ice cream.

I wish this restaurant would have other locations, as it is, it appears to only be in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Jen R.

description:
If you knew me in real life, you would know that...
#1: I am a french fry addict
#2: I crave fries 24/7

So of course, I was in the area and wanted a little snack (aka fries) and ended up at Super Duper Burgers.  My friend kept on saying that she heard that this place was good, so we both made a joint decision to try it.  Lucky me....this place also had garlic fries, which are also my weakness....I actually felt like I hit the jackpot.  I got a regular order and was surprised at how much was actually in the basket.  I was a little disappointed though that the cheese wasn't fully melted.  Sigh. I was too full to eat a burger, but I will definitely be back to try it!
author: Breanne H.

description:
What can I say.... we are Super Duper Burger fans. The burgers are oh-so-delicious and fresh, the fries (daughter and I love the garlic) are amazing, and if you're feeling particularly cheeky the Strauss Creamery milkshakes are a real treat or they have beer on tap (they have hubby's fave Racer 5).

This location is one of our favorites since it's the gateway to Marin and closer to the Marina. Cow Hollow is a great neighborhood with lots of shops and eateries. One of my favorites is burger here then Books Inc. It's also a perfect jumping off point trips for the Marin Headlands. 

The staff is friendly as with all SDB's. The only drawback is it's a small location, but we've always managed to find a place to sit.
author: Andrea R.

description: Freshly dipped chocolate cone on FLEEK!!! Had to stop in here for a dipped cone and it did not disappoint!! We got the kid size which is 3 swirls, plenty for an adult. Adult size is 5 swirls! Choco dipped cone ain't a thang you can share, even w your honey. Place is super cute! Wish we had them in LA!
author: Liz T.

description: We have become fans. Ordered a cheeseburger one veggie burger and fries. Very tasty, nothing was stale, generous toppings and put together nicely. The sauces were put on the side per our request. There's also seating area on perimeter of restaurant which allowed us to eat with our dog. Nice location since it's the Marina.
author: CJ C.

description:
The garlic game is real here. Be forewarned, if you get the garlic fries, there isn't garlic salt on the fries. There isn't little bits of garlic nicely cooked and seasoned on the fries. There is raw, grated, unforgiving garlic on them.
I happen to like garlic, a lot. So I didn't mind, but there was one bite where I thought I got a little garlic and some cheese and it ended up being only garlic. Oh and my girlfriend woke up with garlic breath the morning after even when she brushed her teeth before bed. Yikes. 

The regular fries were dope. Fresh. Delicious.

The burgers were pretty awesome as well. I made the mistake of adding a fried egg on top and that made it pretty unmanageable to eat cleanly (but they do warn you of that on the menu!). Also, don't shy away from the aioli, it's killer!
author: Matthew J.

description: Once again-Amazing.  Burgers are ruined for me and my family until this place opens in San Jose!
author: Dale D.

description: Great place to get a delicious burger for a very reasonable price in the city. Surprisingly I think they are actually even cheaper than their partner stores in Marin County. I was very surprised by this. Great service, very quick and friendly staff. All-around one of my favorite burgers
author: Nick T.

description:
Their garlic fries are amazing. Definitely get it. As for the burger, it's a bit crispier than your usual patty, which is a nice and different change, but not my personal favorite. 
Overall great service and great pickles! :)
author: Vence M.

description: Very tasty burgers! I wish I knew their recipe!! So delicious. Loved the homemade pickles too!
author: K M.

description: Delicious! Super duper sauce, garlic fries, pickles, the burgers. All delicious. This location is cool because there is bar around the grill. Great prices, friendly staff. Loved it.
author: Ashley F.

description: Like Taco Bell, I don't mind spending thirty minutes on the pot for this food. Well worth it.
author: Tyler S.

description:
This is a must try place when you visit when you are in SF! Right when I walked by you automatically notice their cute thick burgers and milkshakes! 

The line wasn't too long around 4 but I ordered a mini burger, garlic fries, Oreo milk shake, and mini burger with a egg. Everything was good as it looks! The milk shake was perfectly soft and creamy and the burgers were nice and juicy. The only thing I didn't really enjoy were the garlic fries. They were soft and surprisingly to garlic for me.
author: Julie T.

description:
This is one of the well-loved local burger gems in San Francisco, which has 7 locations in the Bay Area (and to my dismay, none in So Cal).  Thanks to my Yelp friend Noelle J., I had this place bookmarked before my recent trip.

Using only compostable packaging materials and serving 100% Niman Ranch beef from sustainably raised cattle, Super Duper is an environmentally friendly restaurant which also embraces the farm to table concept.

The MINI BURGER COMBO ($9.25, including fries and a fountain drink) could sound misleading as it is actually a 4-ounce patty, which is equivalent to a quarter pounder.  Together with fries, this is usually enough food for most people, especially for lunch.  So this is not really "mini" at all.  Those with a big appetite can order the super burger which has 2 patties and is a half-pounder.

The patty was well seasoned and very tasty .  There's a good balance in the seasoning that it doesn't overwhelm the natural flavors of the beef.  The beef patty was awesome -- I could taste that it's high quality beef.  Cooked medium, juicy but only slightly greasy, this is almost as good as you can get.  The "super sauce" dressing was slightly tangy and really yummy;  although it could make the burger a little messy.  But hey, a good burger is supposed to be messy, right?

This is definitely one of the most memorable burgers that I've had.  It is more expensive than most fast food and even higher end order-at-the-counter places, but it's worth every penny.

Downtown San Francisco.  Cable cars.  Market Street.  Union Square.  Super Duper Burger.

And don't forget to fall in love and leave your heart behind...
author: Rob L.

description:
What's not to love about this place. Amazing burgers, chicken sandos, and man o man the smells that come from this place make it hard to walk past and go to the gym.

Special shout out because the cashier overheard it was my girlfriends birthday and he went out of his way to say happy birthday and present her with the last donuts of the morning. Amazing customer service!
author: Mike L.

description: The burgers aren't very large, but they taste amazing. The sides are pretty great as well, especially the fries and pickles.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Food - 4 stars
cleanliness - 1 star... because they bus the table for you. 

Delicious food, every time! Moist patties, fresh ingredients, and I just can't resist that egg on top of my burger! Thank you for separating the top bun from the rest of my burger pile for me, I appreciate you not breaking the yolk! 
The place is small and can get very noisy. Little wiggle room. Tables are bus'ed by staff, but they don't clean the tables very well :( there were trash all over the sticky floor. One would think that the reason they bus the table for customers is to make sure the space gets cleaned properly... 

Lastly, the bathroom was a mess...
author: Annie B.

description:
Came before lunch rush hour....

Got the mini combo for 11.15 okay price....include burger(i got with cheese, cost extra if you want cheese in your burger), fries, and a drink. The burger was yummy and juicy. It has that salty flavor too. Maybe from the garlic fries mix together on the grill. The fries had the nice texture and it was warm when i got it.  The coke was good to wash down all the food i ate. 

You can sit either inside (table or booth) or outside table if you dine in.

Since its an open kitchen, you can see your food being cook.

Food came fast. Got my food less than 10 minute

I wanted to give 3.5 stars so i had a hard time whether to give 3 or 4 stars. I only give 3 stars cost of the price. But everything else, i enjoy my meal here
author: Julie N.

description: I'll preface this by saying that I've eaten burgers touted the 'best' in SF. I've even paid upwards of $25 after tax and mandate for some. This is easily the best I've had and it costs me $8.75 for a super double cheese with the works. I simply won't get a burger anywhere else. For the money, you just can't beat it.
author: Zach B.

description:
This review is about the service && not the food. The food here taste like every other Super Duper && is up to par.. However.. I've been to this location on 3 separate occasions considering I work on this street && the service is poor every single time. 

First time, I called in to order my food. The woman that picked up the phone kept cutting me off to get her routine out, "do you know our burgers come medium.." Blah blah blah, I know the drill.. && not only do I know the drill, but she kept CUTTING ME OFF while I was trying to place my order which I found pretty rude. When I went to go pick up my order everything that I wanted on my burger was not on it..so she screwed up my order by not listening. Poo. 

Second time.. I ordered a combo with the 3 dips.. When I got my food the 3 dips weren't in the bag. I walked up to the person working the counter && asked for the dip. He asked me if I paid for them.. I was pretty offended.. Seeing that I already paid $10-12 for the combo...I for surely wouldn't be trying to get over on them for their extra $1.50.. He then had to go into the register, pull up my order to verify if I had actually paid for it.. A total waste of my time for their screw up.. 

This morning.. I had a little extra time before my shift && they were still serving breakfast.. I decided to give it a go. I ordered a egg sandwich + avocado && a small coffee.. My total came out to $7.44.. Then as I'm reading the special I see I could've gotten the same thing plus donuts && a large coffee.. I was a bit taken back at the fact that the cashier didn't point out the special && try to up sell me && then I left feeling a little hoodwinked because for an extra 50 cents I could've gotten a better deal. I guess they don't teach up selling in the fast food industry. 

So if you come to this location, make sure you read the menu's throughly && have them review your order before you pay.. Because the service is terrible here.
author: KyAsha D.

description: Oh man, awesome burger. Juicy and delicious, great with lettuce, tomato, red onion, and their super sauce. Fries well cooked but not spectacular. Not cheap, but well worth the money. They serve chicken, veggie burgers, and salad for the non- carnivores.
author: Dave R.

description:
Very similar to Shake Shack, in size of burger (quite small) and price. :P

I got the mini burger + cheese + fried egg + everything on it and the garlic fries with 3 dips.

When they brought the food they forgot to bring the 3 dips so I had to go back in and ask for it.

The patty was super juicy and greasy. Quite delicious! :D

The garlic fries barely had any garlic... it was mostly shredded cheese. Could barely taste any hint of garlic.
author: Connie F.

description: If you want big ass juicy freshly cooked burgers with special sauce, this is the place.  Totally food porn.  Garlic fries is a must.  Hint.  Get lots of napkins!
author: Mike W.

description:
Just bumped into this place while walking on Chestnut. Wanted a quick bite, and something I could eat while walking.
I loved the chicken sandwich with the spicy aioli sauce... I've never had such a juicy, tasty chicken sandwich :-)
author: Cay A.

description: I had their free range chicken sandwich and it was delicious! It came on ciabatta bread and it was soft and easy to eat. I would definitely stop by again if I'm in the area
author: Maricela C.

description:
They are good and rarely disappoint. 

Meat is good and better than Roam Burger, which is really what we are judging here. 

Garlic fries are good too. I'd skip the dipping sauces if you're getting it to go. 

They don't use romain lettuce and they use red onions instead of white onions, so the burger lacks a bit of crunch or texture that I prefer.
author: Cecil C.

description:
This is a tasty burger.

Menu is a bit misleading as the "mini" burger is just a regular burger, and the "super" burger is a double. Very good burger with fresh lettuce and tomato. The garlic fries are pretty strong, I think I would have done better ordering the regular fries. Next texture though - crunchy exterior and soft interior.

My S.O. got a beer and it must have been tapped incorrectly. He ordered a porter, and the waitress poured that tap, but it was clearly an IPA.

Overall, we really enjoyed Super Duper Burger. My only regret was that I didn't get the softserve -- it looked so good.
author: Lyndsey M.

description:
Been here 4 times and each time I sort of regret coming, but I will still give this place a 4 stars, why?

Burger:
I always get the super burger(2 patties) with everything on it. Sometimes when I feel rich I add avocado, bacon, cheese, and an egg. The burger is very juicy and flavorful, but very wet/hard to fit my mouth around. By the time you take 2 bites, everything starts falling out or dripping.

Fries:
The normal fries is normal, nothing to it. The garlic fries for $0.50 is worth the upgrade. If you're a vampire, I'd stay away.

Sauces:
$1.50 for 3 small cups of sauce, really? I just spent $10 on your burger and $3-$4 on the fries, you're gonna charge another $1.50 for some freaking sauce?

Since this is San Francisco, $10 burgers and $4 fries are not uncommon. But if you want a whole meal (Double burger, fries, shake/drink) it will cost you $15-$20. For only $7-$9, I can get a whole meal at In-N-Out.
author: Da X.

description: Attitude is everything...not quite.  Food counts too.  This place has a bunch of servers with attitude and really really awful fries.  Please avoid, if only for your taste buds.
author: Tom T.

description: Quality ingredients but greasy and a little pricey. My hands and face felt oily after eating a burger and fries. Cheese is an extra 50 cents on your burger. The shakes are good. I wish the oreo shake had more cookie chunks, but they blend it till smooth. I'll ask if they can make it chunkier if I  come back. They have beer on tap and the food comes out to order very fast. Their home made ketchup, mustard, and pickles are good. Don't forget to bus your own tray and table. There's so many other food options on Chestnut that I'd rather try instead.
author: Lori W.

description:
Brought to you by the founder of Pasta Pamodoro, Super Duper Burgers is the true leader of the resurgent burger craze.  Forget Shake Shack from NYC or Umami or Roam or Burger Urge or any fancy schmancy  new place, this the real deal.

Super Duper has a very basic menu in the same vein as an In-n-out. Just go with a 4 oz. patty for light eaters or double for the big. eaters.  Although they have great milkshakes, I prefer to save room for a soft serve cone after dinner.  In fact this location replaced a Johnny Rockets joint, a chain that no longer exists within the SF City limits..

I also prefer their fries over In-n-out burger.  Fries come in both regular and garlic.  This is San Francisco, remember?  

When you get to a Super Duper, you stand in line to place your order and they give you a number which you place on your table.  Drinks are self service and be sure to get yourself some jarred homemade pickles to munch on while you wait!!

When you bite into a Super Duper burger you will note that every thing tastes fresh, from the tomato to the bun, etc.  Of course the first 4 stars come from the burger itself which is moist and just melts in your mouth.

What adds that 5th star are the intangibles.  The incredible soft serve, the friendly service ( they remember regulars), the clean rest room, the great location, and great people watching.

There are other San Francisco locations down at the Metreon and on Market Street.
author: Erik H.

description: Answer your phone. Some of us prefer to order ahead and not stand in line or let Postmates screw up the order. Cmon.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Seriously the best burgers I have ever had! After hitting all the tourist attractions at the Golden Gate Bridge we were starved, and usually when your starving you don't make the best decisions. But luckily on my handy dandy yelp app saved the day :) And mind you I am not a typical burger kind of gal, being Asian I will prefer some rice and a whole spread of other main dishes but I am so glad I chose to please my other half on this day. 

During our 10 day vacation we came here 3 times, yes 3 times! We were staying more in the city, on Sutter and Powell but didn't want to take a chance on a different restaurant. I know they should be the same but my mind is a stubborn one.  

I ordered the mini burger combo, which comes with fries and a drink. I added bacon and cheese to my combo for .50 each. I also added avocado and my other half ordered his burger with organic egg for $1 each. Seriously this mini combo is no joke, I was actually stuffed. Oh and upgrade to Garlic Fries, you will have no regrets! The burger was the juiciest and most perfect cooked meat I have ever had. And it was an extra surprise that they had pickle bar because you know its not complete without those pickles. 

Oh also you need to order the shakes, soooo good! I hope someday that they will make it down here in Hawaii. ( I know wishful thinking) :)
author: Racquel K.

description: I went for lunch. I got a mini burger with cheese and bacon and a side of fries. It was good but not the best I've ever eaten. The menu advertises all their burgers as cooked medium, but mine was well done, maybe slightly even more than that. Also their ketchup was weird. I'd go back but hopefully it will be a little better next time.
author: Stephen W.

description: This seems to be a famous place for its Burger. A friend recommended to try the burger and it is not bad but a little salty.  Great fries and pickled cucumber. Crowded most of the time with young couples. Okay but not the best burger in the Marina.
author: L. G.

description: Good burgers however prices have fairly recently increased by more than 10%. Combo meal used to be $9.50 and is now $10.50. Also ice cream products have gone up in price. Its still good though.
author: William M.

description: The Super Duper Burger is one of the tastiest burgers I have had in my life, and THE most delicious burger I have had in SF. I add on the basic stuff (lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, and pickles) and order a side of their amazing garlic fries. You'll need a pack of mints after eating these fries but a little bit of garlic breath never killed anyone. The food is cheap/delicious, there's rarely a long line, and there are plenty of tables available, so why wouldn't you want to drop by for one of their tasty burgers?
author: Helen P.

description: We stopped in after finding Super Duper Burger in Yelp and were not disappointed! Awesome burger and shakes!
author: Jenn M.

description: If you love a good burger, and I know you do, you will love Super Duper. We plan trips to SF around getting one. Premium quality meat and everything else. House made pickles. You can pay a lot more for a burger that's half as good as these. Potato and sweet potato fries are the thinner kind and are always crisp and delicious. The milk shakes are first rate and they have a small but quality selection of micro brews on tap. Basically all you could need or want.
author: Chris R.

description: Super yummy! Burgers are made to order. Juicy and fresh. Chicken sandwich with the chipotle aioli was delicious, but a tad spicier than I had anticipated, and I love chipotle anything. Wanted to order dipped ice cream cones to go, but their ice cream machine was down. Bummer.
author: Lori T.

description: This place is great.. the food is really good and service is fast at the same time I don't feel like they rushed my food.. I had a mini burger with bacon and avocado.. I was extremely satisfied. At first i thought I'd be disappointed in size . But the Mini was the same size as the super . The patty was delicious . Also the setting is very comfortable. I totally recommend this place to anyone in town for a quick bite.
author: Devon W.

description: Really good burgers, fries and beer.  Homemade pickles.  Really good food!
author: Rich S.

description: Grabbed a burger and beer here while exploring the Presidio area in San Francisco. Good, fast service and the burgers are delicious! Great place to eat while on the go!
author: Jen H.

description: The burgers are beyond delicious here! Service is usually quick and the employees are great! Don't forget to get a cookies and cream shake, you won't be disappointed!
author: Alejandra P.

description:
Super Duper in the Marina!  Score!  The Marina hasn't had a real good burger place in years, if ever.  Drove by a couple of times and saw a line out the door.  Today (weds) came by at 5:30 and walked right up the register.  

Ordered 1 mini burger and 1 mini cheeseburger and a shake.  Beware a "super" burger is 2 patties whereas the "mini" has one.  Ordered "everything" onions, lettuce, grilled onions, tomato.  All super fresh.  Sat down at the counter to wait.  The shake was made in 2 mins, the burgers in 5!!!  The burger was cooked perfectly and real tasty.

Super Duper occupies the mid-range burger tier.  More expensive, but better than In-n-Out, not as expensive or fancy as the $15-$20 burger at many restaurants.  

A great option for a good burger.  Will definitely be back.  Often.
author: Steve G.

description:
What was I thinking?  Super Duper on a Saturday?  In the Marina??  After joyriding up to the city???

Sure, why not.  

Okay, so you've already heard about the burgers.  They're super.  You've heard about the garlic fries.  They're also super.  So here's what I thought about my mini cheeseburger with garlic fries and a lemonade:

Mini Burger with cheese 5/5
Garlic Fries 2.5/5
Lemonade 4/5

The garlic fries got soggy and I wasn't super into raw-ish garlic flavor.  I prefer the garlic to be toasted and my fries double-fried, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  

SOMEBODY TELL ME WHO DOES IT THAT WAY IN SF PLEASE!!!  NOT THIS PLACE!

About that raw garlic flavor.  I can still taste it.  It's 11:47 in the evening.  I ate at Super Duper at 1:30pm.  I even ate dinner at 5, and I can still.  taste.  raw.  garlic.  C'MON!

Super garlic flavor aside, this place is a keeper.  Neighborhood vibe was cool.  Service that day was nice.  The outside table we sat in was super clean.  Next time, regular fries...and take it to go.  The Palace or Crissy Field is a short walk away.
author: Eileen P.

description:
Not bad, though next time, I would probably walk to another one of the many places in the area.

The burger I got was alright, but it was not as great as I expected (or wanted) it to be. The flavors just didn't pop, it was not as juicy as they promised (they say all burgers are cooked medium but mine was definitely medium well, emphasis on the well), and the food took a while to come out. I ordered mine with grilled onions, super sauce (nothing super about it, didn't have much flavor), lettuce, and cheddar cheese. If the burger was a little bit less done and more seasoned, or if the sauce and other toppings had more flavor, this would have been so much better. 

I did enjoy my garlic fries- lots of garlic, and a little bit of cheese as well. Really good and cooked perfectly.

Menu here is pretty small- burgers, fries, a few other sandwiches, beer and wine on tap, and shakes. Definitely not my favorite burger by any measure. It was definitely A-OK but I am positive you can find a better burger in San Francisco.
author: Seema U.

description:
This place definitely hit the spot! I chose this place for burgers since it was more casual than this other one nearby. 

It was definitely worth it since the burger was juicy and the coca cola tasted great. I got the burger with two patties and garlic fries. The garlic fries had cheese on top however, which is odd to me, but you can just request without it. 

The service was really friendly and the place is very clean. Would definitely come back.
author: Kenneth H.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is dank. I probably use this adjective to describe something roughly once a year.

Like, without question, it was really good. The garlic fries and dip were also bomb. Both the chicken and the meat burger were crazy.
author: Nicolas B.

description:
I really enjoyed the super burger combo with added cheese.
It contains great double burger with a looot of meat, really well done, tasty, well spiced and juicy.
The usual french fries, I guess they are fresh made, at least tested like :)
Enjoy the sunny Chestnut street while eating the burger outside on the tables.
author: Nina M.

description:
It has been a week since we have eaten here and my husband can't stop talking about it!  The burgers were a huge hit with him AND the kids, fries were delicious and the cookies and cream shake was scarfs down between the five of us in mere seconds.

MY favorite thing was the chicken burger.  Spicy, perfectly seasoned, juicy chicken breast with bacon and cheese.  It was easily the best chicken sandwich I have ever had.

They had several handles on tap, but they had just tapped the Racer 5 keg when we got there :(  Can't wait to come back next time!
author: Alicia R.

description: This super duper burger took forever to make my food, I was in there before two and didn't get my food until 2:39 when these two young girls got their order taken and received their food within 10 minutes, highly dissatisfied with this super duper burger and their staff
author: Shomari H.

description: Awful, disgusting, unwelcoming, unappealing, unfriendly, and not worth the time......................are all things that you won't need to use when describing this place. Jordan, greeted me immediately when I entered. Great disposition, and extremely helpful. His attitude brought out what I think this brand is all about. Good choice in putting him at the front of house. I left it to Jordan to guide me through the menu and what I had to try as it was my first time in here. He recommended his personal favorite custom built Superburger with pepper jack cheese, grilled onions, cut in half with bacon and chipotle sauce. And that right there my friends is what I call a "slap yo momma " good burger!!!! I will be back! Great staff, great vibe, amazing fresh ingredients, and they have ice cream!!!! Need I say more?
author: Brian J.

description: If you're in the area I would recommend Super Duper. It was an old school sit down burger joint on a corner street. Plenty of seating and great food. The vanilla milkshake was by far the best milkshake I've ever had. The garlic fries were so tasty I almost went back for more. Decent price for a great burger. I'll be going back when I pass through San Francisco again.
author: Devin E.

description: Love this place. Finally found it again. It's been years!!! Had veggie burger and garlic fries yumo
author: Nancy F.

description: Great value for money. The garlic fries are delicious. The burger is pretty solid and the shakes are good.
author: Shawn P.

description: Today is my 2nd time getting breakfast  in the morning here in Super Duper. I was about to rate this place a  5 star, but then today  I was not happy nor pleased about the service especially when my food came out very oily.when I had a bite (the oil went on my pants) who would like to eat oily food tho? also there was a 2 customers came after me. But then they got their order first before me and I only order 1 Egg Sandwich! Tsk Tsk tsk
author: Quiachon L.

description: Awesome burger place!! The place was packed and they had a huge line. They had a huge line, but the flow was easily deceptive. They took your order and then gave you a number. Once you sit, they get your drinks out to you quickly. In our case, our Vanilla shake. Shortly after that., our  food arrives and it was  delicious, especially the burgers. The people who worked there were really friendly and very helpful. Everyone seemed genuinely nice and we will back for more of their delicious food. I forgot to mention that they had a few beers on tap. We sat on the patio and soaked up the sunshine.
author: Robert R.

description: Burger was okay, nothing special tasting although it was all organic.  The Oreo shake was good.  The staff and service was great.  I'd like to rate it higher but the taste was just plain, even with the added toppings.  Good place to stop by for a quick bite but defiantly not the best burger I've ever had.
author: Josh B.

description: This goes for all the other Super Duper locations but this burger place never disappoints! Their super burgers are my favorite. $7 worth it! Super duper is equivalent to In N Out to me and that's saying a lot. The burger, fries and shake together are splendid. Plus their staff has always been friendly and helpful which makes the place lively. Need to to back asap.
author: Anne F.

description: This has got to be my favorite place on chestnut in the marina. Burgers are so juicy and garlic fries are a must!!! Everyone there is so friendly and energetic.
author: Angelina Q.

description: My boyfriend and I were wandering Chestnut looking for food after our plan to go to Pacific Catch failed because it was tiny and packed. After walking past a few places, we stumbled upon Super Duper. We hadn't had burgers in quite awhile so we thought it'd be a good spot for lunch. I ordered a mini burger combo and he had the super burger combo with garlic fries, and we both got vanilla shakes. My goodness were we happy with our choice. The garlic fries were amazing and the burgers were the perfect amount. The shakes were some of the best I've had, and had me so full by the end of the meal. They even have pickles with a hint of spiciness to them to snack on while you're waiting for your food. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone looking for a delicious meal in the city.
author: Valerie W.

description: 25 minutes to get two veggie burgers. Not okay for fast casual! Ended up changing the order to to-go since it took the same amount of time as ordering at a "sit down" spot. Thankfully I didn't have to tip
author: Brittney M.

description:
Burger + Fries + Milkshake = Perfection.

Best burger I had in San Francisco. When you walk in here, you can tell it's more a gourmet burger place. But hey, I will happily fork out more money if the goods deliver and boy did they do just that.

The place is not large by all means but has a few tables and a funky colour scheme. You order at the front and collect a number where they'll bring you your food. The service was efficient and nice. 

But who cares about those things, let's talk food people.

The burgers, were just amazing. Juicy, flavoursome, smelled amazing - what else would you want from a burger? The juices dripping all down my hands and it was such a blissful moment. The garlic fries were perfectly cooked and topped off with cheese that melted onto the fries. Can it really get any better? Finally to wash it all down I couldn't resist the super duper double choc milkshake. Wowza. Yum. That's all I'll say. 

Yes, you can get burgers for so much less but this meal was worth every penny.
author: Felicity T.

description: I just loved the super burger! It tasted amazing, nice and juicy. Cooked to perfection and the buns were nice and toasted. I would definitely recommend trying their homemade pickles, they are great for pickle lovers.
author: Kimberly Costa O.

description:
Came here with a friend after we each finished our salads at Blue Barn half a block down (tasty but not enough to fill us). 

MMM! The meat was perfectly cooked to my liking and super juicy...literally dripping. I would definitely come again for a full lunch or snack in between meals. I'll have to try their dipped ice cream cones next time; they use Straus ice cream.
author: Bonnie L.

description: Forget Roam -- when it comes to veggie burgers, Super Duper is the winner. The patty is so delicious and you can't beat the combo with the garlic fries and vanilla soft serve. So tasty! I often crave this meal and am guilty of Postmating sometimes just the fries and ice cream.
author: Nicole D.

description: The best tasting burger I've had yet, moist, tasty and filling! Spicy pickles, if that's your thing
author: Mansfield K.

description: Ordered a super burger with garlic fries.  Burger was very flavorful and juicy, better than In n Out and Habit in my opinion.  The meat comes standard as medium cooked, which is alright with me.  The garlic fries were great, possibly best ive had.  Very strong flavor that leaves a lasting impression in your mouth.  The only thing I didnt like was the location which is insanely hard to find parking.  Overall good experience and will be back!
author: Calvin H.

description: One of the best burgers ever had. Customer service was nice and fast. I will come back soon. Wish they had locations in the Bay Area.
author: James W.

description: It doesn't get any better than this! I started to frequent this joint last fall after seeing a movie at Presidio Theater. The menus are ready to grab outside the place so the customers can order quickly. I order the cheeseburger and veggie burger interchangeably.. I usually go there Saturday nights, so the place is definitely full. Great food! Love the ambiance!
author: Julio B.

description:
SERIOUSLY THE BEST BURGER I'VE EVER HAD.

I don't really need to say more, but for the sake of a Yelp review I should. I love the simplicity of their burger--patty, bun, the fixings, and their special sauce. What takes the cake for me is the juiciness of the patty itself. It's so juicy and flavorful, and paired with their special sauce AND the red onions make it an extremely flavorful burger. It gets to be a little pricey when you add on other stuff (I always get mine with avocado and bacon), but honestly it's so worth it. And the garlic fries topped with cheese? IT'S JUST ALL AROUND HEAVEN.

The milkshakes are so delicious, incredibly creamy and frothy and perfect for a hot day. If you want the ice cream instead, just get the kid size (it's already a pretty large size in my opinion), and dip that s**t in chocolate. Yeah.

My boyfriend and I have been here so many times that some of the employees know who we are. Come to think of it, it's been a while since we've been....

TL; DR: Just get the damn burger. With the garlic fries. And a milkshake. Ya won't regret it.
author: Bettina L.

description:
Quite a place this is! We're from out of town, found this place here, on Yelp! Glad we did because EVERYTHING about this place is superb. They are fast, efficient, great atmosphere, and of course, the food.....its....INCREDIBLE. We got mini cheeseburgers with everything (lettuce, tom, thin red onion, special sauce) burger cooked medium on toasted buttery bun, got fries to share and split a cookies n cream milkshake (next time, we're not splitting) it was SO YUMMY! Burger was juicy and just right amount of crisp from the griddle. 

You can sit there and watch everything be prepared and I have such a respect for the 3 guys I saw behind the line. One guy working the griddle doing all the burgers, the other two were on the line preparing buns, fries, assembling. It was amazing to see because it was all done so fast and so well. Pickles are made in house, all paper products are compostable, you seriously can't ask for a better place. 

We always stay in Cow Hollow and this will be our GOTO place in this 'hood for sure!

Update: left our little French bistro after dinner last night to head back to Super Dupers for a cookies n cream shake for dessert, no splitting this time, wanted all that delicious goodness in a cup just for me! WORTH IT!
author: Lesley B.

description:
Today my dream came true. 

This burger/meal was like a love song. 

The mini burger and garlic fries were plenty for me!! The staff was so nice... And to top it all off... They have one of my favorite beers on tap: SCRIMSHAW! 

I went a little crazy and got a cone too. Hashtag:NOREGRETS

Besos for this burger
author: Natalie C.

description:
So I was just here two days ago. I ordered a mini burger with an egg , a chicken sandwich an order of fries and a spiked malt.

The spiked malt was meh.

The burger was one of the least appetizing. I was really underwhelmed. I'm disappointed . This place definitely does not live up to the hype.

Great customer service though .

Chicken sandwich is not fried unlike at most burger joints. It was also meh.

Fries were the best thing at 3 stars.

I would definitely not come back as I'm sure there are plenty of other burger places that are better..especially in the East Bay.


Go to Boss Burger instead.
author: Aerin A.

description: If you are looking for a super burger in the marina, look no further super duper has hella good burger. The burger was delicious but the fries were out of this world. They were garlic fries with melted cheese and they are the best fries I've had in a while. I enjoyed the fries more than the burger. They have a good beer selection mostly because they had my favorite beer racer 5.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Ordered the chicken sandwich wtb everything on it, cheese, and avocado. I also ordered fries and a chocolate malt! YUMMMM! There was also home-made pickles up for grabs next to the condiments! Something unique I haven't seen at a burger joint. No complaints on food! Can't go wrong with fresh ingredients!

Super duper is located in a great spot, right in the heart of Marina. All walks of people creating a great atmosphere of diversity!
author: Aunnie T.

description:
The service was very fast. The burger with cheese and bacon was well done and a little grease.
Fries (regurlar) were as good as In & Out. The ice tea was fresh and tasted good.
author: Ed S.

description:
Dear Super Duper Burgers,

You were super duper greasy tonight. Garlic fries were glistening in oil and my mini burger almost slipped out of the wrapper. I probably grabbed for napkins more often than a normal visit at Super Duper Burger. 

As I sit here sipping on hot tea trying to undo the greasy meal and my regret, all I can think of is that my tummy hurts and it'll be quite some time before I decide to visit you again. Tonight, you made me miss Shake Shack.

Sincerely,
Ruby C.
author: Ruby C.

description: Love this place.  Easy ordering. Food delivered to your table. Reasonable prices. Yum pickles. Best part is ordering fries extra crispy and the organic ketchup! Why do people wait 30 minutes at In Out?
author: On C.

description: I can go to Super Duper Burgers anywhere in san francisco and they are equally good. Food is fresh and really awesome! I have tried veg burger with garlic/regular fries along with choclate vanilla shake and everything was tasty.
author: Hasiba C.

description:
Burger ~ juicy. Fresh. Easy to order. 
Cone ~ swirl (pretty good)
Self service. Friendly staffs.
author: SevLong L.

description: Great quality juicy free range beef burger patty at a reasonable cost. The mini burger is $5, cheese is $1, garlic fries are $3. There's limited seating inside but they offer barstool areas and four outdoor tables. They also have malt milk shakes and regular milk shakes. The super burger has two patties and costs $7. Service was friendly despite all of the belligerent drunkards who rolled thru after the World Cup trying to find a bathroom.
author: Brenda L.

description:
SUPER DUPER GOOD! I don't think I've gone back to In N Out yet after trying a Super Duper Burger.

Everything about the burger tastes super fresh. I like to get everything on my burger with grilled onions, avocado, and topped with an egg for the extra protein.

I always get the cookies and cream milkshake too. It has this soy flavor to it that makes the shake really good.

I like how there are free pickles for you to grab at the condiment counter. Everything they use is compostable which is awesome!

I've been to other Super Dupers, but this spot is my favorite. The workers here are really friendly and also greet customers with a smile.
author: Derek T.

description: As a dad with three kids, it's easy to grab a bite at Super Duper. Everybody knows about the juicy burgers and dipped ice-cream cones, but it's worth mentioning that the breakfast specials are perfect for when you're on your way to a soccer tournament. Great coffee, too.
author: Nate B.

description:
Best fast food burger in the city. Quick, cheap, tasty, and love that they have free pickles, which are also very very good!

Seating is a bit lacking here, but if you wait a minute or two something will open up :)
author: Suzanna F.

description:
Burger, Avocado an Pickles!

In many ways, this chain reminds me of G Burger. I decided to come here after a friend told me to try it. It was within walking distance and where I decided to make it a meeting spot for my other friend and me.

Fresh meet and ingredients were a delight. Fresh avocado is also an option. No cheese please and some delicious pickles had me liking the burger. 

Overall, I am not quite the fan but did have an AOK burger. I am almost a fan.

Prices are reasonable.

3.5 Stars.
author: Nick H.

description: BEST BURGER EVER. Great fries (try their 3 different dipping sauces) and add bacon to your burger!
author: Cb H.

description:
We went here for egg sandwiches when we saw the breakfast sign. Boy am I glad we did.  Friendly service, decent prices... Ooh and those little mini donuts that we didn't expect- delish!

I see this place being very busy in the evenings, but the breakfast sandwich was so good.
author: andrew m.

description: Good but not great.  Ordered garlic fries and mini burger with cheese along with a wine.  The smallest glass of wine ever.  Cost for all three was $15.77, cheap in SF. The place was busy but plenty of seating.  The food came out in 10 minutes.  The burger was hot but fries were cold.
author: Susan K.

description: Amazing they never disappoint me.  Burgers are always juicy and super tasty.  Chicken sandwich the same. Gotta love the free pickles too.
author: Brian B.

description:
I'm quite back and forth on this place. The concept is good and everything should work but something always falls a bit off. 

The burger is well flavored but too greasy for my taste. The whole bun gets soaked with grease.

The same with the garlic fries. Incredibly tasty but too soggy under all the cheese. 

However, the chicken sandwich is one of the best I've had from a quick service joint. Crispy bread, grilled chicken and some awesome chipotle sauce. It's to die for. 

I'll go back, but crossing their burgers off my list.
author: Alexandra K.

description:
I'm a simple gal. I don't care much for Valentine's Day, and it just so happened to fall on a Friday this year. The mister asked what I wanted to do and honestly, I just wanted to try Super Duper and watch the Lego movie. So that is what we did. The moment my very first mini hit my lips, my life changed.
Since that night, I have been on a Super Duper kick and I will tell you that not all Super Dupers are equal!

Marina location can be tricky to find parking at night. There's a lot across the street. This location is small. Pickles are the same and for some reason, the patty just isn't as tasty as Castro and Market. They also don't have any special ones like the one in the 'stro.
author: Susy C.

description:
Mmmm...3 stars or 4?! 

Here's the reason: my garlic fries had a bug crawling around. At first I thought it was a little fly, it turned out it was a small spider or some sort of bug I didn't know. I took it to the front and told them there's a bug on my fries...a guy just took the fries back. 5-10 mins later, they gave me new garlic fries. Yet, C'mon...just plz make sure things are clean. 

Regardless of how luck I'm to have a bug, the garlic fries are delicious. It's very garlicky with cheese on top. 

Also order, lemonade with brown sugar. It's pretty good. I don't think u can refill that tho.
author: Yunnie L.

description:
If I were in San Quentin and was set to leave this planet tomorrow, I'd request a juicy burger, fries, and a milkshake as my send off. That's how much I enjoy a great burger. Which is why I try not to give out too many 5 star burger yelps.

We were in the Marina area and remembered scoping out this place. Decided to stop by with the family on our way to the north bay. The crowd in this part of SF is decidedly well-off, and I would say 97% of all females strolling Chestnut are donning Lululemons. Just setting the scene for the readers.

This place is compact, but makes use of every square foot is has leased. There's not too much on the menu. I ordered a super duper burger with the works, consisting of two 4 oz patties ala Five Guys. Also got some fries too. Grabbed a number and got lucky in finding a table for 3. Food came out real quick. I unwrapped that sucker and tore into it. Damn it was good! Meat was cooked almost perfect, if anything I could have used more pink. Juicy, tasty, peppery, juicy. The bun held it together well with the tomato and onions. Even the wife loved it, and she even said it was better than her previous favorite burger. About $8 for this great burger. 

Fries were just ok. I'd skip it. Not nearly as good as In N Out. And nowhere near the volume of 5guys. Oh and although I didn't order it, there were a lot of milkshakes being made, so I suspect those were good as well.

Must try this place. Great neighborhood too.
author: Kris P.

description: It's been a long time since I last was back at this Super Duper since I spend most my time in San Mateo now. I have got to say, I don't regret coming all the way out to Cow Hollow at all. I really enjoy the Super Burger from this location. The meat is always juicy and not too salty, the bacon is crisp, the avocado and toppings are fresh, and the garlic fries are AWESOME! The old crew is missing, I don't see them around anymore but the place still holds a dear place in my heart.
author: Aaron M.

description:
UPDATE: Very disappointed. 2nd visit, and they got my burger wrong - twice! What's even worse, the manager personally delivered the wrong burger to my table the 2nd time around. And it had a runny egg that was still  1/2 raw (which was visible since the top bun was set aside). That's how people get salmonella poisoning from undercooked eggs. I will not be visiting this location again. 

--- original review ----
Delicious burger! Super Burger w/ bacon, blue cheese, grilled onions, and a fresh egg on top = burger heaven!

Plus, the garlic fries are crispy, crunchy, and garlicious!

There aren't a lot of places to sit in the place, but service is fast and friendly. Clean tables, cool decor, and great views of the street, in case you're in the mood for people-watching. 

Definitely go there if you can.
author: Michael M.

description:
5 stars at out of 5 for being the BEST Super Duper burger spot out of ALL the Super Duper spots in SF. I shamefully have to admit that I have tried a burger at every single Super Duper in SF and this Marina location still has the juiciest, freshest, most well put together burgers.

It's worth the extra trek if you are far...but honestly SF is 7x7 miles...so... just do it! You'll need to do some cardio with all the yummy goodness you'll be digesting anyway :P
author: Selina W.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever had and the garlic fries were amazing. I need one of these to open every place that I live!
author: Brian W.

description:
This is the third Super Duper location in San Francisco. The newest burger joint is located where the old Johnny Rocket's used to allocated on the busy corner of Chestnut St.

All Super Duper have great locations including this one. 

Of the three locations, the newest site is by far the smallest restaurant. But the restaurant has the great view of the hustling and bustling of Chestnut St. 

Again I ordered the popular Super Duper burger ($6.50) with cheese ($.50 extra) for $7.00. I also get a basket of garlic fries with my burger. The two are my usual and my favorites. My meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/CR5_3AHC-CqySDwOrynxWA?select=DrUbUzsGnQtCxnQL5uysLA

I usually order beer with my burger. But the newest burger joint is waiting for the liquor license, which may take forever. So I ordered the Cookies & Creams milkshake. For $5.00, the pricey milkshake sounds unique and tempting. But no, the milkshake tasted diluted with lumps in the drink. This milkshake is definitely a lousy choice. Not recommended. If you want, you can have my milkshake: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/CR5_3AHC-CqySDwOrynxWA?select=J5kQ_PNfe3Cg1DS3NnaYsQ

The Super Duper Burger is certainly not the same without my brew. I hope they get their liquor license soon.
author: Matt G.

description:
This is a review of the only menu item I tried -- their excellent and highly recommended garlic fries.

Where to begin? The warm crispy exterior, covered with cheese, salt... but the most memorable thing is the unmistakably rich taste and aroma of roasted garlic. It's not pungent or overwhelming, but an undertone of mouthwatering flavor.

For the price, it's a steal! I'd order them again and again and again...

Don't forget to bring mints: you'll need them afterwards!
author: Yuchi W.

description:
The burgers were not only extremely delicious (no complaints whatsoever) they were so quick, too! I ordered and went to the bathroom quickly before my order arrived and when I came out, my food was ready and waiting for me. I wouldn't recommend the bleu cheese if you're into cheesy burgers, couldn't really taste it much but definitely no big and not important to the overall flavor or experience of the food/burger. 
  The burger was served about medium/ medium rare or so and it was perfect. Added an over easy egg plus bacon and oooh. Superb. Not to mention some of the best garlic fries I've ever tried. They really nailed those. Overall, I think they have the potential to blow your mind - or at least your tastebuds. If your experience is less intense, you will at least leave satisfied, for certain. At least try it once. I know I'll be back!
author: Shannon C.

description: Love this Super Duper chestnut location. They have everything: seating inside, seating outside, seating at the bar. It is always clean and well stocked. Asian looking cashier seems to be happy by singing songs that plays on a radio and joking with the cooks. She always give special attention to the kids that looks professional and at the same time caring. I will be definitely come back to this place and enjoy my garlic fries, mini burger and milk shake
author: Ilmia N.

description:
Can I get an "Amen" for those cheesy garlic fries? Not religious? How about a "Yeehaw!" Good compromise, I think. 

The burger was good! I didn't get that waiting-under-the-heating-lamp-for-someone-to-order-me taste. It's pretty simple so nothing new to report. The stars in my opinion were the fries. Geez, I love cheese. I love garlic. I love fries. Why no one thought to put it together before is beyond me. And if it's already been done, then they do it best cause I could eat that all day. Granted this probably isn't the best date night food considering the amount of garlic you'll consume... BUT! Think about this: if the date goes well, y'all can swap spit AND gum at the same time! Another good compromise, I think. 

I'll be back!
author: Abigail D.

description: This was the second time my girlfriend and I went to a Super Duper Burgers location, the first being on Market Street. Our first time was really lackluster and did not live up to the hype we got from some friends. But this time was different. The line went by quickly and we got our food pretty quickly too. We also had some good seats and could see everything being cooked. We both got a super duper burger and fries. The burger was actually one of the best I'd ever had. The patties were the best and everything else on the burger was really great. I'm not sure what was different but the burgers were so much more memorable this time. When I finished my burger I didn't want to keep eating my french fries because I didn't want the taste of the burger to go away. The one thing I'd complain about is their fries. They didn't seem fresh and we could see the big bags of frozen (?) fries they used. I really want to give this place a 5 but the fries were so lacking compared to the burger. Can't wait to come again for the burgers though.
author: Kevin D.

description:
In my opinion Super Duper is high in the running for best burger in the city. 

Burgers are super juicy and flavorful, and the soft-serve is never a miss either. 

Also they have a open soda machine which for me is an A+.

The only down side to every Super Duper location in the city is I can never find parking.
author: Forrest S.

description: It's a Super Duper. It's good. However... I went to the bathroom. Left my large coffee and OJ on the table. I came back. My large coffee and OJ were gone. I talked to them. They gave me my OJ but they said "I can't help you with the coffee. We're out of coffee." In the end, who cares. They have to deal with shitty people every day, especially in the Marina. That being said, I paid for a coffee because I wanted to drink a coffee.  It was a full cup of coffee and OJ. Why throw that away? I was in the bathroom. I had to pee. Is that a crime?
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description:
Very tasty! Hubby and I both had a bacon cheeseburger with jalepenos and garlic fries. Really filling and lots of flavor. Kinda like old school drive-in burgers, but way higher quality. Prices were reasonable but not super cheap either. Customer service was 5 stars, everyone was very friendly and fast. I also really enjoyed sitting outside to eat & having them come out with the order instead of having to stand and listen for my number to be called. 

Definitely reccomend for a quick and tasty lunch!
author: Mama S.

description:
Awesome place!!! These are probably the best restaurant burgers that I have ever tasted!! The beef was seasoned to perfection, the sauce was awesome and the lettuce was fresh and crispy. The fries were just as crispy as i like them, they just needed more salt, but that's something all American restaurants have in common. ;) 
It you want burgers - this is the place to go!!!
author: Elsebeth P.

description:
A really good looking burger restaurant. A simple menu that does it right. The price is fair for the better quality ingredients. The line builds up very quick and the service is positive as well. I ordered the Bacon cheeseburger with everything(onions, pickles, tomatoes, secret sauce, and lettuce) with a side of the garlic fries.

Bacon cheeseburger - The sesame seed bun is point point. The medium cooked burger was nice and juicy. Everything seemed to balance well. A great job on the burger.

Garlic fries - if you love lots of garlic then you'll enjoy these garlic fries. I was hoping they would be a bit more crispy. They smelled and tasted amazing though. Highly recommended. Make sure you have a breathe mint afterwards.

Recommendation: Bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries.
author: Andy N.

description: Good customer service really shows at this Super Duper. Victor, Vicky, Annie - everyone is really awesome! As a regular customer since I work on the street, I love how they all remember me, which really creates a nice welcoming sense of community. Plus, no Super Duper does garlic fries as well as this one! Thank you for always welcoming me into your store! :)
author: Aaron G.

description:
We were drinking, so I don't remember much.  I do remember that they served beer (YAY!) and the guy at the counter convinced me to get garlic fries. And they were REALLY garlicy. To the point I thought for sure I'd need an entire pack of altoids to combat it. But those garlic fries were so, soooooo good. 

Don't remember my burger - I'm sure it was great!
author: Pam D.

description:
These are delicious burgers. Wow def worth the hype. We ordered to Super Duper Burgers (one with bacon) and two fries. The burger was cooked a medium with just the right amount of grease to heighten the flavor. The fries had a perfect crisp and the trio dipping sauces worked out as well. Though I'd skip the mayo dip, not that much flavor as the other two. I am sad we didnt have the chance to order a shake or the chocolate dipped cone but there is always next time. FOR SURE next time :) 

Side note: eat there. We got ours to go and the lady packing up our food dropped half of fries on the tray and never bothered to replace them. Bummed since we paid full price for half an order of fries.
author: Bri R.

description:
It's prob the best "fast food burger" in Nor Cal.  Kind of expensive compared to a Big Mac but it tastes like ambrosia compared to the Big Mac (no tastes taste)....especially if you order bacon and a fried egg on it.  So so good.

Also order the cookies and cream milk shake. It's definitely worth it.
author: Edward M.

description: Friendly and fast service.  Low key atmosphere.   Food is great.  Burgers made to order.  Try their homemade pickles.  Milkshakes/malt are tasty but a bit pricey for what you get.  Some times gets really busy and crowded.
author: David H.

description:
Came here with my bf on a Friday night. It was pretty crowded. Glad we were able to get a table! They have a bar but I didn't want to sit there.

I ordered the mini combo meal which includes a burger with a single patty, fries, and a drink. The food came out promptly. Everything about this meal was super duper! The burger was good and cooked perfectly. They had homemade pickles at the bar and they were soo good. I stuffed three pickles into my burger. The fries were also well salted. What really had my mouth watering was the vanilla milkshake!! I think it was made fresh because you can tasted the vanilla bean! I wish I didn't have to share it with my bf. haha. 

Would love to come back! Parking was hard to find though!
author: Cathie N.

description: This place was great. Greasy buns on the burgers (not a complaint). Very flavorful burgers and quick service. They did go a little overboard with how much garlic they put on their fries, it was literally burning my nostrils. Otherwise a spot worth checking out
author: Philip T.

description:
Working in the area, my co-worker and I stumbled upon this burger joint.  Menu offerings aren't huge. If you don't eat beef (like me) or is a semi-vegan then you're lucked like (again, like me).  

Ordered the garlic fries.  Pretty tasty it was, but it would taste even better if it's freshly prepared from the deep fryer instead.
author: Chi T.

description:
I went to Super Duper Burgers with some friends on a Tuesday evening. The restaurant was small and had lots of groups of friends and families packed inside, but that wasn't necessarily a bad thing since it added to its charm. 

I got a small burger with everything except the "secret sauce" and avocados and a vanilla shake. The service was very fast, which was great since I was so hungry! 

The burger I got was great! The patty was cooked but not too much (medium rare, as the restaurant states), and all of the fillings k got tastes fresh. It was a delicious burger that I devoured quickly. The vanilla shake I got was fantastic- super creamy! The fries were a bit salty, which some may not like, but I didn't mind. They just needed ketchup. 

Overall Super Duper was a completely satisfying and delicious experience, and I would definitely recommend a visit with your friends or family!
author: Lucy C.

description: Enjoyed the Super Burger with Cheese. As you took each bite the cheese melted in your mouth! Garlic fries were very tasty! My wife tried veggie patty and was raving about how tasty it was. She was glad it wasn't the usual bean patty. Only negative they are bit pricey.
author: Anil L.

description:
I wish we had a Super Duper Burger up here in Seattle.  My sister took my daughter and I here because my daughter was hungry.  It's a quick burger joint.  Come in, order your food and sit down or take it to go.

We didn't order much since we had dinner plans later on in the evening so my sister and I shared the veggie burger and my daughter had the mini burger with cheese and shared the garlic fries.  Everything we ordered was delish! Seriously, go and get those garlic fries if you're ever at Super Duper Burgers. 

This place is a great lunch spot and if you're looking for something quick.  All organic grass fed beef and vegetarian options.
author: Chau D.

description: We have just encountered a god amongst veggie burgers! Bow down in reverence to its succulent juicy crunchynees! The garlic fries were insanely tasty. Yelp is amazing, we saw this place had good reviews and we were not disappointed, all expectations exceeded. I want to live here.
author: Shamsher S.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had! Garlic fries are great too! This is my favorite super duper location, their service is always fast.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Amazing and fresh! This place really makes a super duper burger!!! We just happened to stop in front of this place as we were looking to charge our camera battery...lol! And being hungry travelers decided to sit in and get a quick bite as they so graciously let us charge our dead camera battery before we got to the bridge...! Needless to say it must've been fate to find an empty parking spot in the middle of the afternoon in San Fransisco...but this place was amazing the burgers were juicy and perfectly made to order...my hubby ordered the "super duper with the works and an fried egg on top...OMG...talk about burger heaven!! The chicken sandwich with chipotle aioli- 10 points!!! My very picky son who does not like a lot of things enjoyed their chicken as well! Garlic fries were the bomb and to finish off... the ice cream made us feel like kids again!!! A lot of good food for not a lot 
$$ can't ask for more than that!!!
author: Sophia W.

description:
So, Super Duper Burgers is middle of the road for me. I'm not a huge Umami Burger fan, and nothing tops In N Out, but I was happy and pleased with my meal here.

Watching my wallet and waistline, I ordered a Mini burger and a fountain soda, no fries. The delicious, fresh, homemade pickles (FREE!) they keep by the drink station piled high in a paper dish were my side dish. And you KNOW I am 100% okay with pickles as a side dish. These pickles are of the dill variety, a little sour and not too salty. 

The burger arrived hot and fresh - they come with lettuce, tomato, red onion, and special sauce but you can also add other toppings for a fee. Mine came sans onions and was packed with flavor for the small size. At first I thought it wouldn't be enough food, but for those with smaller appetites, eyes-bigger-than-stomach syndrome the Mini burger will do just fine - it was filling by the end!

Something I really liked about Super Duper is that they make it easy to compost all of your waste. They keep only a compost bin by the bus-it-yourself station and all of your leftover food (yeah right) and wrappings, etc. can go in. The metal trays and glasses go in another bin and you're on your way! Something I wasn't a huge fan of was how close together the indoor tables are...I felt like every time I or a neighboring table got in and out  that my a$$ or someone else's a$$ was hovering over the table. Other than that, I would totally come back here for a tasty burger.
author: Liz G.

description:
This place is hit or miss! I order the same burger every time! Sometimes, I get a solid burger! Sometimes, the burger is not so much! For example, the last time I was there my burger was way, way undercooked! Ever bit into a barely cooked burger? Yuck! :( 

I don't know why they can't do it the same every time! But a place that makes hundreds of burgers a day should be consistent! I think from now on I'll get my burger fix somewhere else! Sorry guys! When your on you satisfy and when your off, I just feel like I waste my time and money! I need the consistency!!
author: Andrew M.

description: Perfect burgers everytime. They have complimentary water from a separate fountain. It's not cold. That's the only downer. Burgers are juicy and flavorful!
author: Mad T.

description:
Great burgers! Bur for $10!

Here I was able to "experience" the environment and enjoyed them. So yes $10 for a burger ...
author: S L.

description: I've been to Super Duper a few times.  The burgers are classic and very tasty.  The garlic fries tore me up and I definitely didn't feel well after. It is a great value compared to other best burger joints in the area.   The last trip, the burger and fries were very greasy.  I'll check em' out again, minus the garlic.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I don't usually rave about burgers, but Super Duper Burgers is a gem.

I came here based on a Yelp suggestion for a quick lunch and my Yelpers were definitely on point with this place. I ordered a Mini Burger with cheese, which is a regular sized burger with one patty, and Garlic Fries.

When my meal came, the first thing I noticed was the packaging. None of that brown paper wrap crap. Super Duper Burgers has customized burger wrappers and I loved the simple designs of them. It is so odd talking about presentation when it comes to burgers, but I loved it. The plate of food came neat and presentable--making me more eager to dig in.

The Mini Burger with cheese was fantastic. The meat was cooked medium and it was just the right portion. I loved that I could actually bite into it, rather than deconstruct it to fit it in my mouth like other places. The products and seasoning they used also made me feel great about eating a burger. Sometimes you leave other establishments feeling guilty or, for the lack of a better word, greasy; but at SDB, I left feeling good about what I ate.

The Garlic Fries are a must. The cook on the fries were just right--not too soft, not too crispy. You can tell they were fresh and it had just the right amount of garlic aioli seasoned on it. If fries were my weakness, then these babies were my kryptonite.

So whether you're a first timer or frequent, I would definitely recommend the Garlic Fries and Mini Burger at Super Duper Burgers. You can bet I'll be coming here on my next visit to SF!
author: Jessica X.

description:
If you're in the mood for a quick burger that'll do you solid and soak up all the dranks you just downed at the bars up the street - then you're at the right place.  

Fair price, relaxed atmosphere and ice cream cone for dessert.

Don't forget to snack on some PICKLES!!
author: Nader A.

description: I love coming here for a burger when I am in the Marina. The burgers and sides are delicious and reasonably priced. I like the Cookies and Cream Milkshake. The French Fries are really good. I hope to return here!!! Good job Super Duper!!!!
author: Will D.

description:
After moving here from LA, I have been on a mission to find good burgers. Super Duper was one of the first places that I wanted to try and I am so glad that I did. It was one of the best burgers I have ever had!

This location was very clean and the workers were really nice as well as quick at moving the line along. I got the Super Burger with cheese and everything on it as well as fries and a lemonade. For a "fast food" burger, it's just amazing... very juicy yet not overly salty like a lot of the other burger joints. I love the fact that you can take as many pickles as you like.

I liked it so much that I ate at another location just yesterday. This location was more organized, though and I would prefer to eat here.
author: Jennifer P.

description: So good!! Juicy dripping burgers. May be a little pink for the meat but still good. One bathroom so it may be a wait for the bathroom. Kid friendly. Not a big place but there are high chairs. Love the garlic fries! A little disappointed in the amount we got for the regular fries but it was good. Clean place too! Love that. We parked at a 30 min street parking a block away and had to go out in more $ but it wasn't that big of a deal. Food took about 15 min to come out. Would definitely go again!!!
author: L M.

description:
We stopped by this place for lunch on a Saturday afternoon, and despite it being prime lunchtime, the line moved really fast and the food was prepared in a very timely fashion. It is like any other fast food place; you walk in, order, grab a table, and wait for your food. In the meantime, you can grab the condiments that you need. My two friends and I ordered three mini burgers (with "everything" on top, meaning lettuce, tomatoes, and onions) and garlic fries to share. The burgers were phenomenal - the meat was extremely juicy. However, the garlic fries were just that -- extremely garlicky and almost too overpowering for me. Next time I come, I will definitely just order the regular fries!

Tip: for those who are driving, there are small parking garages near by, along with street parking, but those can be hard to come by.
author: Hurnan V.

description: Super Duper is sorely underrated.  The garlic parmesan fries are so addictive, and the complimentary homemade pickles are spicy and flavorful.  If they sold those pickles by the jar, I'd definitely buy them!  The burgers are solid, and my only negative critique is that they are on the oily side.
author: Bella C.

description: The super burger was perfect but very messy lol. If your looking for moist mouth watering meal to overindulge...this is the place. The only complaint I would have was that there was to much cheese on the garlic fries and not enough garlic seesoning. Overall great food and price wasn't so bad for being in the city.
author: Abraham M.

description:
This place makes excellent burgers. And I'm not saying that casually. It was like...top five burgers of my life.

To elaborate: the meat! I'm so used to eating bland, boring hamburger patties. But this tasted like happy cows taste...you could almost envision them prancing through the grass with each bite. The garlic fries looked great, though I didn't try them, and the regular fries were excellent--the perfection of size (approx. In n Out size cut), crispness, and taste. I had zero complaints! They make their own pickles and you have a pretty wide range in which you can customize, including adding eggs, grilled onions, blue cheese, and other sauce options. Hard to go wrong here!

4 stars because I think service could have been a little better, and I sorta wish that they made a shake with soy milk so us unfortunate lactose people could take part in the fun. Otherwise it was great, and I will be eagerly awaiting their expansion to Los Angeles. (Hey, a girl can dream, right?)
author: Lynne S.

description:
Amazing atmosphere & delicious food. Quick and easy, a great place for the family and friends. Bar seating, tables, even outdoor seating! If you want delicious food for about $10, this is a great spot!

The Chicken sandwich was excellent! (I know I am an idiot for not ordering a burger at "Super Duper Burger" but it's bikini season so back off). Also got their garlic cheese fries (whoops). The garlic fries were delicious!!! but I think I can still taste the garlic so this is not an ideal order before a date (learn from my mistakes)

5 stars from me. Will definitely come back soon.
author: Nick S.

description:
The breakfast was horrible. Salty, dry, overcooked, and the coffee was cold. I actually really like their burgers and their service, but it was really bad this morning with the family. 

When I asked if they had decaf coffee they said, "no, but the coffee is weak." Which was true, it was weak Four Barrel coffee which was lukewarm once I added cream.
author: S L.

description: Tasty burger and fries. Milkshakes are good too!
author: Zach B.

description: A friend and I came here to grab burgers as we were hanging out at Crissy field (it's about a 30-min walk away). I thought that it was a little overpriced for fast food ($11.79 for a double burger and a soda). I'm actually not sure how it ended up being that expensive because the cheeseburger was priced at 8.50. However, the burger was delicious and came with lots of great toppings (jalapeño, pickles, grilled onion, tomatoes, lettuce). My friends had the garlic fries and said they were good but potentially not enough garlic. Also, I heard that everything is organic/grass fed so maybe that justifies the price. The service was REALLY fast. I think given a choice between here and In n Out I would choice In n Out, except that the fries were better here.
author: Brooke R.

description: Came here with a bud before doing a bar crawl.  I would say the burgers here are a step up from McDonald's but not even near the quality of Five Guys and a million miles behind the Counter.  If your looking for a semi-quick burger, maybe on par with In-n-Out, then come here.
author: Mike M.

description: I tried their chicken patty with bacon! MMMMM... I also got their chocolate dipped vanilla soft served ice cream. YUM!
author: Ange G.

description: I love the location of this place! It is in the middle of all the action, a good place to go grab a burger on a Friday evening. This is also a good place to go for a real casual date, I guess lol, but I came here with a group of people. We came here after a fun & long day at Crissy Beach (which is only about 10 mins away). Try to get a seat as soon as you can because seating is very limited, maybe have someone order the food & someone else save seas. If you are coming here alone, find someone new to sit next to, make a new friend lol.  SERVICE: The service was good, nothing to complain about & nothing to boast about. FOOD: I ordered a burger with a fried egg in it (I forgot the name). It was good, but I definitely recommend putting the "super duper sauce" on it, it gives the burger an actual flavor. We also got a side of garlic fries, I have had better. Overall, I would come back here again & try and tackle the bigger version of the super duper burger, and maybe try a milkshake.
author: Cherise N.

description: One of the best veggie burgers I've had. And the garlic fries are soooooooooo good. You have to get the 3 sauces too
author: Alex P.

description: YUM!  Not the cheapest, however, the best quality EVERY TIME AND EVERY SUPER DUPER I've visited.  The staff on Chestnut is the least cheery (Castro and Downtown have happier people !) but food always consistent.  Best pickles and love me those fries.
author: stephany m.

description:
My daughter is obsessed with the Brandy Melville store just down the street from Super Duper, so as I was killing time one day, I noticed this pretty happening burger joint. I was in the mood for a burger, so I yelped to confirm the quality of the place and it looked good enough to check out.  The problem was, my wife and daughter were not in the burger kind of mood.  So we went to Crab House on the pier which I didn't complain about. I love that place.

The next day, however, on the way back from an event up North, we stopped in for a burgerlicious bite to eat.

BURGER:  It was very good, but not great. Better than In n Out, yes...but not better than The Counter if you're familiar with that place.

GARLIC FRIES:  Big let down.  Just your average steak fries with a tiny sprinkling of minced garlic.  Sorry, them ain't garlic fries.  And some Yelpers and RAVING about these fries.  WHAT!!  Who are these people?  And how did they get this badly deprived of good garlic fries.  

That's all we had--oh, the pickles were a nice touch, but not outstanding.  Just OK.

Why does it bother me so much that people are going on and on about these garlic fries that just don't rock??  I can only hope that they come across some really tasty garlic fries and then, they will know the truth. :)

Best garlic fries I've ever had, btw, was at Christmas in the Park in San Jose at one of those little catering trucks.  We actually go back every year just for the fries.
author: Darien R.

description: Quick and really delicious. Hard combo to find. This place was so convenient and the burger was cooked perfectly. Delicious, quality fast food. I enjoyed much more than umami burger.
author: Therese M.

description:
Antonio Paganini is building an empire in SF that I think not many people know about. He originally founded then sold Pasta Pomodoro but now has focused on a parallel track of interesting dining. On one hand you have Lolinda, Delarosa, Starbelly, Beretta and other hand you now have these series of Super Duper's cropping up. 

Was looking for some late night eats after seeing a talk and our original pick just closed their kitchen. As we drove around the corner we saw that Super Duper was still open. Headed in with 15 min to spare. Got a burger with bacon, cheese and a huge side of pickles. Meat was flavorful, juicy (the medium by default rocks) and sure hit the spot for a late Sunday.
