I know that there are a few more of these locales setup ready to open across the city and I think they're a welcome addition for those of us who want some quality in an expedient and/or late night manner.
author: Kim N.

description: Great juicy burgers. I recommend adding a fried egg to your burger and their garlic fries are a must! Can be a bit pricey as I don't often pay $10 for a mini burger and fries.
author: Lynn T.

description:
I'm not too worried that I have made it a ritual to eat at Super Duper every Friday night; yes, sometimes even in between. Super Duper's awesome friendly staff & management, superlicious vegetarian burgers (also a portabella mushroom burger that's no longer on the menu but they'll still make for you- that is if they've still got portabella left!), endless homemade pickles, perfectly swirled & curled organic ice cream, tasty garlic fries, upbeat music (from retro soda pop to dance), juicy burgers for my non-veggie family, and quick service without it feeling like "fast-food" has me addicted to this place. 

My favorite has to be the vegetarian burger that is far from nasty boca or gardenburger types, which comes with cucumbers & hummus but you must add-on jack cheese & avocado; filling and superlicious. 

For the meat lovers, they make their burgers juicy medium by default so make sure you specify otherwise if that's not your thing, not every meat should be well done. 

After you've had your burger and you're craving an ice cream swirl, get the kid's size, it's more than enough! The regular swirl is like six inches of ice cream. Well, just go out to Chestnut Super Duper and get in on their yummyness!
author: Mariajose A.

description: First time ever going into a Super Duper Burgers and I was not disappointed. The burgers and fries were extremely delicious and the staff was amazing!
author: Sebastian G.

description: After walking the bridge, we decided to hit up this Super Duper. Quality without the frills. The fries were excellent. The chicken over salad was good. My son devoured the chocolate milkshake and asked for another so I'm going to guess it was pretty tasty.
author: Andrea S.

description:
This is my go-to super duper location. It is close-ish to my house and the staff is always friendly. I usually order the single burger with bacon and cheese. But I have also tried the chicken sandwich, which is also good, but I prefer the burger. 

The milkshakes here are incredible. If you have your milkshake in the restaurant you can also request that it is "spiked" which means they add some Soju to your shake. Doesn't really change the flavor but will help you get a mild buzz.
author: Stephanie T.

description: always Yummy!! best milk shakes but can be a bit of a wait! wish they delivered direct from restaurant delivery services don't always get here with hot/warm food! calling ahead to pick up seems to be the best way to have your Super Duper burgers!! if they had curbside service for pick up orders THat would be Awesome and 5+star worthy!!!!!
author: Adrienne O.

description: I'm usually super critical when it comes to my burgers, but this place has won me over.   Although they are a little too juicy and you have to be careful that it doesn't get all over your clothes - the burgers and fries are some of the best.  Thanks!
author: Edgar C.

description: First time trying this place and gotta say I won't be coming back. The burger was extremely plain and greasy while the milkshake was sub-par.
author: Kyle D.

description: I'm 'deleting' a previous review because the manager responded to say the problem would be fixed and I believe him.
author: Ace s.

description: The customer service here is outstanding! Ordered a to go order and i had to go get food from another restaurant, when that place was closed, i went back to SDB and back in line to order another burger for my friend, the manager let me cut in line. Thxs
author: Pickle R.

description: Not bad for an average, pretty quick burger and fry. Milkshakes make the meal pretty pricey. I was able to beat the lunch crowd. It's not worth the wait when there is a line out of the door. Be sure to know what you want when you get to cashier or be prepared to be received with sass.
author: Ashley J.

description: Always a great place for late night burgers and garlic fries! especially after partying in the city, this is a great stop to diminish the hangover and drunk feeling lol!
author: Allister D.

description: Great Burgers. This place has one of the best burgers I've ever tasted, and I am 67 years old. The fries are great also. A word of advice to those of you who are eating with a partner - the single patty was more than filling. I ordered a mini-burger combo for me and one for my wife. Way too much food. We ended up throwing away almost all of the second order of fries. I should have ordered one order of fries. Bottom line: great burgers and a fun atmosphere to enjoy your burgers.
author: Dan D.

description:
This place has, by fair, the best burgers I've had in a long while. 

I ordered the mini burger with bacon, cheese, and jalapenos. It was AMAZING. Cooked jjust right and the flavors combined in a crazy good way. It stunned my mouth into compliant chewing with no conversation.

We also got the garlic fries (which the cashier messed up on so we had to order again). They weren't quite as good, as the garlic wasn't very potent. But it wasn't bad.

I also tried the free pickles they had near the condiments. It was unusual tasting, but delicious. 

I would definitely come back to this place for a good burger when in SF.
author: Melanie P.

description:
Really good burger, crispy fries, and fast service. Unlimited pickles are also a huge win for me!
Honestly, my favorite part was the lemonade. It was perfectly tart, honey sweetened and just what I needed.
author: Flora R.

description: First time at this location. Came here Tuesday night with my peeps. Food was boooomb as usual, but this review is mostly a shout out to the girl that took our orders, brought us our food, and our side of ranch (which she didn't have to do at all). Super nice, super caring, big smile, and a gorgeous ponytail braid! If you're reading this, you are the best! But no shout out to the tall guy that completely ignored us when we walked in before we were saved by girl with braided ponytail :D We'll be back again soon!
author: Jenn H.

description:
To be clear - I'm actually a fan of Super Duper...just not this particular location...

The first time I tried Super Duper was about a year ago at their downtown location.  I had heard a bunch of good things about them, and they all turned out to be (mostly) true.  Between my mini burger, the garlic fries, and the service, there wasn't much not to like.  In fact, the worst part of the experience was meeting my friend at the wrong location!  Whoops.

Hoping for more of the same, I copied nearly my entire order - a Mini Burger with Jack Cheese and a side order of Garlic Fries.  Unlike last time though, my burger fell short.  The patty didn't seem as juicy or tasty as before, and the burger on the whole just felt dry and overdone.  The only thing that kept the whole meal from being a total bust was the side of Garlic Fries.  They were just as good as I remember!  Each fry was cooked to the perfect crispiness, and there was a ton of aged cheddar cheese.

Super Duper - even though this trip was a bit of a let down, I can forgive you since you were so good the first time around.  I'm sure you'll see me again, although it's 50/50 whether it will be at this location since parking is such a pain.  Just don't let me down again.
author: Mike L.

description:
Dude..............................................

Ok my boyfriend and I randomly came here for dinner and omg................................

I had 0 expectations but everything was so good ESPECIALLY THE GARLIC FRIES.
I would eat this over In n Out and The Habit any day.
author: Alice H.

description:
After hearing great things about Super Duper Burgers, my friends and I stopped by after a day at Fort Mason. I ordered the mini burger -- which is not so mini -- garlic fries, and a beer. You can customize your burger, and it was happy hour so the fries were FREE! I ended up getting the burger with everything on it, and I added an egg. 

Overall the burger wasn't anything special. It was kind of greasy, and there was nothing extraordinary about it.  I actually enjoyed the garlic fries more than the burger. Garlic fries were crispy topped with garlic and parmesan cheese -- delicious. If I had to pick between Super Duper (more of an up-scale burger place) vs. In-N-Out (fast food burgers), I would pick In-N-Out.
author: Sandy K.

description: Super Duper Disappointed today. Burger was dry, fries were cold, I was going to finish meal and write it off to a bad day until I found a hair in my fries. This place has fallen a far way from what it was - do yourself a favor and stay away.
author: Justine L.

description:
One of my favorite locations since it's close by my highschool. Although the burgers are on the pricey side in comparison to Burger King and McDonald's, you can tell they're made of higher quality. 

-Unlimited soda refills & basically everything is self-serve

-Good area to be in (around boutiques & stores) 

Warning: Addictive burgers & fries are filling n__n
author: Erica K.

description: This was my go to spot for lunch but went in today 11/22/15 finally ordered the chicken sandwich waited 20 minutes for no problem they were busy I understand got it go back to the shop to eat and about to take a bite and it was hair in my damn sandwich went got my money back and I'm done with that place
author: Eddie L.

description:
Oh Super Duper, how I love thee so. I came upon Super Duper before I lived in San Francisco while strolling along Chestnut and now it's definitely my go-to burger spot, especially if I'm a little hungover and I'm craving something greasy and tasty! The first time I came here was with my ex boyfriend, who was super picky and annoying when it came to food, and even he loved it! This place is the best!

I always get the mini burger, which is more than enough burger for me (add cheddar cheese, avocado, and sometimes if I'm feeling extra naughty- bacon!) The "Super Sauce" they put on their burgers is "super" delicious! The burgers are always juicy and flavorful and taste fresh. My sister and I split the garlic fries usually, and their garlic fries are probably some of my favorite in the city (after AT&T park's of course). They use grass fed beef and organic ketchup, which is cool with me! Their chicken burger is also a tasty option, but honestly unless they run out of beef or you're a vegetarian, just stick with the burger. Organic ice cream cones to finish off your meal! 

The staff here at the Chestnut location is the nicest of all the Super Dupers in my opinion. Parking can be a bit of a headache sometimes, but it's Chestnut so it's expected. The burgers are also a little pricy once you add a drink and fries + tip, but I think they're worth the extra cost!
author: Courtney Anne N.

description:
This is what I call a good burger! We heard about the place from a couple of friends. 

"Better burgers than the average" But man, these burgers are good! Don't miss it, if u want an extraordinarily burger experience :) 

Even the fries were amazing! 

Go there!!
author: Filip A.

description: Amazing burger place in SF.Yummy and great service!Burgers always fresh,homemade pickles.Delicious ice cream. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone who likes burgers!
author: Darmidon 7.

description: I love this location mainly because the line goes by super quick. All I can say is what others say which is their burgers are so juicy and really authentic tasting. Ive also gotten 2 milkshakes: double chocolate chip and Oreo. They are so good! And they're organic lol the service here is awesome too. Everyone is really nice and super quick. Can't wait to go back soon!
author: Shan M.

description:
Super Duper is prettay prettay prettay tasty. It's really hard to get me to complain about a burger, being the beefophile that I am, but these burgers are a tad on the greasy side. This makes for yummy eats, but with a bit of self-loathing thrown into the mix, especially when you're forced to watch all the Marina lasses walking around in their yoga pants, making you feel like you should be working out instead of scarfing down this greasy burger (they're not actually working out themselves, but by constantly donning those Lululemons, they'll remind you of working out and the complete lack of which you are currently doing as you wash down the grease ball with your delicious milkshake). But hey, if you're not worried about those things, eat away to your little bloated heart's content!

The garlic fries are a little TOO garlicky for me, but I am completely outnumbered in this regard. If you love garlic, then you will looooove their garlic fries as do all of my friends.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
Not sure I get the hype, then again I'm not that big into burgers. 

Came here based on the reviews and hype this place gets.  And its so so.  

The meat is great, very well put together, however everything else around the burger is pretty so so. 

For a little more I would suggest trying Umami burger down the road.  Or if you not that picky, there's this one joint that heard is also amazing, I believe its called In-N-Out (note sarcasm).
author: Maggie F.

description: this is my favorite new burger joint. i love there garlic fries and there shakes are too die for. this is the first time i have  every finish there burgers i love there food.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
As my sister and I were hanging out, we stumbled upon this fast-food style burger joint. Their menu was simple just as their burgers. But do not confuse simple with plain. The burger was full of flavor, and very juicy. I had my burger with "everything on it" which included cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, onions (I got the grilled instead of the red), and super sauce. We also had their garlic fries which were definitely garlicky, and that's the way I like it. We also opted to order the 3 sauces which include a chipotle mayo, house mayo, and super sauce. 

All in all, this place definitely satisfied the burger craving I didn't even know I had! Yum!
author: Richard J.

description: Love this place. Homemade pickles, fresh ingredients and friendly staff. Did I mention it's super affordable?!  The only downfall is it's hard to find a table because it's so tiny.
author: Gretchen G.

description: Came in excited on a Sunday night expecting delicious smells of meat and fries and was bombarded with the smell of ass and dirty mop bucket juice and glazed looks from the staff. Yuck.
author: Tommy G.

description: Organic all natural beef patties. Burgers are juicy and on the tasty side. I will be back when I come back to town!
author: Roger T.

description: Don't come here. The service is horrible I waited over 30 minutes for a dozen donuts that I saw sitting in the window the whole time I asked twice about it they told me to hold off rude inconsiderate stay away from this place!
author: Thomas S.

description:
Finally came to the Super Duper burgers near me after having a stellar experience at the one near the movie theater downtown. But damn, this one was just not nearly as good! I got a 'small' burger with side of garlic fries, because that's what I got at the other one that was so good. This one had very little flavor, was completely doused in sauce, and the burger itself was so greasy that it splooged itself into my lap and onto my pants several times. The fries were soggy and did not stand up to the garlic. Pickles were still good, but I swear they were better at the other place! The layout of this is not conducive to the crowd either.

Won't return to this one, will return to the other one.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Despite all the awesome locals making really rude comments as we were waiting in line for Super Duper Burger, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. We were here after the 75th anniversary of GGB which explains the line, but the restaurant was top notch in handling all the crowds honestly and getting orders out on the fly.

We didn't end up waiting too long, and once we ordered it seems like the food didn't take very long after. The burger was definitely juicy and greasy, I think those two don't have to be the same thing but they're pretty much the same thing here. The meat was well flavored and the burger was pretty good.

I did feel somewhat deceived since I asked for "everything" but not "everything" came in my burger. Apparently pickles and jalapeños are ... on the side? I didn't like to have to deconstruct my super greasy burger to add the ingredients so I left them out.

The garlic fries are good, actually, the fries in general are pretty bomb here. I don't know what it is, but they have great flavor and they're just the right amount of crisp versus potato-ey. A+ for their beer selection for such a small place and I will definitely be back.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
I would have given it 5 stars but the price increase kinda sucks, and I think their shakes are way over priced. I love love love the mini cheese burger, the proportions are absolute perfection. The regular burger does not quite make the mark, for some reason the same quality is missing, must be something about the distribution of parts to the whole, or else the bun on the mini burger is far more superior. I also and in love with the Strauss soft serve. So yummy. The place is always clean, and the staff is pretty friendly, despite having to work in the marina...
Wow, I am hungry now....
author: Nicole H.

description:
Super duper good Super Duper burgers! It's juicy, fresh, tasty, and just darn good! 
Add some cheese, bacon, jalapenos... Mmm!

PS. Try the garlic fries! They're pretty darn good too!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Wow.. wasn't expecting all that much from this place but the veggie burger blew me away. Top it off with avocado and cheese and some pickle and you're in burger heaven.

The lemonade was perfect to wash the burger down with and the price was right. Overall, pretty fantastic. 

Only thing they could have done better would have been to offer my dog some water. It was super hot outside, and he was clearly pretty thirsty. That would have been over and beyond, but regardless, 5 stars for super duper burger.
author: Gowri R.

description: If I can ,I will give 4.5star, I come this restaurant a lot ,it is amazing, so so so good, the beef is juicy, high recommend the garlic fries, I am sure u will love it
author: Sarah B.

description:
In-n-Out used to be my favorite burger joint. Super Duper Burgers just took over. I think this chain has destroyed all other beef burgers for me. Specialty burgers like Buffalo Burgers at Bullshead or Ostrich Burgers at (anyone know of place in SF that sells them at a reasonable price?) don't count.

These burgers are juicy. They melt in our mouth, unlike In-N-Out. Additionally, they sell garlic fries (w/ cheese)! But, I feel like there isn't enough garlic or the cheese overwhelms the garlic. Comparing the garlic fries at the Giant's AT&T stadium to Super Duper's garlic fries, I believe the one at the Giant's stadium is at a higher level than Super Duper.

I've been to the Marina location, the Castro location, the Metreon location, and the one near 2nd/Market. I think the Marina location is the best.
author: M L.

description:
After rocking the SF RnR half marathon on Sunday, we were craving burgers. Surprisingly, Super Duper Burgers opened at 10:30AM. I ordered the mini cheese burger with everything and requested medium rare. I couldn't resist ordering some garlic fries and a pint of craft beer to wash everything down. 

We sat on the counter and started munching on some ridiculously good homemade pickles. The burgers arrived and everything looks good. I am not a big fan of sesame buns but the burger was still made very well. It was so juicy and dripping all over my fingers. The garlic fries was decent, wished it had more garlic. 

I wouldn't hesitate to stop by for a quick bite if I am in the neighborhood.
author: Kien M.

description:
Burgers are pretty darn good but on the greasy side. I can only see myself eating here once every couple weeks because of how greasy the burgers are. But it's a freakin good burger if you're in the mood for one. Easily beat $16 burgers I have had in restaurants and super duper burgers cost only $5 each!

Their garlic fries are one of the best I have had as well. They are not cheap with the garlic.

Chocolate strawberry shake was not good at all. It was melted really bad. I mean it tasted like flavored milk almost. On top of that the chocolate completely over powered the strawberry. I will never order that shake ever again. 

What kept them from getting 5 stars is the greasy level of the burgers and the horrible milk shake.
author: Ted V.

description: Besides the pickles, everything was sooo good it was our first time here and we will be back when ever We in San Francisco !
author: Miz A.

description:
This place has DELICIOUS veggie burgers and garlic fries. They even have soju infused shakes. Supposedly most everything is organic and locally grown; all of the accoutrements are compostable too. However, their service is far from cordial. I always feel like they are just doing the bare minimum to get by, not going above and beyond to make you feel welcome. If their HR planned to only hire ambivalent hipsters, then they nailed it.

One time I ordered a veggie burger, walked all the way home, and when I was ready to eat realizes that they gave me a meat burger. I'm a vegetarian so let's just say I was less than pleased.
author: Olivia F.

description:
We were shopping on Chestnut and it was getting well past lunch. Usually when visiting town I research religiously to pick just the right place, but we were hungry and the burgers looked good. We weren't wrong.

The burgers are well done which I like best. The bun is the perfect texture and the fries are fresh. We didn't realize there were several locations, it might be a chain but their quality is obviously high, even though they have expanded to numerous stores. I can't wait to get back!
author: Mike K.

description:
Came from doing a study at UCSF and had a few hours to explore before I had to go into work. I originally wanted to go to Squat and Gobble, but it being Sunday, of course everybody and they mamas was there! So I trekked on to find a good hearty meal, and I stumbled upon Super Duper burger. I've been seeing it all over peoples IG's lately, and I was like whaaaaaaaat! COOOOOOOL. So I got in line, ordered a mini cheeseburger with garlic fries and the 3 sauces totaling to about $12

The mini cheeseburger was good. I'm not much of a burger connoiseur, and I don't usually crave or prefer burgers, so my opinion on the burger should not be too heavily weighed. It was good, don't get me wrong, but it didn't blow my socks off. Maybe if I had added bacon, it would have. Actually, Im sure it would have. But that's what I knocked one star off for. Anyhoo. The garlic fries.

THE GARLIC FRIES.

Are amazeballs. The best garlic fries I've had. I'm gonna say it.... they might even be better than the ones at AT&T Ball Park. There aren't actually pieces of garlic in it, so I'm guessing the oil they cook it/smother it with is just pure garlicky goodness. 

The sauces that you pay $1.50 extra for, skip on dat. It aint necessary.

But the GARLIC FRIES...Yes. Just Yes.
author: Kathleene E.

description: later evening weekday visit...paying for a meter space in parking garage across the street even at night...small diner feel...counter seating with open kitchen behind...small set of tables off to the side near bathroom...two mini-burger (single patty) combos with some upgrades...garlic fries, cheese for one and egg for another...$twenty-five meal for two...self-serve soda fountain...grabbing napkins and condiments...same great tasting pickle wedges and getting more...burger and fries delivered...sloppier presentation and food compared to other locations...egg fried over medium...still enough yolk to squirt, but not the perfect sunny side egg expecting...still a good burger, but little more greasy...fries slightly overcooked and harder outer...market street super duper location is bigger, busier and bustling, but seems to churn out better burgers and fries....
author: Hen A.

description: I come for the ice cream and have had 3 consecutive delicious vanilla and chocolate dipped cones.  This time my husbands choc/choc dip was creamy and wonderful. However, the choc/vanilla was NOT. Oh, the chocolate dip coating was still yummy but the vanilla ice cream was sugary and not very creamy. What a disappointment:( Don't they taste test?
author: Halina Y.

description:
One of the best burgers I've had in a long time! Would highly recommend getting the cookies n cream milkshake, too! 

Service was excellent!
author: M W.

description:
For the people who didn't give this place at least 4 stars, you either came on a bad day or the universe was aligned that day to give you a poor experience.

That cheeky disclaimer out of the way, I was genuinely impressed by how tasty a hipster burger could be at a affordable price. The burger was messy but not in a  disgusted sort of way, as the meat was prepared medium/medium-rare the goodness just  poured out in a very carls jr. it belongs in my face sort of way. The portion of the combo is nice and very well when paired with one of their beers, assuming you drink.

The staff once again is what pushed that 5th star through, with polite warm service that was prompt and at one point the store manager came over asking how it was. He stopped not just browsed by to make eye contact and wanted feedback on the quality of this establishment. That ownership means a lot and it reflects in the way things are run at that location. 

My only gripe might be the napkins not at the table or more importantly a bigger beer selection !!! Only three light beers, where is the love for Guinness type men like myself? Minor slights aside really enjoyed this place and look forward to coming again.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Yes, I go to burger joints like this and order chicken. Judge away.
M Burger in Chicago? Yes, I refer to it as M Chicken.
Epic Burger in Chicago? Yep, Epic Chicken.
So I'm sure you can tell that Super Duper Burgers will from here on out be thought of as Super Duper Chicken, as well.

Chicken sandwich was great... fresh, hot & the fries it came with were really delicious. I wanted a shake but I was trying to behave myself. I instead opted for a bunch of those pickles out of the jar. Spicy! But delicious. Man-friend had the burger & scarfed it down.

A little pricey, a little slower than expected, but worth the wait. Good stuff.
author: Karen C.

description:
How does this place only have 3 stars?? The burger was SO cheap...$4.50!  But you HAVE to add BACON and CHEESE....AND get garlic fries.  Seriously, the burger looks mistakenly small, it's actually the perfect size and DE-LISH!

PLUS, super cute waiter alert (+1star)
author: Liz W.

description: One of the best burgers Ive ever had! I got the mini combo which comes with a 1/4 lb burger, fries and a drink! The burger is cooked medium but I ordered mine medium well and it was perfect, they have three types of cheeses to choose from for an extra .50 cents, I ordered the garlic fries instead of regular fries for no extra charge, the fries come topped with cheese theyre very good! The staff was very nice! Definitely recommend it!! 2 mini combos with cheese cost $23.
author: Nansi R.

description: Great, solid burger with fresh ingredients you can taste.   Fries and shakes aren't too shabby either.
author: Chris B.

description:
This is some quality fast food!  I came here with a few friends who had already tried it.  It reminds me of In-N-Out with the Boudin-style order number system.  The service is pretty quick.  I ordered the Super Burger with grilled onions and a portobello mushroom and fries.  Their fries are so delicious!  Perfectly crisp on the outside and not too greasy.  Huge fan of these.  The burger was juicy and cooked just right.  It's a messy meal, but worth it!

My friend ordered the three sauces for the fries: super sauce, chipotle, and homemade mayo.  They were all pretty good, but I liked the homemade mayo the best.  One interesting item on the menu is the option of spiking your milkshake!  So if you want a little something-something in your milkshake, it's $1.50 for some vodka.
author: Can C.

description:
Super Duper: "My milkshake brings all the boys to the yard, and they're like, it's better than yours. Damn right, it's better  than yours. i can teach you but I have to charge."

Me: "uh-K....well then, how much?"

Super Duper: "$4.75 for reg and $5.75 for super."

Me: "make it super-duper!"

What??! It's that em-effing good. How? they use Strauss Organic soft serve. The burgers are good but for me the soft serve ice cream is the star. Have it in a cone dipped in quality chocolate or in a milkshake, know why? Cuz it brings all the boys to the yard!
author: Michelle B.

description:
ok,  stop, don't bother going anywhere else for a hamburger.  I am a TOTAL foodie,  not a big burger lover at all, but these burgers don't get any better.  The mini burger really shouldn't be called mini because it's plenty big.  The reason the burger is killer good is the quality of ingredients even down to the lettuce and bun,  The meat is seasoned perfectly, crazy juicy, and cooked to perfection.  If you want to make this burger insanely good,  order it with an egg on top, to die for!!  I challenge anyone find as good of burger for under $10 anywhere.  

btw, I never take the time to write a review unless something is  really bad or really good, trust me, this place rocks!
author: karen e.

description:
K and I had lunch here after our Photo-Friday outing. K said his chicken was cooked perfectly, and so was my bacon cheeseburger.  We both had garlic fries and they were loaded with garlic and shaved cheese.  But what made this a real 4 star lunch--they make their own pickles, and they were so good I when back for seconds. The restaurant was in luck; I did not have a baggy to drop even more pickles in to take home.

It was warm enough to sit outside and enjoy our lunches and the busy sidewalk. I don't think I would enjoy sitting inside, the interior is small and seemed very noisy.
author: Terry T.

description: Tried for the first time today, the day after Thanksgiving. While there was a line it moved fairly fast. The Super Duper burger with cheese and bacon was juicy and delicious. Also ordered a chicken sandwich to go and they kept it on the warming shelf until I was ready. The outlet was busy but I was able to find a seat at a small high table. The chicken sandwich was also delicious.
author: Michael B.

description:
Imagine if an in-n-out burger tasted more "gourmet" and was maybe a little greasier. What do you get? Super duper burger!

That's how I would describe a super duper burger in a nutshell. Could be a good thing or bad thing depending on your taste, but for me, I really liked super duper. Between the regular fries and garlic fries, I'd recommend the regular fries. The garlic taste is very strong on the garlic fries and may not be suitable for the casual garlic enthusiast.
author: Allen K.

description: This place is great. Simple menu (burger, double burger, chicken sandwich, salad, ice cream, shakes) any everything I've tried was delicious. It isn't my all time favorite, but it is a great go-to dinner option. I enjoy that you can add avocado or a fried egg to your burger, and the house made pickles are amazing. It's a good place to get a quick bite - nothing fancy, but it doesn't need to be.
author: Samantha W.

description: Veggi burger + cheese + avocado, vanilla shake and garlic fries are to die for. service is too fast
author: Abhishek G.

description:
After noticing friends' FB posts with mouth watering pics of stacked burgers from Super Duper, my lady and I headed to SF with visions of next level Americana. 

What I got was a crazy huge burger I could not wait to devour. Once I picked it up though, the lust went to disgust. A puddle of grease surrounded my double burger (2 4oz patties). Tons of grease dripped off the burger and I showed my woman. She was grossed out and made that sour face that pretty women make. The thing looked incredible with avocado, bacon, and cheddar but unfortunately tasted incredibly average. Nothing really noteworthy here, just all size. Flavor wise a huge disappointment. The sauce is mostly mayo and ultimately a waste of calories. I was thinking I'd rather have In and Out or The Golden State in LA. 

Oh well, sad to say crazy overhyped....and way too much grease. Ech!
author: Taj A.

description:
Classic diner burger. Nothing too special about it. We got the Super Duper burger (two 4 oz patties), which seems like a play on the In n Out double double.  Both the burger and fries were average. The draw to Super Duper was more centered around the old school diner decor. There are many better burger joints on Chestnut/in the Marina.

The highlight was the homemade pickles, which are available on a serve yourself basis. They were really good! They let them marinade for 24 hours and then serve them in the restaurant. This makes for really crunchy pickles that you won't find in your ordinary jar of Vlasic pickles.

Super Duper also does a good job of using environmentally friendly products. Compostable (I think) napkins and containers. Brown is the new green.
author: Brian L.

description:
I wanted to love it.  From the outside it looked like a "designy" high quality fast food place a la Shake Shack in NYC - or even the fabled Kopp's in Milwaukee (which, for the record, no one has yet been able to touch in my book).  They even had a huge sign "warning" you that because they cook the burgers medium things could get juicy / messy / something.

But juicy things did not get.

The burger was pink but not juicy.  (I don't even know how this is possible.)  The shakes and cones weren't particularly flavorful either.  Am I just a total complainer?  Or is it that "natural" beef isn't as salty and organic dairy isn't as sugary or something?  Anyway, service was friendly enough and the crowd was pretty cool.  I'll give em another chance next time I'm rockin a popped collar in the marina.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I LOVE Super Duper Burgers on Chestnut!  The food is outstanding!  The ingredients are so delicious and far above other burger places, and you can really taste the difference.  I love that everything is organic, and that the refuse is compostable.

I'd like to give a special shout-out to the stellar employees including Jordan and Gabe.  They are awesome guys.  They are so cool and welcoming, and they really enhance the experience of the customer!

This is the best burger for the price around!
author: Paula M.

description:
Where do I begin? The great garlic fries, awesome tasting burger, or the kill me because now I have finally tasted heaven chocolate dipped vanilla soft serve????

Ok, well let me just get it all out- We came on a Sunday late afternoon, pride weekend, and surprisingly parking was not horrendous. The place was packed when we walked in but again, surprisingly found a spot to sit for the two of us. 

I ordered the mini combo added cheese, avocado, and had all the free fixings. My husband had the super combo and added cheese, avocado, bacon, and all the veggie delights. 

Both of us had to get our own garlic fries. In situations like this it is not necessary or pertinent to share. So we didnt :) 

Food came out fast and pipping hot. Only disappointment was that my patty seemed so small. So tiny in fact that it took me a couple of bites of my burger to get some meat. Only downside. My husband had no complains. NONE. He had googly eyes for his meat. 

Onto dessert. We chose to share. We shouldnt have. A chocolate dipped vanilla soft serve cone. The chocolate tasted like the best ho ho cake chocolate ever!!! Heavenly children dreams come true!! The ice cream was creamy and so delish. 

We will be back. And we will not share!
author: Michelle I.

description: Consistently good, patty and bun. Lemonade too sweet.
author: Inigo M.

description: Super Duper is my go-to place for a quick bite to eat on my lunch break. The veggie burger with jack cheese & avocado is fantastic. They also have a good beer selection, and turned me on to Great White aka "the shark beer".
author: Emma G.

description: Delicious burgers and French fries, nice outdoor seating and fast service despite the ques. Loved it!
author: Mary T.

description: Super duper amazing burgers! A co worker recommended this joint since I was craving a burger. I had a super duper burger which is two patties and meat with fries and a cookies & cream milkshake. I was in heaven! It was so good! They have the option of adding bacon and cheese (do it!) They have plenty of other options including salads, chicken sandwiches, vegetarian options and shakes & cones which I hear their choco dipped cone is popular. All burgers are cooked medium. Try this gem on Chestnut plus they have other locations in the city. My one small gripe is the customer service at the register...some of them are really nice while others don't even say hi when you walk in, they just stare at you until you're ready, but I'd still come here regardless!
author: Jerry C.

description:
Super duper great service,
 to go with those tasty burgers!!!
Def a great place .
Went there on a whim
 first time ever.
I was really impressed with the quality of food and hospitality .
The whole team was awesome .
A Asian " really pretty "
Lady took my order .
And her team followed in the wonderful service .
Thanks guys !!!!!!
Keep up the Super duper greatness!!!!
Alm.
Xxo
author: Mario M.

description: Burger was just OK. For the price and the hype I was expecting to be amazed, but the burger itself was a little greasy and small, and I thought they could have put more if the extras on there. On the whole, it wasn't bad, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.
author: Kristina S.

description: I was visiting San Francisco with my family, and decided to eat at this restaurant. My garlic French fries came with a cockroach on top of them!!! Disgusting! Staff though it fell on the fries from the heating lamp where they place food before it is served to customers. The manager was nice enough to apologize and remove the charge for the meal. However I would not eat there again, and it affected me when I think of other restaurants and how dirty some of them are. Check your fries.
author: Pavel U.

description: My first time trying this place and I was so happy that I took a chance. I ordered the mini bacon cheese burger with the works and garlic fries. The burger was perfectly seasoned and hands down the best garlic fries I ever had. I cannot wait until I can go back again. The house made pickles are so amazing. I'm still thinking about my meal. I cannot wait to come back.
author: Shuvoln H.

description:
As a burger connoisseur I had to check this place out after recently having moved to the neighborhood.  While clearly not a gourmet experience, they do offer decent, if not slightly upscale, diner style fare.

As you would expect from the name, the burger are pretty good.  The meat is tender and they taste fresh, although at times I've found them to be a little too greasy.   They offer a good variety of toppings and the house made pickles are especially good.  The fries are delicious as well, but best consumed quickly as they can get a bit soggy in short order.  

The soft serve ice cream is also good and forms the basis for their shakes and malts.  While advertised as organic, I can't really tell the difference between it and any other soft serve save for the higher price.  In fact if there is a downside to the whole Super Duper experience that's it; the prices are a bit high across the board.  

Another complaint would be the setup for takeout orders.  After standing in a line that stretches out the door if more than 5 people are waiting ahead of you, food orders are picked up from one side of the restaurant and drink orders from the other, requiring you to cut back and forth through that same crowded line.  

Overall I'd say Super Duper offers a solid burger experience at a so-so value.
author: Kit J.

description:
What a soft serve! I'd walked by the Market Street location of Super Duper several times and the soft serve sign is always so tantalizing! Despite that, I never stopped in to try it...until I walked by the new Chestnut Street location.

Woweee! What a soft serve! Clearly they use whole milk or half and half or some cream that's super rich and fatty to make this wonder, because I've never tasted a soft serve so delicious and so HEAVY. I ordered a kid-sized vanilla soft serve in a cone and couldn't even finish that! Trust me, the kid-sized is all you need (or should be eating). It was clearly more than any kid could eat, let alone adult...particularly when it's so rich!

Yummy, but you have been warned: Frequent this place sparingly.
author: Mansi A.

description:
super duper great service at the bar.  beer extraordinary cold.  forgot about the bacon on my daughter's burger and they gave her a few strips on the house and also refilled her kid's shake?  she was very happy.

burger bun was good, beef was juicy and very hot.  awesome spicy pickles.

good all american style burger!
author: Kevin L.

description: Amazing burgers. Garlic fries are a must. Quick service even with a line out the door.
author: Amanda N.

description: Best "bistro" style burger yet. Built, Five Guys, Smashburger, In'n Out, Umami Burger among others, this one has the flavor experience you want in a burger to beat. And, the fries rock.
author: Tristan C.

description:
update 5/22/14
A couple days ago i was contacted by the manager of the Super Duper on Chestnut street and she apologized for the mistake and even sent me a refund+gift certificate. I am really impressed with the promptness of her response as well as her commitment to providing a great experience. :)

5/18/14
Just picked up a burger to go and when i get home i realize it is just a plain burger with no lettuce or tomato. I tried to call them but they had just closed and nobody picked up. Not to mention the burger was super dry.  I've gone to many of their other locations and had a 5 star experience but I won't be coming back here.
author: Seiji K.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever eaten... Fresh, all-natural, and cooked to order. I would recommend to anyone who is a fan of Shake Shack on the East Coast.  This definitely competes!
author: Dave L.

description:
Probably not super duper healthy... but truly super duper juicy burgers that are super duper messy.  I can't see how there's any logical way of getting these to-go...even with a super duper amount of napkins.

Overall Verdict:  Pretty super duper tasty!
author: Justin L.

description:
Great, classic burger! Best option for burgers in Marina.

Note: Not the nicest decor or atmosphere, rather a 'functional fast food restaurant'.
author: Wilhelm F.

description:
After a long ass day of drinking in ukiah, me and my coworkers ended up at this burger joint. Its pretty small, but they have a sick set up. I ordered the mini 4 oz burger with fries. For the price, which was like ten bucks or so, it was a pretty bomb burger. Service was fast, but parking was a bitch, lol

Service - 5 stars
Food - 5 stars

-Ginou
author: Ginou D.

description:
The beef burgers were fresh.the super burger is $7 and cons with 4 simple toppings for free. 
Fries are $2.50 

The place is a clean fast food joint. The burger was a bit greasy and the fries a bit overcooked.
author: Adam W.

description:
First lets talk about the food.
It is super duper good. The food is indeed 5 stars. I got the super burger that came with everything and I added the cheese/bacon (add $1.50). The garlic fries was amazing but the portion was small. The burger was also pretty greasy, but all good thing doesn't come without the mess... You can get some of their homemade pickles too :)

The wait was pretty horrible. Maybe because we came on an event date = line = 30-45mins wait to get our food. I was shocked to even get some seats...I will try the other super duper to see if the line is this bad, probably not...

Definitely worth a try. I waited in LINE and for my FOOD. So no one else should be complaining.
author: Jade L.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had. A must needed stop if your in SF! Everything was so fresh and perfectly made. Fries are bomb too! We need one in Sacramento!
author: Elyzza C.

description: After a night of bar hopping, I was realllly craving a nice juicy, greasy burger. The girlfriend and I decided to come here since it was close to our hotel, I had mixed reactions. The burger itself was good, cooked perfectly and was very juicy. Maybe it just wasn't what I was looking for? I was looking for a big greasy burger that would stuff me up, this didn't do it. It was good and I would recommend to healthy minded eaters, but for me, it just didn't hit the spot.
author: Miguel R.

description:
I seriously love this place and it's walking distance from where I am staying the next couple of weeks. This could be a problem...

The fries are delicious too. Oh, and the ice cream. Yeah, this is definitely going to be a problem. 

Super Duper is threatening my long-time love, In-N-Out, Ut Oh...
author: Susan B.

description: I know that some people are crazy for this place but I didn't like my burger - it did not have a lot of flavor in fact it was too greasy. The fries were great though. The atmosphere is fun, lively plus the place is located in a great location on Chelsea.
author: Ana C.

description: Better than In-N-Out. So juicy and bursting with flavor. The pickles hit the spot and their garlic fries are mouthgasmic. The price at $7 is amazing too. This is my automatic go-to. Love the decor and seating inside too. Also, the guys that work there are incredibly attractive...
author: Ning T.

description: The burgers here come in a greasy mess. A greasy, delicious mess. The Super Duper combo is their version of an In-N-Out double double, but I really dislike places that tack on surcharges for cheese and other condiments. On the flip side, the unlimited housemade pickles are awesome. A combo meal for $11 is a bit on the expensive side. If I'm in the area, I prefer Roam and I definitely would take In-N-Out for half the price. Super Duper is a little late to the sustainable, organic burger fad, but they still get the job done for satisfying those beef cravings.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Never again!  This place should be called Super Shitty ... or how about Super Slow.  I waited over 25 minutes for a burger and fries.  

The service was poor.  

Seating was close to impossible.  I thought I'd get a good burger because the place was packed.  I was soooo wrong.  

You would be better off going to Burger King or any of the other fast food places.

A hockey puck between bread would have been a better meal.
author: Carb Q.

description:
I really don't know why the average rating is 3 stars because this place deserves at least 4 stars. I came here today and this place is awesome. While many restaurants in the marina is pricey, this place was a great deal. 

I came with my friend. She ordered the Super Burger (2 quarter-pound patties) with a side of garlic fries, and I ordered the Chicken Sandwich (100% natural free range chicken breast). When I ordered, I asked for extra lettuce, and the cashier was super nice about it and told me it was free of charge. 

The wait was okay.  My friend and I got to watch the cooks make a lot of fresh-made-by-order burgers. Everything was so fresh. The patties were freshly cooked and not pre-cooked like McDonalds. The fries were freshly fried in small batches.

We got our orders delivered to us by the waitress. The garlic fries were crunchy with grated cheese on top. So yummy! They don't squash the burgers like they do at Burger King or McDonalds. Instead, they only wrap half the burgers so that they are not flattened. My friend loved her Super Burger, and I loved my Chicken Sandwich. The veggies (tomatoes, lettuce, and red onions) were super fresh and moist. Super tasty. 

While my friend and I tried to take pictures, the waiter even offered to take our picture for us. He was super friendly and nice! While we ate, I can see that he was always working, walking around to see which counters need clean up. The workers here are definitely very hard working and friendly.
author: Elise C.

description: Great burgers. What I liked the most were their garlic fries though. The taste is absolutely gorgeous. The place is busy so you may need to wait for a table for a few minutes.
author: PT V.

description:
People told me that this location wasn't as good as their other ones because it was "greasier," but I'm from the south and not afraid of a little grease. Also, if you're eating a cheeseburger, you expect a little grease.

I got a burger with cheese, tomatoes, grilled onions avocado and super sauce , garlic fries and a cookies and cream milkshake. The burger was good (not any more greasy than a normal cheeseburger in my opinion) but there was nothing special about the sauce. The milkshake was really good with a lot of oreo chunks. But the garlic fries were to die for! Super garlicky with shredded cheddar on top, yes PLEASE. I would go back just to get fries. 

Prices are average, service was pretty quick considering how many people were there for lunch.
author: Christine U.

description: Casual place to get a really good burger. It's not a very big burger and you'll need to get a double patty to make it substantial, but I like it a lot better than Umami's burger on Union Street because it's cheaper and the bottom bun doesn't get saturated in grease. Free pickles were nice to munch on while waiting for order, and their soft serve chocolate-vanilla swirl cone is a tasty way to finish off the meal.
author: Ryan E.

description:
I can say this is easily the best burger I've ever eaten.... always get the portobello burger. Sadly, I don't live in SF. Went there once in 2011, and once last month, and the quality hasn't changed. 

It's just one of those, 'shove in your mouth and moan' burgers, okay???

I'd deduct one star for less than stellar service+wait time, butttttt the burgers are really good and so are the milkshakes, and there's eye candy in the kitchen too, so... 5 Stars!!!
author: Dawn C.

description:
Found this place through Yelp (Thank you Yelpers!). Burger is delicious, you can add your favorite condiment. I ordered the mini burger but it was not mini. Friendly service and I like the location. So easy to find; right in the corner. The price is fair. 

Downside, the bathroom is kinda dirty though.
author: Lin S.

description: Everything we had was great, super good burger, the Parmesan on the fries was perfectly melted and we were totally impressed by the shakes. We just found another great reason to be in sf.
author: Ken B.

description:
Wow, my new favorite burger joint!! Just perfect. I was hungry and the burger really hit the spot. It was super juicy and flavorful. They use NIman Ranch beef and apparently the only seasoning they use is salt and pepper. Yummy
 
Nice hip setting too attracts the hipsters. Good friendly service as well. The soft serve was pretty good. The kid's size was huge! Wonder what the regular size looks like??
author: Sunil R.

description:
The first time I went to Super Duper, I had the veggie burger, which wasn't really worth writing about. Pretty average veggie burger, wouldn't necessarily recommend it. 

The next time I came I got a mini burger with all free toppings, including jalapeños and grilled onions, then added cheese. For the Marina, the mini burger is a good amount of food for $5. Burger was pretty juicy and it's decent quality beef. Overall it's good, but nothing nothing more than plain 'good.' It didn't live up to what I've heard about Super Duper's burgers. I'm still holding out for a Five Guys to open in the City, where you can get a bigger quantity of better food for this price.

The staff was exceptionally friendly and welcoming, and the restaurant experience was very pleasant.
author: Lily C.

description:
Super Duper is a great alternative to Umami in the Marina!

When you're not in the mood to wait or spend a lot of money, go to Super Duper!  I got a Super Duper burger, shared half a fries, and half a chocolate covered strawberry shake, and I was soo full. Next time I will just order the mini (which is actually a normal burger, and probably more similar to what you'd find at Umami).  

The burgers taste just as fresh.  If you are in the mood for something simple yet delicious, go to Super Duper.
author: Roya B.

description:
Food orgasm.

Yes, it does exist. But food orgasm exist only when my palate dances to the beat of The Harlem Shake all the while giving my wallet a peace of mind.

Luckily, Super Duper does this well.

Like the start of a Harlem Shake video, the super duper cheese burger is at most a classic no frill burger at first glance.  But just after one bite, the beat starts and the palate starts dancing to inviting tones.

The huggable buns play a great side actor role supporting the main cast - the beef patty characterized by pure flavor tones while juices drip down the corner of your lip.  Napkins ready.

Paris Hilton move over, no need for a photo shopped Carl's Jr. poster here.  Now, I am the Zoolander super model savoring the burger wishing it would not end.

The burger is simple yet complex at the same time.  As a former burger eating competitor (5 Burgers in 10 minutes), I can attest that a good burger is hard to create balancing buns, meat, and condiments that don't over power each other.

I have tried a few Super Duper location but the Chestnut is a great location for a breezy walk after my path down gluttony lane.

(note: This weekI tried the "hipster Hollywood" Umami burger. For 4 people, we ended up with a $60 bill.  I will stick to Super Duper.)
author: Rayfil W.

description:
I finally tried Super Duper Burgers the other day after walking past it many times.  I ordered a veggie burger and the patty lacked flavor.  I also tried my friend's regular cheeseburger and wasn't impressed.  Both seemed pretty below average and I probably wouldn't come in again. 

If you are in the area and are craving a burger, walk an extra few minutes to Roam Burgers on Union.  Super Duper seems really low-quality for the price.
author: Juliana K.

description: The food here is great! Burgers are juicy, garlic fries are awesome and I love that they have Organic soft serve! But to me what makes a place great are the people. They have an awesome staff. I've had the pleasure of being taken care of by Sophin on a few occasions. She's always friendly, consistent and efficient. I look forward to going back soon!
author: Maria C.

description:
Food is ok but service SUCKS and just the overall running of this place! 

Went in the other night with my family. The cashier had an attitude, probably because I asked a few questions and modified the burgers for my kids (which were still made incorrectly).  
I ordered a beer but forgot a drink for my teenager. So I went back to the register with Mr. Attitude and I noticed there was a sign on the register that said "Order a beer or wine and get free fries between 5pm-7pm", well I was charged for my fries even though I ordered a beer at it was 5:15 pm.  
My teenager begged me not to say anything so I didn't but I think it's lame to have a sign there and they not honor their own offer.  Why should I have to remind them of their own offer? What ever.  I don't need the $4 that bad. Oh wait maybe I do......

Then I go back to the register to order a milk for my little one.  Same grumpy guy rings me up and charges me 3 dollars.  Um ok kinda of expensive but I need the milk. 

A different employee has this exchange with me
Super Duper Employee: "What size milk did you order?" 
Me: "Which ever one just costed me $3."  He hands me this small 6 ounce cup.
Me: (staring at the small cup) THIS is $3?  How much is the larger milk?  
SDE: "That's the only size we have. I just haven't changed the price in the POS system yet?" 

Seriously?! So I was overcharged for milk and did not receive my free fries.  If it wasn't  for the fact that my toddler was screaming for milk, I would have asked to speak to a manager.  Won't be back not worth my time or money
author: Salina C.

description:
Decent burgers, decent fries. I actually quite like their fries with the three dips.

Unfortunately, this isn't a distinguishing trait of any burger shop. There are so many good ones around I need a "wow" to like a new place I visit. Maybe I'm just spoiled.
Their menu is also quite limited -- a bit akin to In-and-out, but the results seem to be less consistent and more gooey. More like a Five Guys that's less greasy.

Oh yeah, and beer. Nice beers on tap as well.
author: Alice C.

description:
Craving for a burger? You can't go wrong with super duper burger! 

My double super duper burger was super duper good! That burger was perfectly cooked medium and went well with the sauces that i also ordered with the garlic fries.

It's a perfect cheap lunch / dinner date with someone too. You cant go wrong!
author: Kenny L.

description: Super Duper as the name says! Loved the chicken sandwich, though no chicken burger to order, and guess what, it was more than sufficient for me.
author: Yv S.

description:
Delicious. Delicious. Saw the deal on gilt city a few weeks ago and snagged it. I don't remember how much I paid, I just remember I thought it was a good deal, maybe $20? Either way this is what it came with: 2 8oz burgers, or 2 4oz burgers with blue cheese and grilled portabello mushrooms, 2 beers/wine, 2 fries, 2 small cones. DEAL!

We got the 2 8oz burgers, paid extra for cheese, and one garlic fries (paid extra as well). The 8oz is HUGE. I love how the patty is cooked super crisp and juice. The bun is amazing, as was the garlic fries. Don't forget their pickles! I'm not a pickle person and I love the sweet and salty dichotomy!

I will return! It is definitely after a late night of drinking food, but also have burning calories at the gym, and go "man I deserve something delicious now."
author: Vanessa K.

description: Nice location of this local chain. Came here on a Wednesday night when it was about 1/3 full. Ordering was quick and the food came within 10-15 minutes. There are lots of seats by the bar/kitchen as well as high top tables and regular tables, plus some outdoor seating. For two we each had a mini burger plus garlic fries to share, which was plenty filling. Garlic fries were great (but bring some mints or gum) and the burger was yummy too although maybe could have more salt? I'd come back.
author: J L.

description:
Good homemade style burgers, garlic fries, 
Awesome milkshakes and soft served cones. Definitely a must to try!
author: Dom P.

description: I love burgers but the burgers here are super greasy like ew. I also paid $8 for a milkshake that tasted spoiled. Please get your ish together.
author: Tina F.

description: Loved their vegetarian burger, garlic fries and milkshake. Very American and quite cheap. Highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Seshadri G.

description:
Yuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuum! I was literally melting in burgery heavy. Their fries are wonderful too. All excellent quality meat. The location moves quickly for how busy it is. They apparently have some really great shakes too (but...I was so full from half a burger and fries that I couldn't go for a shake...maybe dessert or a special treat? yeah, that sounds good). 

Loved the seating, everything from tables for small and large groups and seating around the burger bar. They've got a jar with self serve pickles and everything in the restaurant is compostable. In fact, they ask you to leave trash on the counter as it's an infrequent occurence.
author: Lily K.

description:
I love me Super Duper Burgers and here goes another review for them for another location. Located in the lovely Marina District, it's a nice location to drop in for a burger. They have table seating as well as a bar-top seating area. Came here a few times during lunch and seated myself at the bar-top counter enjoying my burger. Then realized they were playing some Backstreet Boys, Spice Girls, and N'sync music. Brought back memories as I grooved in my seat, alone. Hey... don't judge ;)

P.S. I LOVE THEIR PICKLES!!!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Strange to be writing a review when they got my order wrong, but hey, that happens.  They get 5 stars because of how they handled it.  

I ordered on the phone, burger was ready when I get there, but it was a mini and I was starving.   Addie, who I believe was the manager confirmed what I had actually ordered and had me out the door as quickly as possible.  I had to wait a little obviously, but these things happen.  Addie was very kind and helpful and I really appreciated the stellar customer service.

Oh yeah, these burgers are great.
author: Todd K.

description:
Yummo, agree w/ all the good tips. Thanks Yelp.

Parking can be a challenge in the area.
author: Lizzie B.

description:
I am a big burger guy.  I eat at Super Duper.  Not because I like it but moreso because it's convenient, quick, and close to me.  In all honesty, Super Duper was hyped to me by many people before I ever tried one.  After giving it more than enough chances, I can honestly say the burgers here are nothing special.  Is it an upgrade over Johnny Rockets (which occupied the space before)?  Sure.  But as far as burgers go, I have yet to bite into one and think I was experiencing something extraordinary.  Maybe that was due to expectations.  It's not a bad or bland burger.  But it's just not a "super duper" burger (see what I did there?)

If anything, the reason to go would be for the dipping sauces that come with the fries.  Those are pretty legit. 

My advice?  If you're looking for a burger around Chestnut, Barney's is a better choice.  If you're looking for the best burger in the Marina, it's probably between Balboa or Umami Burger (please don't get me started on Roam).  

Super Duper isn't bad.  It's just not great.  Hence, a very accurate 3-stars.
author: Joe M.

description:
I wish they had one in LA!  Super Duper Burgers beats the crap out of the highly overrated Umami Burger.

Food: 4/5- Think of this place as an upgraded In 'N Out burger.  They serve juicy niman ranch beef.  The super sauce they use is just average but everything else is executed very well.  Unfortunately, I choked (trying not to hold up the ordering line) and forgot to request the free grilled onions and jalapeno peppers.  I should've also added the egg, but at $1.50, it's pricey.  We also tried the garlic fries and they were good, but not great.

Service: 4/5- Although it's setup like any other fast food joint, their cook to order service is quick, everyone is friendly, and the workers also clean up after you (you don't clear your own trays).

Environment: 3/5- The restaurant is a bit tiny.  It'd be nicer if there was more table seating space.  

Value: 3/5- We fed 3 people (1 Super Burger, 2 Mini, shared garlic fries, no soda) for ~$23 (before tax/tip).  For the quality of their ingredients and considering the high cost of operation in SF, this was a good deal. 

Return again?: Yes.
author: Jin L.

description:
I had the mini burger with blue cheese and everything on it. I asked for grilled onions and the bf asked for raw onions. They messed up and switched this. We also ordered the garlic fries (no dip; had it at Castro and wasn't blown away).

This location tastes a lot better than the Castro location.  I don't know why.  The meat was a little more seasoned and the fries were a little crispier.  Hit the spot!  Of course, it also undid any good that was done by tennis beforehand.  Maybe playing tennis in the Marina was just an excuse to get Super Duper after.
author: Erika C.

description: I don't get the 4 star average here at all. We've been there twice. The first time was one of the greasiest burgers I've ever had, so I went back to give a second shot because of all the great reviews. The second time was worse. Only thing I can figure is the people who are reviewing this are drunk, young and inexperience to things that taste good,  or in a coma. There are SO many places infinitely better, not the least of which are umami burger and roam just a few blocks away. Save your money
author: Lance K.

description:
With a name like Super Duper Burgers, I expected more. The burger was good but nothing special, and the fries were just all right. Garlic fries were very, very garlicky - this might be a good or bad thing, depending on your tastes! (They were a little too strong for me, which made me glad I ordered the regular fries and not my friend's garlic ones.)

Their combo options remind me a lot of In-N-Out (single patty vs. double). They asked if I wanted "everything" on my burger (and they told me that "everything" included lettuce, tomatoes, onions - they did not mention cheese), and when my burger arrived, it came with cheese on it. This might be partially my fault, since I generally specify that I don't want cheese on my burger and did not do so this time around, but when I brought the burger back to them, they seemed genuinely confused. (I guess I can understand: I'm a weirdo who doesn't like cheese!) In the end, they were still happy to make me a patty without cheese!

All in all, not a bad burger joint, but I'd pick In-N-Out or Five Guys over this place. (And definitely Umami or Roam!)
author: Sarah B.

description:
I've been to this location about 3 times since they opened last year.  Thumbs up to the  late night hours and the affordable food.  There has been lots of hype towards gourmet burger joints all over the city.   They're good, but so expensive! This place serves decent burgers at affordable prices.

On my first two visits, I had the Super Duper Burger served low carb style.  The burger itself was juicy and the patty a good hefty size.  However, the burger was loosely wrapped in the lettuce, which made it very difficult to eat without making a huge mess.  Their burger was not amazing, but it was decent and it was not going to break the bank.  

On my third visit, I decided to go with the chicken sandwich served with chipotle aioli on ciabatta bread.  It was seriously delicious!  The chicken itself was pounded thin, thus very very very tender.  I added portobello mushroom and cheese to my sandwich and it was just so perfect.  The sandwich was big and satisfying.  I also had french fries with my sandwich.  The fries here are cut like the ones at McDonald's.  They were fresh and delicious as well.  Strange, but I think they do a better chicken sandwich than a burger.

I will certainly be back for more chicken sammies!
author: Gloria Y.

description: NEVER ANSWER THEIR PHONES FOR TAKE OUT! So pissed at SD on Chestnut b/c they NEVER answer their phone for takeout orders!! It's so difficult to park on chestnut street I had to go elsewhere for my burger! Go to Barney's on Steiner! They will answer their phone, take a credit card and run your food out to your car when you pull up!!! Now that's good customer service!!!!
author: Kelly D.

description:
Yummy, yummy, yummy!

When the restaurant side of the nearby Izzy's was closed, my son and I found this burger joint on around the corner.  The patty is a little on the salty side (because they use some type of rock salt), but all of the elements of this burger come together.  Their garlic fries are my absolute local favorite.  This is a great Chestnut Street go-to if you have a burger craving.
author: L P.

description:
Can't go wrong with grass-fed burgers!!  They have a killer strawberry shake and garlic fries.  The burger...I thought...was okay...nothing too special but all-in-all...GOOD!  I had the mini-burger (which ain't that mini) with sunnyside up egg.  

The menu was straight forward but was confusing as there were things that I didn't know about till after...like I can get my own pickles??
author: Patrick C.

description:
Hands down, the burgers are on point...make sure you get the organic egg with it.    

The size of the burgers are good as well.  Get the double if you're super duper hungry!

Garlic fries and the shakes are also on-point as well.

Friendly staff around the neighborhood as well.  Been to other Super Duper locations but Chestnut has always catered to my burger needs.

In fact, writing this review is making me crave one now! lol
author: Toma W.

description: The guy at my hotel recommended this place and Super duper they are!!!!!! The burger was delicious and OMG the garlic fries is so goooooood. I have gotten the super combo and was disappointed with the size cup drink I got.but other than that I recommend you check this place out
author: Mike S.

description: Originally tried the burger.  It was decent.  Next time on the manager's recommendation, I tried the chicken sandwich with cheese and an order of fries for about $10.  Pretty tasty, I can admit.  It's open till 11, too, which is a nice option.
author: Ross I.

description:
I've seen a couple of these in San Francisco and we've called into this our local one for a milk shake before now. This time we just wanted a quick, casual meal and that's exactly what we got.
A good sized burger arrived quickly and was presented well.  It's fresh and wrapped up so it's easy to hold  but with the filling visible so I can see it was well packed!
I barely finished that but the accompanying fries went down well as did the cookies and cream milk shake. The shake is enough to be shared between two!

A friendly with the overal experience better than expected. I've seen lines out the door at busy times but it was OK at 8.30 mid-week.
author: Rickie J.

description: I went to this place, expecting a regular burger buttttttttt it was outstanding like the kind of burgers i make a home and the nest garlic fries ive had in a while being that i skipped the last 6garlic festivals a.d i havent been out to the mb aquarium in equally as long.Great customer service you get your food fast even though its always jammed packed :)love love love i recommended
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I was SUPER disappointed with this place.
My chicken sandwich patty was SUPER thin.

BUT I am SUPER willing to give them another chance because

1. It's called Super Duper BURGER, so I'm sure their burgers are much better than their chicken sandwich. I was feeling like chicken that day, so please don't judge me.
2. I didn't get any soft serve ice cream or any of their shakes and that seems to be what a lot of people like.
3. They just recently opened at this new location, so perhaps they're still working out some kinks?

My one friend liked her super burger, but my other friend wasn't that happy with her portobello mushroom burger. Again though, portobello is the veggie option. Next time I think it'll be BEEF all the way.

The place is really clean and the staff was nice! I'm not sure if the other Super Duper Burgers are like this, but you have to wait in line to order and the distance from the cashier to the entrance is kind of short, so you might be waiting outside. Not really fun if it's cold or rainy.
author: Kei H.

description:
Burgers were good...but the patties were thin, and just reminded me of an upgraded version of Five Guys or In-n-Out.

The garlic fries were so so good, and then I got to the bottom.. where the last layer was sopping wet with grease.

They do serve beer though...my reason for three stars and not two.
author: Kim D.

description:
omg!! why have I not been here sooner??? this little burger joint offers the best burgers & garlic fries that make it worth a trip any day!!  Its located in the Marina on Chestnut btw Avila and Pierce. Unique and diff from other spots is that SD offers a small selection of liquor (beers, wines & spike milkshakes).

What I had:
1) a mini burger with cheese, bacon & hard over egg (hard vs easy so eating isn't such a mess) as recommended by SD's sweet and very friendly manager Annie.
Comes with their sauce, red onions, lettuce and tomato.  It was quite delicious 

2) garlic fries!!! Super crispy and full of garlic flavor without the grease!!! The only thing I would do diff next time is to order my own vs sharing an order with my gf, hehe!

My girlfriend had:
1) green salad w/ cucumber, tomato, eggs and patty! They put the dressing on side and gives you two but one is plenty. 

2) Oreo shake which was a perfect consistency and its huge!

Pro's:
-friendly ubar style and you can watch them make your food
Thus, lots of seating and a few tables. Turn over us quick so you don't have to wait long if busy.
-very clean
-friendly staff

Con's:
-parking can be hard but there's a parking structure right around the corner.
-gotta pay meters til' 10pm but that's just SF for ya

Would definitely come again and would also recommend this spot to my friends to visit!
author: Nga L.

description: I was pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for lunch today. The burger was juicy, fresh and seasoned perfectly. I ordered mine plain and it was delicious without the addition of condiments. The fries were crisp and hot, so delicious!! I will definitely go back there next time I am nearby.
author: Betsey C.

description: Favorite burger place in SF, always delicious and consistent. I love the free pickles and garlic fries. The burgers are perfect every time. Conveniently located near crissy field so walking distance from the beach.
author: Lee X.

description: The marina location is amazing! Atmosphere, staff, and weather, two thumbs up! There is outside seating and I thought, in sf, no way, but in the marina district, it was surprisingly warm and perfect. Anywho, the burgers here are pretty legit! Juicy perfectness and the buns and fresh lettuce, and the sauce!!!! Sorry if i just made you drool ;) I went for the mini, and I think the mini is just the perfect size :) for me at least! We also ordered the garlic fries and an IPA beer :)  I appreciated that the cashier asked if we've eaten there before, cause she briefly explained how it works, where to get your ketchup, water, napkins, etc. friendly welcoming factor :D
author: Cindy C.

description: The burger was by far the best part. I consider myself a huge burger enthusiast so I was happy that it met my inflated expectations. The garlic fries however I was not a fan of. For $15 I expect more.
author: Jacob A.

description:
i used to come here just to get ice cream while shopping, but had no idea that this was a burger place.  guess i don't really pay attention!!

i'm not vegetarian, and i LOVE burgers, but i tend to order the veggie burger here because
1) it doesn't taste like shit
2) it fills you up without weighing you down.  

if you're giving up processed meat or going vegetarian, this would probably be a good transition food to wean yourself off (:
author: Jennifer L.

description: Pretty good burger excellent garlic fries and bomb chipotle sauce!! The waiters looked a little rushed but very nice and even better pricing.
author: Isabel S.

description:
Meh... not so super duper... it was more like super duper greasy! 

Got the Super Duper combo. Fries were good but you can get those at McDonalds. Take it from me thrifty people... save your money and go to In-and-Out.
author: Cheryl L.

description: Upscale fast food burger that delivers. Seriously, they make great burgers, perfectly cooked with lots of choice toppings. Chicken sandwich was really tasty and truly fantastic chocolate shakes, too.
author: Allison W.

description:
Unlike In-n-Out where there are really only three burger choices on the (visible) menu, this build-your-own-burger joint is not for the indecisive at heart.  You start with a mini burger (1 patty, $5) or super burger (2 patties, $7) and choose from an assortment of free toppings (lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, jalapeño, grilled onions, pickles) and add-ons (cheese, bacon, avocado, roasted portobello, egg, cambozola blue).  Ranging from .50 to 1.50, the add-ons can add up quick.  There are other items on the menu like chicken sandwiches, veggie burgers, salads, shakes, fries, and soft serve cones.  So many options and combinations made for staring at the menu for 5 minutes this first visit.

I (finally) opted for a mini burger and garlic fries, and the bill came to $9.24 - slightly expensive.  The burger was dripping with grease and the fries were more cheesy than garlic-y, but the flavors and presentation were solid. The chipotle aioli added a subtle kick of spice, the aged cheddar on the garlic fries brought depth to compliment the garlic, and the zesty pickles diffused all that saturated fat I was probably ingesting ;) 

Bottom line: if you're craving for that all-American favorite, Super Duper Burgers is a decent place to go.
author: Amy T.

description:
Absolutely the WORST burger ever (at this location at least). Waste of money! Rude, no personality service. Burger was tasteless, bland and the patty was  crumbly. Garlic fries was dripping oil. Only thing good was the soda and ketchup. Came here with my family and one of my sons says "mom, maybe we should've just eaten at in n out".  Sadly, my son was right, we should have.  The family sitting beside us got their meal before us and a few bites into thier food, the father says "ok, well this is the 1st and last time we'll be back here again".  

I'm still willing to give the other Super Duper's a try since of all the Super Duper's this had the least stars.  I'm thinkin' this SuperDuper caters to the palate's of this location.  

This was a disappointing 1st time experience.  = I
author: Sarah N.

description: My roommate introduced me to that chocolate dipped ice cream cone, with garlic fries. Game over.
author: Linda X.

description:
It's amazing how efficiently this place runs.  You walk in, tell a cashier what you want, are given a number, grab some paper towels, catchup and their very good pickles, seat yourself and soon your food arrives.  And for the price it's pretty good.

I had two mini burgers with lettuce, tomato, and caramelized onions, and an order of garlic fries.   The burgers were juicy and better than your average fast food.  The garlic fries had an assertive blast of garlic.  

My only criticism is of the paper towels.  It would be so much nicer if they had napkins.  Even cheap napkins.   Paper towels are really messy.

It may not have been the healthiest meal I have had but it was one of the least expensive.  That counts for something.
author: David D.

description: Seriously good across the board including the killer milkshakes. Even the often neglected chicken sandwich and veggie burger are tasty and consistently well prepared. Solid kids options too. The only issue is that they're usually jammed so be prepared to wait.
author: 1 D.

description:
