I finally decided to give Super Duper a try to see what all the hype was about. I thought the place would be packed since its pretty popular, but it was empty. Perhaps it was because I went at 2:30 on a Monday afternoon. Parking was not bad since Chestnut street is usually very busy. 

I ordered the mini cheese burger with a side of garlic fries. The burger was wrapped nicely similar to those at In-N-Out. My boyfriend and I both thought that the burgers were a little greasy on the outside. Other than that, it was pretty good. It kind of tasted like a burger from In-N-Out, but maybe that's because I didn't add any fancy toppings they offered like an egg or avocado. The garlic fries were delish. Very garlicky, the way I like em. Other than that, service was good and I would come back if I'm craving a burger.
author: Vivian H.

description: I'm a fan. I can always expect a good tasting burger from Super Duper. There's nothing fancy about them, except that there kind of is. The burger patty is juicy. The bun is puffy. The whole thing in your hands just feels right. The garlic fries are delicious, although there is more cheese than there is garlic. Garlic lovers may be disappointed. Pickle lovers rejoice over the unlimited, complimentary supply.  Seating here is not super abundant, but there's a great variety of choices: the regular tables, counter top facing kitchen, counter facing window and street, tables outside, high tables inside... good for kids, good for groups, good for not breaking the bank.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Man, these burgers are freakin' BOMB! They are chargrilled and juicy as all get out!

The people that work there are friendly and do an efficient job. The place is clean and inviting. But the main point - DOPE BURGERS!

I shall return when frolicking around the Marina. :)
author: Jade F.

description: One of my fave burger joints! The meat taste really good & fresh which I like! And its not too oily and fatty tasting, I believe their meat is grass fed which is a plus! Their fries are also really good too and their prices are decent.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Lot's of my friends have been talking about Super Duper so I decided to give it a go, and by go, I meant all out! I ordered the Super Duper cheeseburger with two meat patties and bacon. I also substituted my regular fries for garlic fries. The food came out in about 10 minutes and boy, was I salivating. Not only was I super hungry when I went in, I was super salivating from the sheer sensation of just the smell! The burger was really juicy and tender. There were no dry parts to this burger what so ever!! No need to request medium rare. These bad boys come out by default as medium, and it's perfect in my opinion! The fries were really crispy and tasty too! I actually got a little creative with my leftover bits of garlic and cheese and slathered it into whatever that was left of my burger. I wish I did that from the get go!

Also, I loved the fact that there was a pickle jar for me to grab endless amounts of their "in house made" pickles! Fresh, crispy and perfect for a quick reset of the taste pallet. 

I loved it!

I am now a fan of Super Duper burger! The staff was extremely friendly and they were on top of cleaning/clearing out tables for clients ASAP. I went in around 3pm, so it wasn't too busy, but in no way was it slow. 

My hunger was calmed, and the burger definitely hit the spot!!
author: Andrew W.

description: The beef is delicious, tender, moist and cooked perfectly. The bun is lightly toasted, the lettuce is crisp and the tomato is fresh. Also, get the grilled onions and pickles. I wish this place was in the Los Angeles area.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Very good burgers, I will say I'm upset about one thing and that's the fact that I should have ordered a super instead of the mini.

I shall return!
author: Food Has To Be Good W.

description: Words can't even describe how much I love super duper burger. Their burgers are so good and juicy, oh and you have to try their garlic fries...they put cheese on top! Lol it was heaven in my mouth. The workers were really nice and friendly, the bathrooms were super clean, and the whole place was nice and comfy.
author: Danica M.

description: One of the best veggie burgers I've had. It's nice to find a burger place that makes great burgers (my friends lived theirs) but still take the time to make a yummy veggie option for those of us that don't eat meat. If you get the fries get the three sauces too--chipotle was really good!
author: Maryann M.

description: Yesss! SF keeps on proving to me that  it has some of the best damn burgers in the U.S. Juicy, messy, tasty and the company's organic/sustainably farmed products philosophy is equally awesome. I don't see this for the everyday, but I will most definitely be back for more yummers! The organic Oreo milkshake was to die for. Absolutely recommend to fellow burger lovers!
author: Sara C.

description:
Chicken Sandwiches here are so yum! Spicy  and on a perfect bread. Food is quick and there was no wait when we got here on a Thursday night. 

They have more than burgers- fries, chicken sandwiches, salads, and more.

Definitely a hit for good food and a laid back atmosphere.
author: Kayla J.

description: Decent local burger chain with an excellent selection of home-grown microbrews on tap. The food was a bit too greasy for my taste, though, and the onion fries left my stomach turning. Sure beats some of the more traditional fast-food options, though.
author: Joe P.

description:
Super Duper, you make quick and delicious organic burgers.

I ordered the Super Duper Burger for $6.50, adding avocado & bacon for $1.00 each. On the side I added some French Fries along with a Cookies & Creme Super Shake.

Their service was rather quick. After I sat down one of the servers brought out my shake within a minute. This isn't your typical cookies & creme milkshake as the cookie ingredients are homemade cookies rather than Oreos (remember this place is all organic). It tasted pretty good. The shake was not thick but had a good amount of creamy texture. You don't have to wait for the shake to melt a little to start drinking it.

The burger itself was very appetizing. The Super is 8 ounces of meat and it comes in the form of two patties. The patties are on the saltier side but I enjoy salty flavors. The sesame bread bun was buttered and toasted to a nice crisp. The lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, super sauce and avocado paired subtly with the entire burger. Nothing to overpowering in taste, just right. One of the best parts was the bacon. The bacon was not hard & flaky but rather moist & chewy. Burger well done!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Been waiting to try the in and out rival of burgers and surely there's no rival here!!! Super Duper reigns as the supremacy of burgers in my book. There was a long line of customers, and I was greeted kindly by a lovely Asian girl. Soon to learn that she was the manager, she kindly accommodated a vegetarian option and the other burgers we ordered. 
I definitely will be back here for another treat!
author: tiffany t.

description:
I am seriously having this place like no other. 

When I lived in San Diego, I was a regular at burger lounge. Literally swore by their burger and fries. Now that I live in SF, a Super Duper has changed my vote for the best Veggie burger from a burger only spot that isn't a sit down. 

Honestly I don't even know how to describe the love I have for this place. Friendly staff, good service, perfect locations around the city, and so far nothing but greatness from the burgers I've had. The veggie burger is definitely a must. They are getting 4 out of 5 stars because their French fries are good but not memorable. I'm still needing to try different items on the menu but this place is a must if you are a local or trying to find a place to bring friends when they are in town.
author: Lindsey M.

description: Great all around burgers. Think five guys rich classic meat, but packaged and held together with in and out integrity. The homemade pickles really add a delicious mouth puckering break to the rich burgers.
author: Peter T.

description:
So I love burgers. I eat them often. And eating these burgers makes me desperately wish I lived in SF. Huge fan of the random burger joints down here in SD especially Burger Lounge and the Counter in East Village but dare I say it....the Super Duper burger surpasses them all ! 

I can't remember the last time I had a more juicy and flavorful burger. I loved the sesame seed bun too. It was just pure perfection. I appreciated the simplicity of the menu with just really good quality ingredients. More places need to realize that less IS more most of the time. I'd also like to commend the service at this location. They went above and beyond to please one of my friends that didn't like her burger at first and were really accommodating. The special sauces that came with the fries were all delicious as well! The fries weren't anything memorable but they were hot and still pretty tasty. 

The next time I'm up in the Bay I am going straight back to Super Duper to try out their raved about Veggie Burger and also organic milkshakes!
author: Brandon H.

description: Lunch  here recently was  really good.  Inhaled my burger and fought my wife over who got the last of the garlic fries.  It was crowded and the staff did a good job managing what is otherwise a small location.
author: Charlie B.

description: I had to chicken sandwich with the chipotle sauce, probably the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. The service was a little slow but amazing food and friendly staff. I'll definitely be coming here again!
author: Krissy K.

description: First time there. Very good burgers. Sister recommended it. In the Marina.. so parking is a little hard. Burger was tasty and a good size. The lemonade was nice. The pickles that you can grab from the side jar.. super sour. Fries were good.. not over fried or salted. Definitely would come back.
author: Helena C.

description:
Manager walks around with an open stapler and staple guns his employees. I'm absolutely not joking... not only is this a complete breech in sanitation, but also in human rights! Poor guys, walking around with staples in their forearms and caked blood on their arms.  The whole thing was ridiculous - the manager was clearly under the influence of something weird... 

Less shocking was the mediocre food (though I decided not to consume anything, the sight was enough).
author: Zoey S.

description:
Went two weeks ago with two kids and two adults.  They all had a hamburger which they loved.  I had a chicken sandwich it was pretty tasteless but it only cost $6.50 which would have been a good deal if the sandwich was GOOD but it wasn't.

Would we all go back my family would but I wouldn't I try to avoid eating a lot of beef I need other alternatives to my food.
author: Jay S.

description:
Not only are the burgers great, but the service is awesome too. Everyone I have encountered from the Managers to the servers are always quick with a smile and a hello. I used to go to Roam on Union St., but once I discovered this spot, I haven't been back. These burgers are not only a lot better, but cheaper! 

The burgers are juicy, tasty, and best of all fresh! The burgers taste more like steak than a burger patty. Make sure you get the garlic fries and a shake, you will not be disappointed! Best burger in S.F. hands down, especially when you take into account the value.
author: Fernando E.

description:
ordered a mini combo (burger, fries and a fountain drink). The burger was literally drenched in their "special sauce". I could literally not taste the meat.

The burger was just a let down. I would probably never come back.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
My friend introduced me to this place a year ago and since then I've been a loyal customer. 

The burger is always done very well and the fries are awesome. The garlic fries are are definitely my favorite fries at a burger place hands down. Also the shakes here are awesome, they always seem to be out of chocolate when I go but I still always try to get a shake here. 

This place is so good, I eventually take all my friends here anyway so they can share in the greatness of this burger place.
author: Michael C.

description: Best burger in San Francisco. We had the super burger and fries. You need to check out the chipotle sauce with your fries!
author: Curt B.

description:
I am not a huge fan of burgers but sometimes you just want a big fat juicy, flavorul patty of meat in between a bun!

On a wet and rainy saturday, I was craving just that while strolling the streets of the Marina district post thai passage on North point. Contemplating whether we should brave the rain and hunger (815 resos) at sushi ran, I gave in when i smelled the wafting smell of....GRILLED MEAT!
Hubby and I each got a super duper with everything, his with chedder and mine plain. Free pickles, a side of their garlic fries and a vanilla shake.
The burger itself was quite delicious. It was super juicy, and flavorful, cooked perfectly medium. We didnt realize the burgers come with two meat patties which was great!! Everything about the burger was good, the sauce, the meat, fresh lettuce, tomato and onion. The super duper is a good size and since it is so tasty you can scarf it down in one sitting with no guilt =).

The fries were really yummy too, however the size for $2.75 was the equivalent to that of a small fries at mcdonalds...it came iwth garlic on top and parm cheese. Just wish the fries were a bit larger or just not the skinny mcdonalds fries..to give it some gumption...

the vanilla shake was ok..a bit runny and not thick and creamy like i normally like it, as i figured out later its made of their organic soft serve. I wouldnt order this again. mels drive in has the best thick style shakes!

Overall for $6.50 a burger, for great value, grass fed beef, you cant beat it!
The best thing is after you eat it, you do not feel gross. That is a hard thing to come across after eating a huge burger.

My new go to burger place in the Marina. Yum.
author: Petri Y.

description:
This is a "quick food" place ("fast food" would just be insulting) on par with almost any sit-down burger restaurant.  

Everything is fresh and delicious, and cheap!  I can't believe they didn't have a line around the block, but the speed of service was just another aspect that made it a total gem.

I had a Super with Bacon and Cheese, with Garlic Fries.  Absolute burger nirvana!
author: Kevin M.

description: Pretty obsessed with this place.  The hardest part trying to avoid eating beef is knowing this place exists and I can have one of their juicy burgers in my hands in a matter of minutes upon ordering (even when it's slammed).  It's the best burger I've had in the city.  There's another pretty choice spot that has high priced burgers close by off of Fillmore, but Super Duper easily has them beat and charges half the price.  Even the chicken sandwich is excellent.  I usually just do the mini with everything + grilled onions.  That's plenty for me.  Shakes are good too.  It's a nice place to bring friends, or just go alone
author: J W.

description: YummY! hamburger is huge, got one with the works and jalapenos and I was full the entire day! Milk shake was really good.
author: Maxine M.

description: The small burger is the perfect size! The beef patty is super flavourful and the bun is soft and delicious. The fries are not the best though- bit dry and too crunchy. The cookies and cream milkshake is thick and the best quality with a generous serving of cookie chunk in it. Bit pricy but so worth it!
author: Penny C.

description:
Somehow managed to beat the rush and got an indoor table. Everyone got the mini burger which was juicy and perfectly cooked and made really fast. I liked all of the "free" toppings. The garlic fries were good, but very greasy, so next time I'd opt for the regular fries. We sprung for the trio of dips for the fries, but next time we won't and just stick the free ketchup. My husband almost ordered the shake, until he realized it was made from soft serve ice cream and he prefers "real" ice cream. 

It was also nice to see that they use Niman Ranch meat and that they grind their own daily. The homemade pickles were good, but there really wasn't anything to put them in. I liked that the napkins appeared to be recycled, but it would have been more helpful to have them on the tables instead of one location next to the pickles because they were needed. They should be bigger because 1 is not big enough to put on your lap to catch drips.
author: Lisa T.

description: Do they grill these burgers in salty butter?  I otherwise have no idea how the patties get those crispy edges that go so well with the fresh buns and bottomless pickles.  I want to say that I like In-n-Out more, but it's not true.  These are the right balance of taste/price, perfectly positioned between In-n-Out and Roam.  Always good.
author: Rob P.

description: I love me a cheeseburger but damn, Super Duper has probably topped it for sure! The burger was amazing!! Their sauce was the BOMB!!! And their bread was just phenomenal! The service was great and the food was better! If you're in the area, I definitely recommend hitting this place up. You will NOT REGRET IT!
author: Junior R.

description:
Who doesn't love a big juicy burger with garlic fries?

Anyone?....

I thought so :)
author: Dasha B.

description:
Flies be crawlin' up and down the walls up in this place haha.

Burger was aight. Price was aight. Service was above average.

There's nothing spectacular to mention about this place aside from it fed me. Go here if you're hungry and want something quick. If you want your mind blown by something amazingly delicious... venture down Fillmore and find Roam Burger instead.
author: Paul B.

description: Came in to look at the menu because it smelled so good as I walked by and ended up staying for dinner. I ordered the super combo with portobello mushrooms and avocado, and garlic fries. The meat was fresh and seasoned well. Mushrooms, avocado and tomatoes were fresh and perfect. Fries were crunchy and cooked perfectly, but they were too garlicky for my taste. The place was clean and welcoming. Me and the other 3 people in my group were pleasantly surprised. If we are ever in SF again, we will stop by.
author: Brenda V.

description: Delicious fresh hot food! Chocolate chip shake was awesome!! TAKE NOTE: if you want a well done burger ask because they make them medium well and the garlic fries have cheese on them.
author: Celenia A.

description: Loved it!  Garlic fries a must, mini burger with everything and a chocolate shake it was all delicious.  Staff was friendly and the service was fast all while being reasonably priced.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
10 Things I Love About Super Duper:

1. It's walking distance from home
2. It's cheap + tasty
3. Soft Serve Ice Cream
4. Soft Serve Ice Cream dipped in CHOCOLATE
5. Homemade pickles, I can't get enough
6. Garlic Fries + dipping sauces = fun times
7. I can pick up a legit meal after the bars close
8. They have a decent Vegetarian menu for days that I feel weighed down (probably from having too many SD burgers :/)
9. Super Salad w/ bacon & avocado = BOMB
10. Service is always speedy with a smile. I love that!
11. The pickles are FREE!!!
author: Deanna T.

description: Awesome garlic fries! My friends and I had 8:30 reservations in a nearby restaurant, but we were already there and starving an hour earlier, so we decided to eat fries here. Wonderful fries and wonderful service. The lady who took my order asked if it was my first time here and then welcomed me. And the guy who brought my fries and jalapeños (I ordered jalapeño on the side, which was free), then asked if I wanted utensils for the jalapeño and brought them to me. Going to try their burgers one day for sure!
author: Keyla B.

description:
"Best burgers in the wold!!! I finally found a perfect please to take my kids for a burger.
Clean, friendly people, tasty burgers for an affordable price. My kids love it, I love it!
author: Lorena F.

description:
If a burger dining experience could be considered "cute" then this place definitely earns that label. The tray liners? Cute. The wall art? Cute. My perfectly-sized 4oz. patty? Super cute. (And super tasty.) 

Other notable cute elements: pickle bites, signage, milkshakes,  and thin-cut fries. All contributing to an adorably gluttonous feast.
author: Valerie C.

description:
Great location, great burgers, friendly staff! 

I've come here a few times and haven't had a bad experience yet. I've ordered to-go twice and my order has been there ready for me both times. The burgers are a little smaller than normal, so I opt in for the super burger (double patties). The fries are good, I haven't tried the garlic fries yet but I'm planning on it next time. 

** Also, the ice cream cones are DELICIOUS! I ate mine on the walk home before my meal...great choice. **
author: Ryan E.

description:
Not sure if I should give them a 2 or 3 star....their fries are more like a 4 star....but the service...hmmm....

We walked in on a Sunday late afternoon....yes, we were not ready to order...the "lady" behind the counter was very unhappy with us....eye rolling moment lasted (on her part) seemed like forever....

The burgers were ok...very thin patties....very greasy...yes...great fries....rather awful service...don't think we'll be going back anytime soon....
author: Barb L.

description: Just arrived in town. Looking for a buger. Yelp guided us to Super Duper. What a great burger! Juicy, tasty, toasted bun, all the toppings and a tangy special sauce. Plan to go back tomorrow. Will add bacon!
author: Dave L.

description:
this is one of my favorite burger spots in SF. always go for the double with a fried egg on top and cheesy garlic fries, because, well, YOLO.

plus they have decent beer selection on tap. and milk shakes, of which you can add alcohol. haven't tried it, but looks pretty good.
author: Andy J.

description:
This build your own burger place is delicious!

I had the Mini Burger  with Grilled onions without buns and GARLIC FRIES :) The burger was cooked to perfection. Really juicy, tender and seasoned perfectly. Fries, the cut reminded me very much of in and out but better! You can actually taste the garlic :) OH, AND THEY HAVE RANCH SAUCE! :)


I really like how it's an open kitchen. I was able to see how each order was made. When i say fresh, I mean each patty came in a form of a ball and isn't a patty until it's ordered! Really neat :) Great thing about this place, it opens to 2am on the weeknds!

It was moderate when we entered, made it just in time before the dinner rush. Most tables were taken with few left. The place was really clean and organized.
WILL DEFINTIELY RETURN :)
author: linda L.

description: Loved it! Had a veggie burger with everything and it was great. Everything hot and fresh. Definitely a keeper!
author: Stacy Y.

description: The food was delicious and great staff. They forgot one of my garlic fries. I ordered to go and forgot to check the bag.
author: Andrew F.

description:
I was excited to try Super Duper Burgers because the storefront facade and environment gave off (almost rip off) a Shake Shack of New York vibe. Shake Shack being awesome and worth the prices and half hour waits for fast food, I knew I had to try to Super Duper. 

What a disappointment. I had a cheeseburger and fries. I would have rather gone to McDonald's. The patty was overcooked. The bun tasted stale and old. The fries I got were all the little bits and scraps you would get at the bottom of a bag--maybe because it was late and the staff didn't want to make new fries? 

I felt bad because my boyfriend and I were ragging pretty hard on our meal. A tourist seated nearby asked us if this was not a good burger. He was from Eastern Europe and until he overheard us he thought that this was the best burger he'd ever had. We felt bad for him because we totally crushed his experience, but recommended that he try ROAM up the street on Union, which has a similar price point and is a much better burger.
author: Darcy L.

description: Awesome burgers. They are not for those counting the calories, but they are tasty, loaded and filling. I also recommend the chocolate milkshake, so thick it is like a small meal. Good prices, quick service. I will definitely go back.
author: Barry O.

description: So after I sent the poor review, a manager got in touch with me and asked about the details of my experience.  The feedback was well received and in turn she sent me a gift card to give them another shot.  So I went back and while I encountered some issues with the card the manager on site Ryan took care of the card issue and then some.  I mentioned I got the card because of a poor review and then he asked who issued the card and which review did I have.  He knew exactly which review I had and stated he wanted to speak with me the date of the bad service but we had left too quickly.  He was so nice and genuinely cared about our experiences and stated that they read reviews and try to learn from the feedback.  So I gotta day out food came out perfectly and the interaction with the managers made me edit my review.  I will go back to super duper after all.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
The garlic fries are tasty, with a bit of shredded cheese on top.  the french fries are good, too. the mini cheese burgers are good size for kids under 12.  the beef is juicy and delicious.  if you want alvacado, you have to add a dollar. cheese 50 cents. their milk shake is awesome!  you can pick either chocolate or vanilla. 

what i really like about this place is they have veggie burgers for vegetarians.  however, don't get hummus, it just ruined the whole veggie flavor.  the veggie burger itself is great especially you ordered it with alvacado.  they even have lemons for water!  

this is a nice place for you to hang out with your friends or family after you spend sometime in the marina, great for tourists from Japan and Taiwan and China. try an american style burger.  i agree with some other people, the bun is a little bit too hard.
author: Kentaro K.

description: A must visit in SF. Burgers are on point in terms of juiciness and tastefulness. Be sure to have a lot of napkins on hand as you will get your hands messy. The cookies and cream shake is one of a kind. Staff is cool, too. Ya dig?
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
Tasty Burgers, tasty fries, tasty homemade pickles...

Went in here for a quick bite before heading over to enjoy Bay Lights. The burgers were cooked perfectly, the fries were tasty and they had awesome homemade pickles.

Worth stopping in if you'd like a tasty quick bite to eat. 

I only ranked 3 out of 5 stars since this place is located 4 blocks from Umami Burger... Umami =5 stars because you can get a calamari burger... Super duper=4 stars cause they make great burgers as advertised,
author: Joshua M.

description: I like the mini bugger. It's very tasty. The French fries are very good too. I like it very much. When I call them, after 5 minutes I can go there pick up my food. They're very fast to cooking the food.
author: Weibin L.

description:
SuperDuper is a great place to get a quick and delicious burger. Great atmosphere and great service. They definitely have their own
signature taste once you have gone several times.  You know what I mean. Your favorite burger joint has its own taste...whether its Bk or Mcd's. My point...if you are craving a super duper burger...accept no substitute.  Best thing is that they're open late. Ok thing is their ketchup.
author: Ignace P.

description:
So you like food poisoning?  You found your spot.  I normally wouldn't hold that against a place.  Truth is you normally can't tell when you got poisoned.  But when 9 friends meet up for a meal, and all of you end up sick though you spent no time with each other anywhere outside of this place for a month, it's pretty safe to say where you got sick.

If anyone else ate here on 12/20/2011 in the late evening and had their doubts as to what caused the 3 days of vomit, here's your confirmation.

What bothers me most though is managment's  assurances that they have some "seasonal help" which won't be here in a few weeks, and this would be "unlikely" to happen again.  As in, tough sh1t for anyone who's going to eat here until then, we don't know if these temps we hire wash their hands after they take a dump -or- if they understand that meat needs to be refrigerated, but we're sure "this won't be a problem in the new year".  ARE YOU F'N KIDDING ME?  YOU LEAVE YOUR SH1T IN MY FOOD BECAUSE YOU'RE TEMPS ARE INCONSIDERATE DIRT BAGS AND YOU DON'T EVEN KNOW IF YOU CAN TALK TO THEM ABOUT IT?  

I followed up with one of the clerks, and I kid you not, they insisted that management is serious about issues, and once they heard one of the boys pissed in the special sauce, they fired him...  I've got these discussions on tape, so if there's someone who can pass me instructions on how to get a hold of the media or a food inspector at least, please pass it along.  Just eat somewhere else.  3rd world country roach mobile's have better food handling.

And, again, if any of you got sick on 12/20/211 or in the days shortly thereafter, sorry =)
author: Ma Y.

description:
It was a random sunny day... the urge for a juicy burger that wasn't at the cost of a limb was in full effect...

Ran into where the old Johnny Rockets was, and surprised to see Super Duper!! SCORE!!!

Why?

$10 for a combo meal? redic. 
garlic fries... on point.
unlimited homemade pickles.. snooki approved.

burgers.. besides the many options you can do to your burger, one things stands true.... the patty alone is like a REAL patty. Like its a piece of a cow real.  sorry if that was too real for you vegans... but I heard their portobellos are awesome. =)

Did I mention they have wine + beer??? Yep, I'm a happy camper.
author: Deanna T.

description:
Super and Duper! that's right, Super Duper! I love these burgers.....juicy, juicy, juicy- perfectly cooked and seasoned and just down right super.

i love the little wine carafs they give too.....super duper cute!
author: Ricquel N.

description:
My family and I walked from the Letterman Digital Arts campus, down by the marina and then up to Super Duper so we were plenty hungry by the time we arrived.  Luckily, it appeared we arrived just before the rush as it was pretty quiet with a couple empty tables when we ordered but, by the time we got our food, there was a line out the door and along the front of the place.
The beef portion of the burger, you could tell, was high quality.  As for the rest, who knows?  The burger was certainly better than middle of the road but not really worth the price.  There was nothing inviting about the place, no ambiance to speak of.  All in all, pretty generic and unremarkable.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Well, it didn't get the name Super Duper for nothing.

I went to Super Duper Burgers on a rainy night with some friends and was really excited to try this place. I ordered the mini burger with cheese, bell peppers, and grilled onions. The bun was perfect,the sauce was perfect, the patty was great, and the onions and peppers were grilled to perfection--I love that they had those as an option! For me, a native Texan, to be so excited about a burger, well...that says a lot. The garlic fries were pretty stellar too! 

Don't forget to bring your ID--they have beer! I didn't get carded at first which made me a little sad (am i really starting to look that old?!), but then someone suggested they card me just to be sure. I'm 99% sure they did it because they saw the heartbreak in my eyes when I wasn't carded in the first place. HA! I joked with the staff about it and they were really friendly.

 Anyway, it was delicious...totally unhealthy but absolutely glorious.
author: Holly G.

description: Hell yeah. Juicy burgers. So guuuuuuuuud!
author: Chenguang W.

description: Seriously so yummy.  Stopped in,  really quick. Easy basic menu but allows for additional toppings.  We added jalapeños ands grilled onions.  Going to stop in one more time before we leave town.  New favorite! !
author: Micaela S.

description:
The burgers here are sooo good! I come in for lunch pretty often and more than likely order the super (2 patties) with cheddar and bacon. Top it with their garlic fries and rinse it down with a cold beer! Great selection of beer too may I add! 

Everyone is always super duper friendly here and weekdays are usually a bit more accommodating if you want to dine-in with a couple of friends. I've seen the line loop around the block so I would avoid coming on weekends. However, they do take phone orders!
author: Rob B.

description:
One of the best burgers ever.  Honestly, I am not exactly sure why there are so many low ratings.  I went there last night while bar hopping, and the burger I had was excellent.  I had a mini burger, and it was everything that a burger should be.

There are three main elements that I consider in a burger: the patty, the bread, and the fixins.  The beef patty was delicious.  Seriously, it was amazing; everything was right about the patty.  In my opinion, the bread is just as important as the patty, and they toasted their sesame bread perfectly, which made it crunchy yet still bread-y. Finally, the fixins.  Most burger joints over do it with toppings or throw on a nasty slab of iceberg lettuce.  They placed the toppings nicely on it, which actually complemented the burger as a whole. (I didn't though have any secret sauce, because I am not a huge mayo fan.)

I can be pretty pretentious about my burgers, and it is RARE that I admit that I enjoyed a burger as much as a I did, so I really have no idea why there are so many low ratings. It might have been our timing of going there, we went around midnight, and it had a bunch of people there, but it wasn't too crowded.  Seriously, top 10 burgers for me, and everything else there was wonderful (shakes, fries, and service)
author: Sarah S.

description:
You guys have an amazing hamburger bun!  That was some quality meat too.

The only reason I came in here was to take a piss, but I'm glad I did.  Your burger is worth driving out there for!
author: Doug F.

description: One of the best burgers, hands down. Puts In N Out to shame! Fries equally good. Glad we discovered it!
author: Yvonne C.

description:
Sooooo yummmmmmm!!!! :)

Worth the price!!! The Garlic Fries are amazzzzzingggg!!!
author: Amy T.

description:
After the first handful of trips to Super Duper I was prepared to leave a mediocre review.  I found the burger far too greasy for comfort, and I generally enjoy greasy food.  

My wife recommended I reduce my order from 2 patties to 1, and I now find the level of grease to be acceptable.  

It is not my favorite Burger in the Marina - that distinction falls to a tie between the Truffle burger at Umami, and the Tejano burger at Roam.  

Still, it is a vast improvement over Johnny Rockets, and tends to be my go to since I live just down the street.

Here's to second chances!
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description:
I frequent the other two Super Dupers in town and I dig the burgers. I'm not sure how some of these other reviewers can complain that the burgers are too greasy. I didn't know there was such a thing as a too-greasy burger. If you want a crispy burger, go to Five Guys or something.

Anyway, love the burgers and would normally give Super Duper four stars, but the service at the Chestnut location, especially during lunch on a weekday, is worse than terrible. Specifically, the workers have no idea how to properly handle a line.

The first time I went there and the guy walked away from the register to do something else, whatever, they're new. Working the kinks out.

The second time a week later, I start to worry, but the guy didn't leave me hanging for too long.

The third time I went there this past week, I started my stopwatch when I got in line. A line that consisted of two people in front of me, and they were together. The one person they had at the register made *them* wait for over a minute while he did something to the ice cream machine. Mid-order, he also got involved in a to-go order that someone else had started handling.

When it finally came to be my turn, he said 'I'll be right back' and walked away yet again, messing around in the soda machine area, looked like he was re-stocking napkins or something. Then he expedited an order. Meanwhile I've been waiting for 8 freakin' minutes and my order hasn't even been taken yet. Before I knew it, I was down the street at Tacolicious and Super Duper did not get my business that day.

Look, (sorry to call you out), red-headed order taker guy. I don't know if or how Super Duper has trained you, but here's what you do. Park your ass in front of the register and don't move it an inch until there is nobody in line. Period. No excuses.
author: Matt J.

description:
I'm absolutely in love with this place! I come here whenever I can when I'm feeling a good hearty burger.

I've tried their vegetarian, chicken, and beef patties! All were delicious, the burgers always come out tasteful and juicy.

I always pair my burger with the garlic cheese fries. I might be bias since i love garlic, cheese, and fries even separated. The fries are so overly tasty that you don't even need any ketchup or dips.

The place and name is just adorable AND spiked milkshake? cray cray
author: Dorris W.

description:
Good place to lunch or dine. The price is fair but if you decide to upgrade your burger with other goodies or add sides, it might just add up. I average about 16 dollars per visit, but I think its worth it. The burgers and fries are super tasty and super greasy. Totally not recommended for health cautious people. 
Side note: Restaurant has really bad air quality; you will smell like BBQ & Hamburgers when you exit.
author: Wayne L.

description: I had a veggie burger and it was super yummy. The patty seems homemade and all of the toppings were really fresh. The best thing was that they have self-serve, free pickles! I will definitely go back.
author: Mylie T.

description: I LOOOOVE this place, their burgers are amazing and their garlic fries to die for. Everything tastes fresh and the staff is always friendly. Don't forget to try their homemade pickles and if you still have room in your tummy get the organic ice cream as well :)
author: Veruzka O.

description:
GOOD, FAST, and CHEAP.  Really great quality burgers, that won't leave a fat dent in your wallet. 

The mini 4 oz. burger was just right for me, but for $2 more, you can get double the amount of beef for only $6.50.  You can really taste the quality and freshness of the beef they use, which btw, comes from 100% vegetarian fed Niman Ranch cows.  The burgers come with the usual fixings:  lettuce, tomato, pickle, and super sauce (some type of delicious aioli).  Cheese is $0.50 - $1 extra.  

I really wanted to try the garlic fries, but opted for the regular ones because I was on a date.  I'll save the dragon breath for another visit.

Like they say on their website:  "FAST FOOD STYLE BURGERS, FRIES, AND SHAKES ALL MADE WITH THE BEST INGREDIENTS."  Amen to that.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
This was the location of Johnny Rocket.  Super Duper added outdoor tables and increased seating capacity inside as well.  Overall décor was well done.  We ordered the mini burgers, which was basically a quarter-pounder, with everything on it for $4.50 each.  If you do the combo with fries and drink, its $8; very reasonable considering the location and what you get.

My girlfriend and I were there at noon on a weekday.  The dining room was about  1/2 full.  After ordering at the counter, our meals arrived at our table in less than 10 minutes.  The beef was cooked just right with a hint of pink in the center.  We also shared an order of garlic fries, which was tossed with garlic and topped with a dash of shredded cheese.  It's as good as the garlic fries at AT&T Park, but less greasy.  Be sure to bring your own mints if you plan on having the garlic fries, unless you don't plan on returning back to work.

The mini-version was perfect for me.  The regular size was an 8-oz burger (basically two 4-oz patties), or  1/2 pound of beef.  You can't beat this for the price: you get a good burger, quick service, and nice atmosphere.  

.
author: Jean T.

description:
Is this supposed be a Shake Shack rip-off? I hope not, because if it is they forgot to rip off the fact that Shake Shack burgers are actually tasty.

Something's just not quite right about the burgers here. It's like the sum is less than its individual parts. The beef is quite good -- maybe the best part -- yet it's almost too... beefy? Like the beef flavor overwhelms the rest of the burger components. I think this is why some other reviewers so strongly recommend adding bacon, because otherwise the patty taste is overwhelming. Again, it's a good patty, but the whole thing should taste like a burger, not a piece of beef.

Likewise, the garlic fries are SO garlicky. Not a good or bad thing, but just be warned.

Price is slightly expensive but overall fair. Space is nice. Shakes are pretty good!
author: Albert L.

description:
What a welcome change from Johnny Rockets -- a national chain restaurant should known better than to post up in San Francisco, even the Marina!   If you've ever been to Shake Shack this place should look creepily familiar (not that that's a bad thing).

Came here with two friends last Saturday night around 6:30 or 7 PM; even at this peak time they did a great job keeping the line moving and tables turning.  I never saw people hovering around waiting for a seat...it just all kind of worked out.  Noise level was a little overwhelming, but I'll give them a pass since it was a Saturday night prime dinner time.

The menu is small (although it does include a chicken sandwich and mushroom burger to placate your non- red meat loving friends) but generally I'd rather them concentrate on perfecting a few items than half-assing stuff all over the map.  

The burgers come in 2 sizes -- small and large (the latter is 2 patties).  The milkshakes were great as was the lemonade.  Great fries -- garlic and regular.  Would love to see them add sweet potato or cheese fries to the menu.

I'm probably being a little generous with my stars given that I was (a) kind of still drunk from a trip to Napa and (b) ravenous since the extent of my food so far that day was like a baguette and cheese when I visited Super Duper, (not to mention (c) I'd spend all January in India where red meat is obviously prettyy hard to come by) but y'all, this place is legit.  

If you can't bare to come up to the Marina, there are a few other locations in the Castro and by Union Square.
author: Molly B.

description: Yum yum cheap pasture beef, what's not to love? it's not grass fed but good in a pinch. And the pickles. I do love the pickles. The gluten-free bunless option with lettuce is super nice too. Super duper good job, this is my quick beef fix.
author: Viv R.

description: Came here today because I had seen all the great reviews and wanted to try it for myself.  My girlfriend and I both got miniburgers with cheese and Super Sauce.  Both burgers were REALLY greasy.  I used at least 4 paper towels to sop up the grease on the burger.  My girlfriend started in on the fries first, and by the time she got to her burger, the bun was soaked through with grease.  Considering the reviews, I am assuming this was a fluke.  After I got all of the grease off, the burger itself was pretty tasty, but I'm not sure that I will go back.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Hey fellow Yelpers!

I went to Super Duper Burger in the Marina the other day on one of their first openings. Initially they had posted that they would open on 10/17. Four days later they actually had their grand opening (10/21), which only lasted a few days as they were closed again on 10/24 for lunch. 

Management should really work harder to provide proper information to their customers, or at least apologize for the late opening. That being said, the food was sub-par and certainly not worth the wait and/or price. My bun was not fresh and the veggie burger was falling apart all over the place.

If you are looking for good burgers in the Marina, this is not the place.

Hope this post doesn't get flagged and removed this time...

Relatively expensive for diner-esque burgers.


--- EDIT ---
Tried to go a second time today to enjoy a burger for lunch and they were closed. They advertise their hours from 11AM-11PM, still looks like they fail to follow their own guidelines. Nothing super, let alone duper about this place.
author: Ninja R.

description: Fries are perfect and delicious. Great flavor. Burger was very over salted, kinda hard to get through it. Syrup was out on the sprite, which happens but wasn't a pleasant surprise. But the self serve pickles were so good!! Wanted to take a jar
author: Natalie T.

description:
Super Duper burgers are greasiest burgers we ever had in our lives. The 2 patty deal makes a huge burger which tastes good but beware.....grease is dripping from the entire burger. They are cooking the burgers on a flat iron instead of a grill, so the fat can't drip down. When you press a meat this way, it cooks faster but the fat/grease will be just lingering around....which eventually gets absorbed by the bun....thank god they have excellent pickles, which will cut the grease in your mouth and belly....about 90 minutes of our burgers, both my husband and I had horrible heartburn and diarrhea....
The fries and pickles are excellent...there are way better burgers in SF....
author: Krisztina E.

description: Order the mini combo .. upgrade to the garlic fries. Add jack cheese. Add a fried egg .. and I guarantee you can't go wrong .. great now I want a burger ..
author: Jen P.

description:
I don't know if it's the chain or the specific branch itself but overall Super Duper was not the most super experience. I had heard rave reviews from a friend but all in all, my $13 bill left me feeling used and abused. Don't get me wrong, the fries were crispy and delicious but in the land of SF and especially the Marina, there are at least 2-3 other places that do a burger much better (FYI my burger was super rare and ridiculously greasy - in the not fun and delicious greasy way).

Glad I tried it so I know but I will be keeping to Roam or trying Umami burger in the future.
author: Rachel R.

description: Convenient location near work, friendly staff and you build your own freshly made to order burger... what's not to enjoy about SUPER DUPER?!? Their BEEF PATTIES are great although both times I've ordered CHICKEN the patties were overcooked. Be sure to order you burger with Blue Cheese, Bacon and Grilled Onions, yum! Their MILKSHAKES are tasty (both regular & "spiked") and their GARLIC FRIES are fresh but not overpowering. There are a few good burger joints in the Marina and some may be better but you will always get a good meal at SUPER DUPER.
author: G C.

description:
This burger joint is all about what's hot (build-your-own burgers, shakes, grass fed beef, hip interior, great neighborhood, beer).  Unfortunately, their product is terrible.  Their beef patties lack flavor, seasoning, and fat.  Their buns are stale.  Their cheese doesn't melt, because it's too processed.

While their prices are reasonable ($8.50 for a quarter pound burger, fries, and soda), I can't get over their terrible burgers.  Service and a cool concept isn't enough nowadays when there are better custom burger spots.
author: Valerie H.

description: Very satisfied with the service and the food! I'm happy I chose this place. I highly recommend the veggie burger!
author: Anthony B.

description:
12.31.11

I don't know what you do to your garlic fries, but keep it up!

OK maybe it's the enormous amount of garlic and cheddar.  Definitely keep it up!
author: Jenny L.

description: My friends and I went here after a long hike. It was a great burger for an amazing price in the city. Everything from the burgers to the fries and unlimited pickles were scrumptious. If you are looking for a good affordable burger this is the place to go. I would definitely go back!
author: Amanda T.

description:
Eh.
Garlic fries were soggy..
Burger was dry.
Big let-down.
author: Beth N.

description:
I've been a fan ever since the first restaurant opened in the Castro.  Followed Super Duper to  the financial district.  

I drove across town to check out the new Super Duper....just as good as the other two.

Staff is super friendly, the cooks work hard to give the customers the best experience.
author: Ricky B.

description: The outdoor seating is great for people watching, the staff was friendly and the food was great!
author: Katie K.

description:
I didn't intend to like Super Duper. I thought that it was probably over-hyped. And there are just way too many places to get a decent hamburger in the city. When I heard that Johnny Rockets was being replaced by another hamburger place I just thought, "What's the point?"

But - I was very very impressed. Not by the atmosphere or the service or anything other than the quality of the hamburger. It was absolutely delicious.

The ambience leaves a lot to be desired. When it's full the noise level is deafening and it's not terribly comfortable.

But the hamburgers make it all worthwhile.
author: Patsy K.

description: Thank you, yelp for the recommendation. My boyfriend is a big fan of the bacon on the two patty burger. I got a simple mini burger, and it was juicy and filled me up. The garlic fries we're top notch, but the regular fries we're just alright.
author: Tatiana F.

description: The burgers are so juicy and fresh not to mention they are made to order. I got a double patty, bacon cheeseburger with all the fix-ins. I even added jalapeños to the burger which really gave it a perfect kick. The restaurant has a great atmosphere and they even sell organic ice cream!
author: Cindy G.

description: Reeeaaaallly good, juicy beefy burgers. You can taste the freshness in the beef. All made medium. Serve all-natural Niman ranch beef, free range chicken burgers, organic soft serve ice cream shakes and malts. Cool deal. Didn't get 5 stars because they don't do refills on their brown sugar lemonade (which is delicious). For the price, they should.
author: Catherine V.

description:
I really like the Super Duper in Castro so I was excited to go here since it is so close to my work.

However...the restaurant was not open when it was supposed to be, on multiple occasions.

Initially the sign said it would be open on the 17th. The next day it said the 18th, then the next day the 19th. After that, then there were no signs to tell you when it would be open! So I went every day to check if it was open and the day I did not go (Friday), it opened! So I missed the opening! And then they closed it after that with a sign saying it will be open on the 25th (today). I am going to try it out today.

Additionally, a friend of mine wrote a review that got DELETED...saying the following:

This place should provide an accurate opening date for their customers. They were supposed to open on 10/17, but it was delayed again and again.

Nice PR Super Duper Burgers.

I think the franchise has really good food but the way they handled their opening was not professional and disappointing.

UPDATE: Went again today, was refused as it would not be open until 12:30 PM.
author: Gabriel G.

description:
PROS: None.

CONS: Everything. Literally the greasiest, most bland-tasting burger I have ever eaten. I literally felt like I was biting into a bag of grease. Felt terrible the rest of the night. That the ambiance is sterile and the servers remarkably unfriendly (especially considering what should be a fun, hip establishment) only reinforces my profound distaste -- literally -- for this place. Avoid at all costs. What a shame they replaced Johnny Rockets (which, fortunately, is not too far away still at Fillmore and... Pine? Bush?
author: Marc H.

description: Food was hella bomb. Def hit up that chicken sangwhich. Not to mention one of the friendliest staff I've ever encountered considering they don't work on tips.
author: Joey F.

description:
First time coming here with 2 friends this week. I had a protein style burger and garlic fries. The burger was very juicy and fresh! I'm not a huge beef eater so I can definitely tell when the beef is not fresh.. it has this gaminess to it. So I was very impressed! I also love that you can customize your burger however you want.

The garlic fries were a hit because we originally ordered one to share, but it was so good we ended up ordering 2 more! OoO.. I want some right now! Do they deliver?
author: Carol C.

description: This is 5 stars solely for the strawberry milkshake alone!!! My lawrdddd ...best ever, tastes homemade. Not too sweet, everything about it was just perfect. Looked around at what people were eating and it looked good, will def try other things next time
author: Andrea A.

description:
I love the burgers here and the fact that they have different size burgers!  Everything was very well put together, the bun perfectly toasted and the meat and sauce were all to my liking.  I like that you can order it to your specifications and while it might be a bit pricier than other places it was delicious!

It was a perfect burger coupled with their fries and a drink, it was all the right size for me as well. :)  Liked it so much that when I was back in the area the week after I had to eat it again!
author: Victoria Y.

description:
I have been to Super Duper a few times now since I work near by. I have to say that their burgers have been very consistent. The meat always tastes fresh with lots of flavor. It's advertised as very juicy and it certainly is. However, the flavor and juicyness comes from the fat content in the meat. It's not necessarily a bad thing but because of this, I eat here in moderation. My hands are always greasy after eating as the fat soaks through the wrapper. The fries are good as well as the home made pickles, where you can help yourself because it's located near the ketchup area.

Service is good as well as the atmosphere. It's always a clean feeling place. If you are in the mood for a good juicy burger, you won't be dissappointed here.
author: Jeff L.

description: Absolutely amazing, you could taste the freshness in every bite.  It was a little crowded and loud but I could understand as soon as I took my first bite.  The staff were super friendly and helpful.  I had heard amazing things but now I know first hand this is a must try place and as soon as you do you'll be hooked also.  The homemade pickles were delicious also it was like the cherry on top of the perfect sundae.
author: Trisha C.

description: Incredibly good. The double cheeseburger is perfect - just a little touch of grease so the burger, bun, cheese and condiments melt together. Honestly, it's more like a thick grilled cheese sandwich with meat in the middle. Reasonably priced (for the city, at least) too.
author: Nicholas R.

description: A for average - had the blue cheese super burger - super super greasy - fries were old and cold - wouldn't go back - not sure what the hype is all about.
author: Tim G.

description:
Mini burger was delish!  I added grilled onions and jalapenos.  The meat was browned nicely and really juicy.  The bun was toasted and buttery.

The staff was friendly and helpful.  They are still working out their kinks like most new places.  The space to get drinks, pick up orders and pickles is quite small and seemed to create a 'traffic jam'

My only complaint is how LOUD it is inside.  Sound bouncing and loud music.  I don't remember this from the Castro location.

I'll be back to try the chicken sandwich.
author: Laura G.

description:
My girlfriend and I normally frequent Roam on Union st when we're looking for a burger in the marina. But after hearing from a friend that Super Duper was opening on chestnut, we decided to give it a shot. 

We both ordered burgers with all the essentials. She asked for onion but when her burger arrived, it had none. She also asked for the "Super" 8-oz size but they served her a 4-oz "Mini." After realizing this, she sent it back and they politely made her a "Super" with onion.

When we picked up the burgers, grease literally spilled out from the wrapping and pooled on our tray. The beef and bun were doused in oil and both lacked any resemblance of taste. I could have gone to Safeway, grabbed some ground beef, and thrown it on a skillet to get the exact same result. Very disappointing considering how delicious the burgers are at Roam only a few blocks/bucks away. 

We also picked up some garlic fries, thinking they would be similar to those served at Pac Bell Park. But alas, they were merely cold and plain, with a small amount of finely crushed garlic topping them.

Do yourself a favor and go to Roam at Union and Octavia. Burgers are about $1.50 more and are exponentially more tasty.
author: Henry P.

description:
This is a solid diner burger at a good price.  I ordered the super burger which has two patties.  Next time, I'll order the mini burger (one patty) and it will be perfect, especially for $4 bucks.  Our burgers came out really fast and they were hot.  In addition, the fries were really hot and crispy too.  We also had a shake, very good too.  

Only recommendation, wish it would have been a little cleaner.  The tables were wiped off but still seemed dirty.  In addition, the seats had crumbs all over them.  The staff were very friendly but need to have better attention to detail on keeping place clean.
author: Shelly W.

description:
Great BALLS OF OIL!!!!! These Burgers are just the ones people crave if you were hungover. Yes they were Greasy, yes stuck up Bi%^* grazed over and had stupid conversations...but WHO CARES GET A LOAD OF THESE AWESOME FRIES! 
The fact after you finished you contemplated starting a diet the next day, has to be a sign of that nasty burger juiciness you just experienced. 

I ordered garlic fries and a burger with all the toppings. I have no complains this place definitely hit that G spot...(G as in Ginormous Food Craving geezzz you dirty dirty minds hehehe). Try it you'll either Love it, or hate it...because things this good and greasy are never good for anyones Cholesterol no matter how young you are. 

P.S If your mind wanders into the wood cow art piece, and you start to imagine how much router and layout time it took to make that cow look so seamlessly effortless.....no worries you are not alone in your Dorky meat eating, wood working ways, there were others before you who did just that as they took a bite of their Super Duper Burger.
author: Lannette G.

description: Had the pleasure of eating here last night at the grand opening. All natural 100% Niman Ranch burgers, locally sourced organic shakes and cones (try the "spiked" shake with Soju), free range chicken sandwich and garlic fries. Fast food can be healthy (er). Plus very friendly staff. Can't wait to try the pecan pie!
author: C T.

description:
This is a very good diner quality burger and one of the better $5.00 cheeseburgers you can get in  San Francisco.

Get a double (half pound) cheeseburger for $7.60 including taxes.

They don't ask, but you can get it cooked to order.  Without asking of the two burgers we ordered, one was medium rare and one was well done.

These are messy.   Due to the high fat content of the meat (and I would guess these are 75% lean, 25% fat), these are a little drippy, but very tasty.

The strawberry shakes are delicious.
Thin cut garlic fries are very good.

The interior aisles are narrow and not suitable for a wheelchair (likewise, strollers are asked to park outside).

Street parking is not too tough.

Bonus: Like Johnny Rockets before them, this place is open late.

(PS, why does Yelp ask if they have a television?   Is this what family style means? lol)
author: Kelly D.

description: I ate here yesterday and both my friend and I were so pleased with the warm welcome we received from Ryan. He was jovial, funny and went out of his way to make sure we had a great experience, which we did. Thanks Ryan! Super Duper Burgers is Super Duper Lucky to have you. We will be back..
author: Brian R.

description:
I really like Super Duper Burgers. Their garlic fries are ridiculously awesome! The meat is high quality and the burgers are all-around good. 

A few times, I've received a burger that had a decent amount of pink meat - my understanding is that fast-food burger joints make burgers with no pink by default. If so, it'd be awesome if you could cook the burger a little longer. I've resorted to just ordering well done so it's not a big deal for me.

Also, I probably eat at this Super Duper Burger two to three times a week - it'd be awesome if you guys had a loyalty program =).
author: Mo A.

description:
Name says it all.  It truly was super duper.  Also the fries were fabulous and they had a jar of home made pickles you could help yourself to.  
Best lemonade ever, even without vodka in it!
author: Megan S.

description: One of the most delicious veggie burgers I've had - plus an excellent bun and incredibly reasonable prices.
author: Kim C.

description: Plain delicious burgers. Had the big one with lots of pickles and loved it. Wife had the same and she loved it, and have in mind that wife is so picky about food.
author: Raul G.

description: A good burger place....not as good as shake shack, but hearty portions and tasty nonetheless. And can't argue with the Niman Ranch quality beef. Also got the garlic fries, which were above average (shredded cheese and parsley was a nice touch) - but they're not as good as Gordon Biersch, which sets the standard for awesome garlic fries.
author: Philip L.

description:
I came here for lunch on July 4, because what is more American than a burger and fries? My friend from outer Richmond said I had to try this place so we both went. It was very crowded but we were able to score a tall table by the window. The burger was solid with quality ingredients with a small mess factor (good thing) and toppings that were there but didn't overrule the meat. 

The main downside is no fault of Super Duper, but I just can't handle the Marina. The whole area was dominated by young, rich, gorgeous people who look like they've never dealt with adversity of any kind. If you've ever wondered what happens to the popular cheerleader crowd from high school, they end up in the Marina. Watching all the holiday sidewalk traffic in this part of the city started bumming me out while I was attacking my food. 

I know there's other Super Duper locations, so I'll try one of those next time. And there will be a next time.
author: Sherry G.

description:
This place should be called Super Duper Greasy.  No flavor at all.  Had to douse my burger with ketchup and hard fries :(  

I'll pass.
author: B J.

description: Seriously one of the best burgers in town! And the employees are super nice. Can't wait to go back!
author: Michelle D.

description: Delicious burgers.  The fries were so so.  Shakes were yummy.  Service was fast and efficient.  I'm a fan.
author: Animal K.

description:
YAY!! 
  I am a huge fan of a good burger for a cheap price and this place was great.  The staff was very friendly and funny, and answered all of my questions.  Bradly was my food runner and took the time to chat me up and recommend some other good places in the area.  I will definitely be back and recommend this place as a great after-bar food restaurant.
author: Matthew G.

description:
I am not a burger person. I am a vegetarian and always have a hard time finding a veggie burger that doesn't taste and look like like processed  faux meat. 

Super Duper won me over! They have a great veggie burger that is loaded with vegetables and grains. you can actually see the different types of veggies in the burger and it had a great char to it.

Super Duper in the Marina took over the old Johnny Rocket's location right on the corner. It opened a few weeks ago but this place is alwasy croweded and has a line right out the door! They have a small section of booth seats(about 6) that can sit up to 6 and then a long counter for bar seats where you can look over at teh cooks and see them making your food. 

My husband and I went on a Saturday to Super Duper around 11:15am and there was already a line forming. And why not! they have a clean, simple menu with great choices. They have meat burgers in two different sizes: Super and Mini. The mini is the perfect amount if you are hungry and teh Super is your are REALLY hungry. They have a great selection of toppings. From the normal(lettuce, onion tomatoes to the extraordinary, fried egg, grilled peppers, blue cheese sauce). 

They also have a chicken sandiwch, veggie burger, portobello sandwich, salads and fries(garlic or plain.) For an extra dollar, you can get 2 of their homemade sacues: susper sauce, homemade mayo and chipotle

I love that they have something for everyone and are willing to make the extra effort. If you don't like something, they will be more than happy to fix it for me. I complicated my veggie burger order by asking for cheese, not hummus and added lettuce,m tomato, super suace and jalapeno). They forgot the cheese and when i told them, they quickly fixed the issue in a flash! How great!

They have great shakes that are easily shared! We ordered a choclate milkshake with fresh strawberries added. Delicious. They didn't have their liquour license when we went, otherwise we would have gotten it "spiked" for an extra $1.50. They will be serving beer, and wine along with their fountain drinks, iced tea and fresh lemonade.

For dessert, organic soft serve cones!

I will absolultey be back!
author: Whitney S.

description: best burger ever!!!! home made picklesl‼.....a must try for the burger lover..san francisco is all about sea food to me usually.... but this place made me appreciate the reason to come here for a perfect burger.
author: Janet C.

description: Over the top, awesome. Little noisy and crowded, but once you bite into your burger you'll understand what the fuss is all about. Insanely fast service and you can watch it all be prepared in front of you. Lot of flavor in the patty and garlic fries. Great lunch spot. All organic grass fed beef, and there's vegetarian options for you herbivores.
author: Julio C.

description:
Came in with the Gilt City coupon offer. For $22 (coupon face value) + $2.74 for some upgrades, we got 2 super duper mini, 2 garlic fries, 1 beer, 1 white wine and 2 cones. 

I would say it's the best burger I've ever had, but it's getting close to the top of the list. Bottom line is that the patties are juicy, cheddar on the fries has been aged pretty well. Considering the price and the ambiance (outdoor seating in a typical SF summer day), it's a solid 4 star experience.
author: Danny G.

description:
Fantastic! So messy, but so good. Cookies & Cream shake is awesome.

Try their Super burger with cheese and an egg. Pair it with their garlic fries and a shake, and you'll experience food bliss!
author: Jonathan T.

description: Super duper yummy burgers and soft serve that becons to us very single time we head to the city.  My only wish is that the fries were consistently hot.  When I want to go ahead and have French fries, hot is important to me.  That said, eat here.  Lots.  It is super yum!
author: Melly G.

description: ramp it up, my fries and my pals where barely hot. it wasn't that busy when I visited and truth be known, I waited a long time for the order to arrive.
author: Henry K.

description:
The first experience here was the soft serve, while strolling with the girls on Chestnut street, exceptionally smooth and delicious with just the right hint of Vanilla. Be mindful that it's rich and heavy so the Kid Size is a better bet. 

My second experience was the Super Shake (Chocolate and Fresh Strawberries) with Chicken Sandwich (Chipotle Aioli). You would think that it's a skinny glass once you see it but I would say share it, you don't know how much that glass can hold. The shake is simply fantastic, not overly sweet and not over powering in either of the two tastes. It went very well with the sandwich. It was a heavy meal but for the amount we paid, it was a lot of food. My friend tried the Super Burger, I need to get my own the next time is all I can say, since between the sandwich and the burger I was enjoying both. Everything was simply delectable!

P.S.. The garlic fries are really Super Duper!
author: En J.

description: I've been to Super Duper a few times and enjoyed my experience each time. The burgers are downright juicy and the salads with chicken and avocado are a nice option if you want to go healthy. I recently discovered that you can actually put a beef patty on the salad and Wow! I was amazed! Who would've thought??? And since I like my food spicy, the jalapenos were definitely a great addition. As suggested by one of the workers a beef patty with bacon and avocado on a the super salad makes a nice protein packed lunch. I find myself craving it every so often. Service is always quick and prices on point, pickles are delish and soft serve makes an awesome dessert!!
author: Trina M.

description: This place was my favorite at my recent trip to SF. I stayed at a hotel close to there and saw it on my way to a coffee shop. It's located on a corner very nice comfortable location. The staff was very friendly and social. For a Monday night this place was beyond busy. Dont recommend the garlic fries. Werent bad just personal preference. Try the chicken sandwich with bacon and cheese. Also their lemonade is great! Done with brown sugar. Price was greaf. Overall great experience. I went there the next day and was recognized by the staff, was treated to a drink. Thanks! Going back when in SF. Hopefully soon.
author: Adrian C.

description:
Not bad for a late night burger joint.  I would still pick in-n-out burger over this place.  But for something near by and open late its not bad. 

I ended up with a super duper cheeseburger with bacon and onions and fries.  YUM!  Definitely got my burger fix.  It's super greasy, super big burger and super fast!  Love it.  Chocolate dipped ice cream cone was AWESOME!  You have that to complete the meal :)
author: Ying F.

description: I have to say this is by far thee best burger I've EVER had. The cheese fries were top notch, but that burger THOU!!!! My god I knew SF had some of the best gourmet but this is ridiculous:) if a burger is this good I could just imagine how everything else is.
author: Daniel A.

description: Vanilla shake with malt was so freaking good. The only thing that could top it was the cookies and cream option but I was being good...this time!
author: Emm C.

description: Walked in to grab an organic chocolate dipped ice cream cone. How do you ruin THAT, right?! The service sucked that bad! Cashier had a crappy attitude and server handed me an already melted, dripping ice cream cone that I wrapped 5 napkins around just to avoid disaster. Ended up throwing a $4.35 soft serve ice cream away bc it was a giant mess before I could even get to my car. Bummed!
author: Melody T.

description: Super duper burger with cheese and avocado and fries. Beef was juicy cheese melted quite well. 1st bite almost an orgasm when you're starving, but subsequent bites, the oily burger starts to get to you. I'm more of a habit burger fan it's less greasy.
author: Jonathan l.

description: Well i returned, and maybe it was a rough day, but things didnt go very smoothly. Confusion with my order, slightly too much sauce (making the burger a bit soggy), and the biggest let down, which was, that i didnt get my burger Medium how they used to do it. I normally cook my own burgers medium rare to rare, so when i received it well done i was pretty disappointing. My fathers burger and brother's was also not cooked medium. It wasn't dry or anything by any means, but yah. Oh well maybe next time.
author: Emilio G.

description:
I have heard many people RAVE about this burger joint so I decided to check it out for myself.  Burgers have a special place in my palate.

I found it to be a good spot to grab a good burger.  Not necessarily anything to write home about but that is precisely its appeal!  It isn't pretentiously dressed up and over charged.  It is a perfect spot to grab a quick bite to eat.  The staff was friendly, the price point appropriate.  

The tomato was a bit thinly sliced for my taste but the burger was cooked perfectly to my liking.
author: Ambere S.

description: Love their special sauce. Very juicy burger. Makes for messy eating, but is delicious!
author: Anne K.

description:
I wasn't expecting much from this place, but I think they're doing a nice job.  

Tried the regular cheeseburger (which is actually two quarter pound patties, they will sell you a burger with one patty as well) and thought that it had a really nice sear from the griddle and that the meat was well seasoned and definitely had enough fat... actually, maybe they should just a little leaner beef.  The cheese was completely melted between the patties, bun was nice.  Toppings didn't add much and the fries were kind of weak. 

All in, this is 1,000 times better than the Johnny Rockets that used to occupy the space and it's nice to have an option on Chestnut where I can get a decent burger without having to be waited on.
author: Peter M.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is a great addition to the Marina.

Chicken sandwich- godawful. 
The bun and stuff it comes with is good- the chicken itself is gross.  
Gross smell (unappetizing spice mixture).
Gross texture. What sort of piece of chicken is this?  It was so...striated. 

The smell of the spices on the chicken turned me off and that's a first for me. 
I'm not a spice disliker.

My friend had it recently and doused it in chipotle sauce.
He liked it. 
I shoulda got the sauce.

Their sauces would make the cashier taste good.

French Fries- very good to excellent
Garlic Fries-very good to excellent

Vanilla soft serve cone (chocolate dipped)-very good, normal ice cream flavor, kid's size is BIG.
Milkshakes-there is some weird flavor to these I can't place. 
I tried the vanilla first and returned it because of that weirdness. 
I got the chocolate, it had that weird flavor, too. I have no idea what it is.

Veggie burger- first time I liked it a lot. 

Second time, it was good except for some seed that was like crunching on glass.  I didn't notice that the first time because I had 23 seconds before a show and swallowed it whole.

I'll give the veggie burger another try.
 
Okay so I examined it.
Yes, it is filled with annoying little seeds; they of the glass-like consistency.
I doused it in Super-Secret Sauce 
(now you won't remember if it's called Super or Secret Sauce. Hint: it's one of those) 
and it helped.

I do like the veggie burger overall;  I'll tolerate the glass seeds (but minus one star).

I appreciate that they're open later than most places on Chestnut, for that reason alone they get a star.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description: Love super duper! Fresh tasting good burger! Parmesan fries were delish. Burgers are juicy which is my thing about what makes a good burger and freshness of meat. Doesn't taste like a frozen patty yuk....overall can't go wrong if u want a good burger
author: Roger P.

description:
I purchased a coupon from Gilt Group for 2 burgers, 2 fries, 2 beers, and 2 cones for $22 which was a steal in my book.

Service: 5/5
When I arrived with my girlfriend I told the cashier we had the Gilt coupon and he said no problem. He was polite, knowledgeable, and let us know everything that came with our coupon, and he even let us sample the different beers on tap before choosing which ones we wanted. 

After we placed our order and he was typing in the coupon, he asked his manger if he should cross my name out of the book now, and the manger told him to take care of the customers behind us first and not have us wait. ether Right here showed management has a customer first attitude.

Food: 3.8/5
I got a regular cheeseburger with garlic fries and my girlfriend got the special Gilt mini burger with blue cheese. Both burgers came with everything and they were good, but not mind blowing away. Also the size was quite small and needed to be a bit bigger.

Next time I would get two patties on my burger. The garlic fries were delicious and I would recommend getting them over the regular fries. They weren't too strong and just had the right amount of garlic.

The cones were pretty good, and they brought back a nostalgic feel of having them as a kid.

Overall I would go back to Super Duper if I'm in the area or near one of the other locations, but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Do not order the portobello sandwich. Not worth the price & it is not super duper. Maybe good as a kid's meal.
author: Katherine V.

description:
had their soft serve only - though it took a lot longer than a soft serve would take to dish up, it was yum. it wasn't too sweet and it wasn't too bland. reminded me of the good ol' days. 

the burgers smelled really good but i can't really comment on them since i didn't get to eat one. (had the tipsy pig prior to coming here, but i'm sure it would've been 50x better than tipsy pig's hockey puck hamburger patty.)
author: Vicki T.

description: If you're a vegetarian like myself, this veggie burger is pretty damn good. After a solid workout, I'd eat here anyday.
author: Bree G.

description:
Despite its name, don't expect large portions.  If you have a large appetite, I suggest  ordering the signature 2 patty namesake, the mini just won't cut it. It's pretty much the size of a cheeseburger at you local in and out. Toppings are quite limited and don't contribute much to size.  Their fries share a similar texture to those found at in and out, crispy and crunchy.

I really enjoyed the fact that burger patties are made to order and not defrosted. You can actually see the cooks frying them. Made there right in front of your eyes, theres not much to worry about except maybe that beef could be leaner, my wrapper had quite a bit of grease on it. 

Service is cordial and pretty efficient. 

Tip#1 get the garlic fries, way way way more flavorful than simple fries

Tip#2: If you don't mind splurging a little, add an EGG to your mini sandwich. It reduces red meat content and still gives you the same amount of protein at a fraction of the calories! It's also less expensive than the two patty meat overload. My cousin and sister tried it and loved it!!!! Hot tip******

Tip 3: soft serve is organic and very rich. Two people should probably share one  regular size cone. They are very big. I ordered a mixed chocolate and vanilla combo, the chocolate was a bit overwhelming for me but the vanilla was simply delectable! Highly recommended.

Tip 5: chiles included in sandwiches are quite spicy so be sure to order them on the side.

Overall, food is decent and fresh but a bit pricey for the small servings.
author: Sue T.

description:
Had a mini-burger with blue cheese and bacon. Really tasty, really juicy- 4 stars for the food, three napkins for my hands. ; )
Excellent value.
author: Johanna S.
