description: I'm in love with Super Duper's garlic fries, I have been since day 1. However this location is definitely more cramped than the one in Union Square which is sad because it means less space for garlic fry lovers to sit. Oh well, Super Duper is still Suuuuper Duper!
author: Idk A.

description:
We were starving at 1am, having eaten dinner inordinately early in order to get into a movie. Everything we tried was closed, but Yelp Mobile told us that Super Duper was open. 

Sadly, the location was in Super Duper Douchebag  territory (a.k.a. the Marina). The place was filled with drunk dude-bros eating ice cream cones. We ignored them as best we could and ordered our food -- two cheeseburgers and a side of fries. Trying to find a seat, we realized the restaurant was trashed thanks to the aforementioned douche bags. Happily, a cashier came and cleared the table off. Shortly after, we got our food. It was tasty.

Probably won't go back to this location unless we have no other options, but definitely going to seek out Super Duper burgers in the future.
author: Karen C.

description:
Absolutely Fantastic! 
I love Super Duper Burgers and the fact that I have one close to home is just amazing.
Great service!
author: Ana J.

description:
I just started my diet which consists of NO meat. I work in the Marina and I am constantly on the hunt for new foodventures, especially in a thriving restaurant area like this. I noticed this cute burger joint opening up a few months ago, because I always pass this corner to get to the middle area of Chestnut St. I know that this isn't the first location because per Twitter, my friend said he had enjoyed the burgers from the Market St. location.

I've been on this diet for a month/couple of weeks now and I told myself I am going to be strict and really stick to my seafood/veggie choices. It was last week when I was passing Super Duper Burgers that I saw they had a portobello sandwich, and I dreamt about the ones from my trip to New York from Shake Shack (drool). So I looked up their menu once I got back to the office and decided that I should try it, though it will definitely not be up to SS standard. 

I just finished off my portobello sandwich and one word describes it: YUM! I got it to my liking too: no onions or tomatoes, with jalapenos please. The bread was incredibly soft and the "secret sauce" was just enough. The garlic fries are on point, not a huge serving (I love to eat, but I can't eat a lot). Wish I got a spiked milkshake to complete my meal, but there's next time. I brought my lunch back to the office, but the restaurant itself was clean and bright.

I hope to try a real burger once I get off this diet!

I was able to pay for my food and get back to the office within 5-8 minutes. I love good food and fast service.
author: Jenna R.

description:
I can't really say anything bad about this place.  Although I find their marketing a bit backwards.  "Fast food burgers, Slow food value.."  Their burgers are actually high quality.. and pretty freakin delicious.  Yeah!

I'm the guy that likes the shabu place with the better sauce, when everyone else likes the place with the better meat.  So sue me.  Needless to say their "super sauce" won me over.  But wait a minute.. their meat is some high quality shizzle too?  For sho!~

I saw the optional extra toppings like avacado, egg, roasted peppers and portabellos and I had to get the works.  Think, "one of those juicy, drippy, messy, delicious-looking carl's jr. commercials," except, it's actually as good as it looks.

The fries and garlic fries are awesome as well and the choice of dipping sauces only further secured Super Duper's place in my heart.  

Having started my 2012 sexy diet (which will more likely than not be abandoned by the time you read this), I abstained from having a shake, but my friend had one and she thought it was pretty good too.
author: steve c.

description:
Unadulterated travesty. Equivalent of Jack in the Box on a bad day. The good: fries (but not stellar). The bad:
1. It costs $1+ extra for cheese but you get American cheddar, nothing more (really?).
2. Bread isn't warmed or grilled (yep, cold as a corpse), and the bun is the small kind from Safeway - they sell those for $2.99 per pack of 8. I wonder what the bun would look like had I ordered the $5 "mini burger" - perhaps the size of an Oreo?
3. They don't ask how you want the burger cooked, and so it's no surprise that one day they cook it well and another - medium rare or something else (2 times is enough for me).
4. When you order to go, no one cares to put a napkin in your bag. So if you are on the go and in a hurry, you are screwed. Same goes for ketchup.
Summary:
A travesty. An annoying, shameful, unadulterated travesty. Why do I give them two stars and not one? Because I am a nice guy and because their fries are above average. This place should be called Super Dump, not Super Duper. Grow up peeps. The good news? They have lots of room for improvement :)
author: Sander X.

description:
If stranded on a deserted island and given only one option of food to eat for the rest of my days, I'd definitely choose cheeseburger and fries. These days I'm still trying to make up for keeping kosher my first 12 years of life. So, I will take any opportunity presented to order one. I usually like waiting a few weeks/months after a new place opens to let them work all the kinks out. This was pretty tough to accomplish with SuperDuper, considering it smells delicious from the street and I'm always walking past it. A buddy suggested a field trip to the marina for some SuperDuper a few weeks ago and I was all in. 

I went with the regular burger and some well-done fries. The burger was pretty awesome-juicy, cheesy, savory. The only problem was the bun was too greasy, necessitating the use of lots of napkins. It was definitely what Cam W. would call a "gut bomb."

Mid-week lunch with a full afternoon ahead? Probably not a great idea. Saturday 1PM with a hangover? Perfect.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Great Burger, great pickles and awesome service. If you're looking for a classic burger you can't go wrong here! Best late night food in the Marina!
author: Reynaldo B.

description: This place really is delicious. The shakes are really good and the burgers are also good. I'm always cool with a "mini," which just means one patty instead of two, but most men I know get themselves the bigger one. I'm not much for fries, but apparently these fries are pretty good and you can get garlic ones, too. Only downside about this place - at all their locations - they get really busy! So unless you're early or late, get ready for lines. Lines go by quick and food comes out quick, but if you come at prime time plan to take it elsewhere to sit and eat because seating will be scarce for you.
author: Emily R.

description:
Great little burger place in the hood.  The decor is nice.  The food is good. The line is kinda crazy.  

We got a few of the Super Duper burgers.  Mine came back incorrect, but that's understandable due to the sheer volume of this place.  Lots of folks coming in and out, but if you're looking for a tasty burger from a pretty limited menu, this is it.  

It's not super fancy, but it is exactly what you'd expect.  Next time, I think I'll try the shakes and see if I can't get this up to 4 stars.
author: Andy S.

description:
We were too full to try the burgers, but the fries and milkshakes are amazing. The fries were perfectly crispy but still tender. They were a bit salty though.

We tried their vanilla milkshake, vanilla malt milkshake, and chocolate and fresh strawberries milkshake. They are really thick milkshakes and filling. I highly recommend the chocolate and fresh strawberries. All of us were in awe because you can really taste the strawberries. 

Will come back for their burgers.
author: Tif L.

description:
I actually got around to ordering from them, after trying to place a phone order several times to no avail, I walked over and got myself the mini-burger and an order of fries. 

The burger was okay, the fries were good, but honestly I just don't know what all the hype was about. They're regular-tasting burgers. And they sure don't cater to take-out orders very much, there were no packaged sauces or ketchup, they had no containers either -- so I had to put the pickles in the paper, bleeding through -- they are pretty unprepared for take out orders for sure!!

I do have to dock points for the olfactory factor, I was in there for a total of 5 minutes to place and pick up order, and when I left I smelled like grease!! My hair, my clothes..... And all the strollers in the little cramped space just made me want to pull my now-stinky hair out.
author: Marie F.

description: An excellent cheeseburger. I had this with some fries which where pretty decent. I'd pass on their ketchup however. Too sweet for me.
author: Brad C.

description:
Went in the other day, had a regular burger with everything (tomatoes, red onion, lettuce and secret sauce).  First off, I didn't even taste the "secret" sauce, and second, theh burger was pretty bland.  Fries were decent.

Didn't wow me, but glad I was able to try them out..
author: Jennifer H.

description: This place is delicious! Quick service, reasonably priced and always a good experience eating here. I love the mini cheese burger and garlic fries! SOOO good.
author: Jessica L.

description:
We miss Johnny Rockets!! 
This place is NOT kid friendly
No wait staff
You have wait in a line to order like a cow being herded
If you want a dessert you have to get up again and go wait in line
The employees don't all wear uniforms
Instead of a relaxed fun sit you are bombarded by staff yelling out  names- three or four times until someone finally claims their order
They even ask you if you are eating here or to go and
if you say for here they make u get up and come back to te bar to grab ur 
food before having to find ur seat 
Then u could loose ur seat!
Again no kids game menus!!

The best thing about the whole entire business is the Dyson hand dryer on the wall of the bathroom!!!

Next time we are skipping this joint and heading over to the other Johnny Rockets!!
author: Omar N.

description:
mMmm gimme my burger now! (^_^)v

My first ever super duper burger was scarfed down at this location on a beautiful saturday afternoon! Me and the BF just left the monthly SF english bulldog meetup at Crissy Fields and we had a craving for a burger. Super duper has always been on the top of my list to try. So since it was on the way home. what better time?!

There was a lot of foot traffic but we were able to get a seat outside to accomodate our 4-legged friend. At first there were no seats but a couple minutes later one came available and immediately, someone came out to clean the tables and we were seated! My BF went into order while i manned the table. He ordered me a super burger and garlic fries. YUM! He forgot to add my egg so he ran in promptly to fix that and everything came out perfect! No issues, no attitude by the workers for the subsequent change. 

While waiting for our food, they saw our 4 legged friend brutus and came out with a bowl of fresh cold water for him! So not only were we more than satisfied with our food and service, i'm sure if brutus can write a review, he would give them 5 stars too! *Woof*

Oh man, i am getting hungry and *drooling* just writing this! Delivery please!

Overall, great food, great service!

I would definitely go back for the food, for the service, for the outdoor seating. 

Goal: try their soft serve dipped in chocolate!
author: Bevo T.

description: the service was great! staff was super kind and accommodating to our family of 5. would definitely go back.
author: Grace S.

description: Great spot to people watch while munching on a greasy delicious burger. Oh did I mention the tasty buns and tangy pickles. Yup.
author: Ed G.

description:
Came in for a milk shake and let me just say it was not super duper. We tried both the cookies n cream and the stawberry and it was the biggest waste of $12 ever. They were extremely watery and the cookies and cream one tasted more like vanilla with a crumbled sugar cookie inside it. 

Step yo game up please.. It was so awful my friend threw his "cookies n cream" one away after 3 sips. 

TIP: Do yourself a favor and DON'T DO IT.
author: Kristen C.

description:
I don't know where you grew up, but my memories of burgers and ice cream from childhood swirl around Fosters Freeze.  Note I said burgers AND ice cream.  If you wanted great ice cream, or outstanding burgers you wouldn't necessarily go to Fosters Freeze.  Heck, if you wanted decent burgers and ice cream you still might not go to Fosters Freeze, but that's not the point.  You went because it was cheap, it was quick, you could sit outside on a hot day, and it was/is Americana.

When Super Duper opened in the hood I crossed my fingers that "warm" days in the Marina would echo of my days as a youth, with chocolate dipped vanilla cones, so cheap and sweat even then I knew they couldn't be good for me.  Alas, things weren't meant to be.

As is usually the case with restaurants in the Marina, or generally SF, the prices are tenuously high for the type of food being served.  That's not so much of an issue when the foods great, or good, or fills a niche.  But when the burgers are "just" better than fast food, when the fries are dumped in a little fast food tray with abandon, and when for the life of them they can't serve a chocolate dipped ice cream without it dripping oily black streams of unsolidified chocolate down your hands and onto your tight button fly jeans, I don't know what to say.

Kids and families?  Welcome.  People looking for great burgers?  Questionable, but arguable.  Men looking to rehash the best summer days of their youth through ice cream induced flashbacks?  Dead in the water.

Oh, but they do have great shakes!!  Let's just see how interested I am in getting a shake when order/then be seated line is out the door and it's raining.
author: joe z.

description: Burgers were good. Juicy and delicious. Garlic fries were awesome. Burgers advertised as cooked medium but came out closer to well done. Tasty and def get a shake. Classic fries, burger and a shake place.
author: Drew N Chelsea R.

description: Great, juicy burger on a deliciously toasted bun, made by La Boulange! Their meat sweats quality and their ingredients have always proven fresh. Seriously the best hang over cure is a Super Duper burger and some people watching on Chestnut Street. Oh, and definitely grab their chocolate cookie milk shake. Lactose intolerant? Worth it.
author: Meredith M.

description: Sad to say. Had good experiences here before. This time the double was over salted, colder than a grill off the grill burger and was cold half way through. The fries were old and stale. Sorry guys never again. In n out has all of my burger business going forward.
author: Robert P.

description:
In regard to my original complaint about the chicken sandwich being over cooked,
dry and tough, and the fries being over cooked and super duper greasy, I get this
response from their manager Annie W, who obviously did not read and take in
what I my complaint was all about. Here is her response:

Annie W., Manager has sent you a message on Yelp:
Your Review
"Hi Dee G,
Thanks so much for taking the time to leave a review.  We take customer feedback seriously as we continue to improve and refine our practices, so we appreciate that you shared your experience. I'm sorry to hear you weren't a fan of our Portobello burger, next time you come in try our veggie burger--it's a customer favorite! Either way, thanks for the feedback." 

SHE TOTALLY DID NOT ADDRESS MY COMPLAINT!!
author: Girly Foodie F.

description:
Good place for burgers. Fast and good quality. A bit over priced for a in-n-out style burger. Maybe because its in the Marina district they raise it an extra few bucks. Good place once in a while.
Good shakes and toppings on the burger. Never had anything besides the beef burger as they do have a turkey and chicken burgers. 
The fries couls use some work. I love garlic fries and they have them. When they come to your table, they are unflavored and soggy. The garlic is just thrown on top and not mixed in to the fries. After the top layer of garlic fries are done, you only have "fries" left. 
This burger place seems to have won multiple awards for the burger, but I hope not for the fries. In my opinion a great burger is accompanied by great fries. 
This is why I gave them 3 stars. Customer services is good and I like that they deliver the food to your table and you dont ha e to wait. I like to enjoy a beer on a nice day with the outdoor seating.
Overall, good place, maybe ask for the fries well done and it might help to compliment a good burger. The mini burger(1 patty) is usually filling with all the toppings!
author: Satish P.

description: Used to be my FAVORITE burger place.. Went today and found out they raised their prices & made the burgers smaller... ALOT smaller.. The size for the mini-burger is enough to get full with but the price $9.75.. mmm not a fan...
author: Jillian S.

description: They have Mexican Coke in the glass bottles, so that was fantastic. Their garlic fries are amazing, though not much there for $3. I got a veggie burger adding avocado (costs $1 for add) and found it to be less than "super duper". The burger was basically flavorless. It was a real disappointment. I don't think I'll be returning for a burger, but maybe fries and to try an organic soft serve cone!
author: Christy C.

description: We had the mini combo and the amount of food was perfect. The price of the meal is fair.  The burger was really
author: Robert C.

description:
Not quite super.

The third and newest location of this growing burger empire. Space is compact and busy. Peeps everywhere. Menu is simple and focused. Three burgers (beef, veggie and chicken). A few sides. The famed milkshakes.

Veggie came topped with hummus. And a special sauce. Yes on the former. No on the later. Let's do this.

Round 1: No hummus. Plenty of special sauce.

Round 2: No hummus. No special sauce.

Round 3: Side of hummus handed to me.

Third time was finally the charm.

Burger was good and it wasn't that expensive (six bucks). Maybe a little small for the price. Bun was bland white sesame. Unlimited pickles for the taking just like at the Castro location. 

Secure at three stars. Far from four. Missing that something extra to truly earn the Super Duper title.
author: Jason B.

description: Popped in here to grab a milkshake and it was the best I've ever had. It was just a standard shake and I was sharing it with my boyfriend and the lady put it in little mini cups so we could have half each. It had pieces if Oreo in too! Yummmm!
author: Charlotte M.

description:
GREASY! But very scrumptuous. A bit overpriced IMO given within the vicinity (Barney's, Roam, Umami, In N Out) considering competition. I liked it but it's not my favorite. I do give them points for staying open late.

Another great item is their hand dipped cones. Wow is it amazing, wow is it expensive. Something to try.
author: Nelson C.

description: Mini burger with bacon and cheese. Garlic fries with 3 different sauces. The fries are skinny and crispy, which is what I love most. Get your own pickles. Yum, Yum, Yum. Glad to finally try this place.
author: Karen H.

description: These burgers are delicious, made with grass fed beef. I've only tried the burgers twice, and the garlic fries are pretty darn tasty too, with garlic, parm and fresh parsley on top. Love these burgers!
author: Piper W.

description: really good!  Amazing veggie burger, especially if you add avocado.  It has hummus and cucumbers on it!  It's pretty busy at lunch time during the week, but we always manage to find a seat.  The service is really friendly.  Plus free pickles while you wait--nothing better than that.
author: kate s.

description: The best garlic fries and shakes. Great customer service. Freshly made hamburgers.
author: Tere G.

description: So far, this is in my top faves for burgers. Fast service and great quality. Ordered the mini with the works, cheese, and bacon. Delish! The burger was cooked to a perfect medium, so juicy and tasty. Also ordered a side of the garlic fries which are a must. Oh, and the pickles, homemade crunchy pickles that you can help yourself to. Perfect balance of tang and spice.
author: Nicole G.

description: YUM YUM YUM. I love to eat at this delicious and fun restaurant whenever shopping on Chestnut St. with friends. What I would order: Bacon Cheeseburger with a side of fries, and occasionally a milkshake. This restaurant has organic food, and a great, very casual atmosphere. Also, great location. Enjoy!
author: Eleonor W.

description: My experience here is unparalleled to other burger joints! Victor d and the gang do exceptionally handling large crowds and getting you in and out! The best service around thanks for a great lunch time! Get the bacon blue cheese burger!
author: Keith T.

description: The manager contacted me after my review and offered to give it another chance, which I accepted.  This time, the burger was great - yeah, it was salted, but it was fine and I liked it a lot.  Thanks!
author: Richard A.

description: Quality burger, and delicious shake (I got the fresh strawberry). The house-made pickles were tasty as well. Quick and friendly service, overall a solid choice for hamburgers. I also liked that they had chicken and veggie burgers too, something for everyone!
author: Misha Z.

description: Super Duper YUMMY! Great flavor (even their chicken sandwiches are good!) and EXCELLENT milkshakes
author: K.D. C.

description: Great place to get a super delicious burger. The combos are definitely worth it. I came with the girlfriend and also had to get a milkshake. We had a vanilla milkshake which tasted super duper good.  the burger was good with the fresh pickles that they had.
author: Jason L.

description: Been here a few times.  It has honestly been hit n miss.  Took my brother in law when they were in town and he had to send his burger back.  The pickle jar is a plus, and fries are good.  My burgers have always been consistent
author: Rick T.

description: Just tried once and no more.  I rather go to in and out burger in the future.  The burgers here are expensive and very oily.  Not recommended.  Strongly recommend in and out burgers due to the price and taste.
author: Alex G.

description: I love these burgers. Very juicy and cooked perfectly. The fries are cooked crispy not soggy just the way I like them. I can never drive by without stopping for a vanilla malt.
author: Sparky M.

description: Awesome shakes, good chipotle chicken sandwich (held me over on NYE), and great marina location.
author: Justine G.

description: Decent burger, but today was the second time they have ignored my order. Paid extra for bacon and they didn't even include it on the burger and forgot the onions and jalapeños I added as well. After ordering a pretty basic burger with bacon added I walked away with a to go order only to find when I got home that it was just bun, burger, and cheese. Next time I want a burger I'm walking to Union St and will go to Roam...
author: John P.

description:
I'd say this burger rates a 3-1/2 star.  Good for fast meal and a casual atmosphere.  the burger was better than OK; better than the fast food burgers. We ordered a Super Burger and a Mini Burger.  The mini burger was a good size and I would not call it a mini.  Friend requested extra crispy fries and the order of fries was very crispy.  

Would probably not go out of my way to eat at a Super Duper, but if I was in the area and was wanting a burger, would eat here again.
author: Em D.

description: Food is great! Service is good and speedy. My order is always right. Only negative is the line during peak hours, but that just speaks to the quality of their food.
author: Madelyn A.

description: My wife and son rave about Super Duper. All around excellent, good flavor, etc.  My son particularly likes the extra chewy bacon and the soft-serve ice cream. Personally I'm not a big burger guy, so I get the chicken sandwich -- it's good but not spectacular. But even I appreciate the straightforward menu, and general approach of doing a few simple things very well.
author: Stephen K.

description: The rumors are true. This place is really good. Ever since we ate here, we've been trying other burger places to see if any of them can beat Super Duper. So far, there aren't any. I don't know what it is that makes the meat so juicy and flavorful, but I like it.
author: Michelle G.

description: Super juicy. Super tasty. A bit too super small for my taste. Get the double double with cheese (I skipped the bacon, sort of regrettably). The meat is extremely tasty, always cooked medium rare so the grease is piping hot and tastes delicious. For $8 it's great, just needs to be bigger. Maybe I should have added fries to fill me up.
author: Chuck N.

description: Food was great service was fast. But the supervisor was an Ass. Didn't want me taking any photos inside the restaurant. I was gonna give it a great review. Very unfriendly.
author: Jet Tech C.

description: Went here for lunch with my coworker. Burger was delicious. The Great White beer was perfect with my meal!
author: Michael S.

description: Seriously good, traditional burgers.  Very reasonable prices.  Homemade pickles are free and the bomb (on the sweeter side for dill pickles but still awesome).
author: Darius D.

description:
I think I'm being generous with this review because the last time I came here, something terrible happened.
Long story short, I ordered a veggie burger but ended up with a regular burger. It had been my first time in 6 years since my  tongue has even touched an animal. I should've checked the patty just to be on the safe side but since I was careless at the time, I ended up taking a bite of beef. Immediately to my horror, I spit the disgusting piece out. Unfortunately they didn't comp the meal and only switched the burger, but at least it's something...Anyways I give this place four stars because their veggie burger is amazing and it doesn't taste like a bocca burger patty from the freezer. I love it when places like this put effort into making a veggie burger rather than heating it up. Also the best thing on their menu is the cookie shake - there's actually pieces of cookies in the shake! It's so delicious!!! The only bad thing about this shake is that its unaffordable but all in all, 
I really like this place but vegetarians beware!! 
MAKE SURE THE PATTY ISN'T MEAT.
author: Susie N.

description: My mini cheese burger(4 oz) with grilled onions and jalapeno peppers was super.  The fries were fantastic.  I really wanted the garlic fries, but we were going dancing afterward,  and my friends wouldn't let me get them!  I don't understand the negative reviews.  It's a cute little diner, the guys who work there are hotter than hell, the service was very fast and efficient, and the food was better than I ever expected it to be!  It was probably the best burger I ever had!!  Don't let me forget the wonderful homemade pickles!   I fell in love with the wooden cow on the wall!  Hey, cut me some slack, I'm from Wisconsin!!
author: Blondie R.

description: Loves super duper. Better than 5 guys, more upscale than in n out (obvi), similar to shake shack in NYC but I think better thank shake shack. I like the simplicity of the menu and unlimited and delicious pickles. Good ingredients- niman ranch beef and organic Strauss soft serve. Cheap too! Crispy fries and I like that the toppings aren't overwhelming like at 5 guys. I will def at this to my burger rounds.
author: Kristy H.

description: Veggie burger was SOLID and obviously fresh & house made, bits of veggies visible in patty. Fresh cucumber and hummus under the patty really gave the burger a delightful crunch. Garlic fries were amazing. Husband's mini burger & reg fries were good too. Super friendly cashier, fast service (had our food in less than 5 minutes). The organic ice cream was seriously the best soft serve i've ever had. ever.
author: Sarah L.

description: Epic failure. I really didn't taste anything special... about halfway through my burger, i remembered it had bacon on it... it was there, but i couldn't really tell. The fries are pretty lackluster. The milkshake was okay, but i was lucky it showed up. I knew i wasn't going back, before i even tasted my food. They were really slow to finish our pretty non-special order... then we had to remind them twice that i ordered a milkshake... which they first brought out in a glass for our to-go order. So unorganized... or maybe they just hate money.
author: Sean M.

description:
Super Duper has the best 6 dollar burger in the world (it's better than any 10 dollar burger I've had as well). It's probably got something to do with the freshness and quality of the beef, and they use excellent buns. Great beer on tap, as well as some good happy hour deals. Fries with fresh garlic! Mmmm. Also, they do protein style for you carb-counters. Oh, and the soft serve icecream and shakes are top notch.

TIP: They rarely ask you how you want your meat cooked. They serve it Well Done by default: good, but not special. When I remember to order it Medium Rare, it blows my mind.

I've been to most of their locations in S.F. I've gone to one one day, and another the very next day. I love this location on Chestnut street, but that's just because this neighborhood is beautiful.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Imagine sitting in a casual booth with your friends, excitedly awaiting your burger.  Your chatter immediately ceases when you smell the aroma of meat and cheese approaching you.  You know it's coming.  One of the employees leaves it at your table.  You pick it up and take a bite.  Grease rolls down your hands and you quickly put down the burger before the grease soaks into your sleeves.  You wipe your hands and your brand new napkin is already completely soaked in grease.  But that bite was so delicious that suddenly you don't care that grease is rolling down your arms and dribbling from your chin.  You take another bite and the yolk from the fried egg bursts over the meat.  When you finish eating, you unbuckle your belt because your stomach is bulging over your pants and you can't breathe.  It is a wonderful experience and you can't wait to come back for more.

Super greasy, super delicious.  Homemade pickles.  Get the fried egg and bacon.  Get "everything on it."  If you're on a diet, this is not the place for you.  If you don't like greasy burgers, this is not the place for you.
author: Justine L.

description: I found this place while walking on a chilly evening. Very tasty. I ordered the original burger which includes 2 four oz. patties and added cheese and bacon and wow it had great flavor. Buns were also soft and toasted. The only very minor complaint was the burger was a little greasy but I was so satisfied that I can look past that. Garlic fries were very good but very garlicky. Don't go on a date eating garlic fries because you won't get any at the end of the night I'm just sayin. And the Oreo shake was delicious tasted handmade. I would give it a $$ on the money meter. I would go back.
author: Nancy G.

description: I got the super duper burger with all the fixings, garlic fries, and the Racer IPA. All of that cost me $20 plus tip, for that price I could eat a proper dinner at a Indian cuisine. However the burgers were not bad, not better than Red Robin or Five Guys. The Garlic Fries were slightly disappointing, not that tasty as they should be. If I were to go again it will be for their Shakes because most people seen to be going there for them anyway...til next time!
author: Carlos R.

description: Best hamburger of my life. Killer milkshake too.
author: Kristen F.

description: their free pickles are to come back for. burgers patties are pink on the inside, i don't know if they meant it that way or my order was just undercooked but nevertheless, they tasted very good. i prefer the mini burger because after a while, i get tired of the amount of meat on the big burger. garlic fries are also highly recommended for garlic lovers like me.
author: Xavier E.

description: We went here because they were open later and were pleased with the standard of their burger. We expected something that was fast food but the ingredients were quality, down to there being actual garlic and real cheese on the garlic cheese fries. We will be back!
author: Brittany B.

description: I'm really confused on how so many people can give this place 4 and 5 star reviews. I'll admit that the fries were good and the option to add jalapenos is a bonus that more places need to offer too, but you can find much better burgers for less. The patties need to be seasoned before being cooked because they were very bland and they say that they put "super sauce" on them but I couldn't taste it, unless the grease is what they consider their sauce.
author: Frank J.

description: These guys helped me get over my fear of burgers cooked medium rare because they are so damned good, and I eat one every Tuesday without fail.
author: Vlad G.

description: I am still trying places but this brand could possibly be the best Burger in the city.  It takes In and Out's business model to the next level of quality.  Keep it simple, Keep it great.
author: Nico O.

description: This place is super duper delicious. The burgers are juicy, and there are unlimited pickles! If you're sitting outside and it's cold, ask them to turn the heat lamps on. Also, my friend's order got lost/forgotten, and when he notified one of the servers, she immediately put in the order AND gave him a free milkshake! Friendly service, delicious burgers, unlimited pickles; go here next time you're craving a burger!
author: Kate B.

description: I love their cheeseburger! Best bang for your buck cheeseburger out there! Umami is nice, at a higher price point, but for a basic cheeseburger this is my favorite. I like them more than Roam and they have free pickles, what's not to love.
author: Jimmy M.

description: Wow, this place is the bomb! You really can't go wrong w/a Niman Ranch Burger & they definitely do it right here. I love that this place offers all the "fixings" that I love for free & on top of that I like to add their Roasted Portobello Mushroom AND an Organic Egg! Put it all together, along w/one of their organic shakes & I'm in heaven! If they offered seared foie gras on their burgers then I'd be here every frickin' day! And if you're lucky enough you might be able to see a celebrity while you're there...like Dave Chappelle! Really cool, laid back dude AND I saw the manager/supervisor unwrap his burger for him. Now that's service!
author: John W.

description: 5 stars for food and service. The presentation made it a little tough to eat tidily but I'm nitpicking. Would definitely suggest for quick, casual yet delicious dining
author: M. W.

description: Love the pickles. The burgers are okay. It's a bit salty.
author: Annie C.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed their veggie burger with hummus sauce. The texture of the patty was crisp and flavorful with a variety of veggies mixed in. No need to order fries - the burger is a meal in itself.
author: Joanna L.

description: So okay, a burger is a burger is a burger right? Wrong. And this comes from a guy who likes to broil burgers at home to save money. The best burger in the City! Great location in the Marina which makes it a fun time.
author: Mark F.

description: Great burgers and fresh fries.  Good draft beers.  nothing fancy, but simple menu, and everything done right!  Fast service.  What else can you ask for at a burger place?
author: Dennis M.

description:
yum! the burgers here are juicy and delicious! i'd say it's in my top 5! the other toppings and condiments, thankfully, don't mask the burger flavors and actually enhance and complete the burger experience.

honestly though, they received an automatic 2 stars for the unlimited pickles (i actually wrote a review on a pickle - http://www.yelp.com/biz/marina-submarine-san-francisco#hrid:u7UDtt23-CbIv6eQBU8-Nw)

i've been meaning to do a burger taste-off between super duper, umami, and roam - but more to come when this actually takes place.
author: Marjie T.

description: Gotta be the best burgers in SF hands down! Super juicy patties with fresh ingredients, and you can't beat the free house-made pickles on the side.  The fries are perfectly fried and seasoned.  The salad was just ok though.  Definitely grab a frozen yogurt on your way out too, and it's big enough to share with a friend.
author: Julie P.

description: These burgers are freaking good and the garlic fries are good and they have decent beer on tap.  The food is pretty reasonably priced as well.
author: David P.

description: Burgers are super yummy! Fries are great, home made pickles is a must. They have good service and their cost is reasonable. Soda is refillable so that's a plus.
author: Chanel T.

description: Such a great burger every time!  I'm disappointed to read that anyone would have a problem with the juiciness of these burgers.  They are consistently delicious and also yes, super juicy.  Think of it as a metaphor for life. Grab a bunch of napkins, and live! Get in there!
author: Scott M.

description: I work near here so I stopped here for lunch one day. I had a super duper burger and a cookies and cream milkshake and let me tell you: it hit the spot. I just moved here from Singapore where it's difficult to find a good burger. I mean a reaaally good burger and this place really hammered home how artery-clogging, juicy, succulent burgers are supposed to taste. The milkshake was great too. Good texture, flavor, milkiness--everything about it was what you want your milkshake to be. Liquid ice cream.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Captain Z.

description:
I was disappointed with this place because of the service and the burger.

I came here with my friend and wife for a snack because a movie was sold out. I ordered a super duper burger with mushrooms and "everything on it". My friend ordered a super duper with cheese, bacon, and "everything on it". When our burgers arrived, my friend and I inspected our burgers. Where is the cheese? Where is the bacon? Where are the mushrooms? 

We went up to the front to get our orders corrected. One of the employees told me that they ran out of mushrooms. I don't understand why they didn't mention this earlier. At least they offered to give me back the money. And they were able to correct my friend's burger. 

The taste test finally arrived. The burger was too salty. My wife thought so as well. The patties were dried and overcooked. Why are the reviews so high for this place?
author: Brad C.

description: We decided as a new year's resolution, to give up red meat & only have it once a month so there we were enjoying our juicy,delicious burgers! The trip & the perfect parking spot was just the tip of the iceberg...the burgers were enough, but i wanted to try their shakes! My wife & i ended up sharing a vanilla cone...maybe next time...We will be back !
author: J. S.

description:
This was my first time at any Super Duper Burger Restaurant.

The hostess was not very personable but she was not rude. I think she was in a hurry to leave and I can relate to that.

I wasn't impressed by the environment although It was very clean and the guys working behind the counter seemed very polite and attentive.

I did like the serve yourself pickle area. 

I got a super duper cheese burger with fries and a coke. My bill came out to $12 bucks.

Although the burger was tasty in general sans the extra sodium I must say the fries were lack luster in that they reminded me of the kind you get at Burger King. 

Overall, I would like to come back but the pricing on the item is a bit much in my opinion. If I just happen to be near a Super Duper Chain I might consider it but would not go out of my way.
author: Daniqua J.

description: Good for what it is...regular ole burgers. I had the mini 4oz special, which was $8 and includes the burger, fries and a soft drink. The burger itself was good, although I think I could've eaten a bit more. My husband had the vegetarian, which was acceptable, but nothing outstanding. I think their straus shakes are much better as is their soft serve. For a plain ole burger it's just fine. I didn't find it greasy like others. But if you want something special, Roam on Union is the place to go.
author: Natalie S.

description: Had their portobello mushroom salad. Delicious! Will go back for some garlic fries :)
author: Julian M.

description:
four stars for homemade pickles! 
the burgers are good,  but may be a tad bit expensive for my college broke ass. 

DO NOT LEAVE WITHOUT TRYING THE COOKIES AND CREAM MILK SHAKE!
author: Chelsea B.

description: The only thing that's tastier than their burgers, is the guy with the dark hair and tattoos that works there.
author: Gretchen V.

description: Went here with the Gilt City deal and had a wonderful experience. The kid ringing us up new exactly what to do and in no time at all we were seated and had our drinks. He told us to come up at the end to get our ice cream cones but we were much too full and he even followed us out of the restaurant to see if we wanted the ice cream. I'd call that pretty good service for a "fast food" joint in the Marina.
author: Pam S.

description: I thought that Johnny was Meh.. but Super is worse! It has potential, but yikes. No bueno!!! They lie, or at very least are not ready yet. First they promote beer...but their taps DON'T work! Next was was the pies, again disappointment. They DON'T have any available but are offering them...very chaotic and stupid. How can you offer what you do not have? They should have waited to open instead of rushing. Go to Barneys! Don't waste your time.
author: Natasha M.

description: I am reluctant to write a review on a restaurants first day but seeing the negative comments here I need to put in my thoughts.  Firstly, I don't eat burgers because I refuse to eat factory lot beef or chicken.  A sustainable burger - right up my alley!   My niece ate a mini burger, it was juicy and full of flavor.  The fries were perfect, and the milkshakes were to die for, perfectly thick and still drinkable through a straw.  The salad was great also, fresh and a pretty good serving size for the price.  While the service and staff were a little disorganized because it was their first day I am certain that will smooth itself out.  Hey, if you are expecting five star service go and pay for a five star meal.   I will be back.
author: D B.

description: Why would I go to a burger place and order a chicken sandwich?  I'm still not sure.  The chicken was a dud, but I thought I would give it another chance since the garlic fries were amazing.  So I went back a second time and ordered a super duper burger, which was superduperlicious!  For $2 more than the mini u get double the amount of meat, but I forgot about the law of diminishing returns.  I'm not sure how great it is to have extra meat, if u can't eat it!  Plus, I had to save room for the garlic fries!  This is a great place to go if u want to sabotage your diet!
author: michele k.

description: I love Super Duper.  I love the freshness of each patty, and the various options that you can add to make it your own.  It isn't comparable to the more upscale Umami burger, but I think this place is better than Five Guys.  The burger that I recently ordered was the Mini Burger adding Bacon, Avocado with just Spread and Red Onion.  The ending result = DELICIOUS.  Bacon makes everything better, and avocado is one of my most favorite things to top off any burger/sandwich.  The decadence of the combination was tasted in each bite and had me wanting more after it was long over.  I love their french fries and think they're much better than In N Out and Five Guys.  I wasn't a fan of the lemonade, I was expecting something a little sweeter rather than sour/tart.  I've gone to Super Duper for my lunch hour down in the Financial District on Market, and I'm always in food coma afterwards.  This is much better for dinner than for lunch.  I love my combination and will be hopefully going back soon!
author: Lisa I.

description: I love super duper burger but this super duper's burger seems way greasier then the other locations....the bun was soggy from grease.
author: Wakako U.

description: This place was AWESOME when it opened up. Now, the fries are always soggy, the tables are not clean, the burgers are loaded with salt and the place just seems a bit dingy. I used to go about once a weekend. Those garlic fries (when they are cooked properly) are amazing. However, I have been going less and less now that it's going downhill. If I was the owner, I would really want to whip this place into shape. I know I'm not the only person who feels this way. I have a relative coming into town this weekend, and normally I would bring them there for a great lunch, but I wouldn't bring them there now. The quality of the food is just not as good, and the cleanliness is lacking. I hope they can improve things soon.
author: Mason K.

description: I think within the 3 check-ins I have here, I tried almost everything. Garlic fries, regular fries, the mini beef burger with everything on it including the extras, cookies & cream milkshake, and an ice cream dipped in chocolate. Omfg, I'm a Super Duper fatass.
author: Anita W.

description:
Feb 14, 2012 update...

OK, they seemed to have really improved.  I still don't love the layout, but the hamburgers are mouthwatering, a little greasy, but mouthwatering.  Worth checking out.
author: Brian G.

description:
it should be noted that the portobello burger is NOT a healthy option, breaded and deep fried.  

delicious?   yes.
healthy?  no!
author: Josie M.

description: If you like yummy juicy burger with fresh ingredient this is the place.  Although the line is a bit long but their turn over is pretty quick.  I ordered their min meal deal since i wasn't that hungry for $8.00.  It come with a cheese burger, small fires & a soft drink.  Good food with great value!
author: Charlie H.

description: Like Shake Shack in NYC. Great burgers, good pickles and fine shakes. Definitely a top 3 burger joint in the US that I have tasted  and absolutely best in SFO
author: John R.

description: I really don't know what all the hype is about?? The burger was ok at best.  There are at least 10 places within walking distance that have much better burgers.  Its got the old school diner feel and thats cool. There are sit down places like barneys, roam, umami ect and if you want something faster, in and out, that are all better.  If this was the only place to get a burger around there then it would be ok, but with so many options it just doesn't make sense.
author: Vince C.

description: Meat inside the burger too cooked. Very very greasy, awful!! Fries were good, garlic fries too strong. Diet coke bad... The cookies & cream shake deserves 4 stars... but that's it!!
author: Fred S.

description: This was my last place to try on my list of new burger places in the Marina. If you are looking for a super basic, fast burger this is a good spot. The place is really clean and the staff is friendly. I honestly like In n Out better - and the other burger places in the Marina (Roam, Umami Burger) but would come back here in a pinch.
author: Gina C.

description: These burgers are awesome, cooked juicy to perfection! I usually go for the 8 oz. double patty Super Burger + a second 4 oz. single patty Mini Burger when I'm "super" hungry. I have a large appetite but I'm sure one burger is sufficient for the normal appetite. I also love their fries made in small batches and hand tossed when they add the salt and their free all-you-can-eat homemade pickles.
author: Serghio P.

description:
this review is for the icecream only

its pretty poor,think wendys 
frosty, but wendys frosty only costs 99 cents
super duper cost $4 
very little icecream taste

buy the kids one its only $2.50 and nearly the same size


but a better idea is skip the icecream
author: cc c.

description: Yummy burger joint. If you get their lemonade, water it down. It's not that great and way too strong.  Figure half a glass of a lemonade with half a glass of water should make decent lemonade. We watched the burgers being made it they are made well. Ingredients were fresh too. WIll return.
author: Jael J.

description:
Hello San Francisco, and any tourist that come across this eclectic place...At first glance it looks like another hipster joint with a yummpy menu to serve...Burgerf fries, chicken and salads not bad, not to mention, they sell alcoholic beverages...kinda.

If i could give this place half a star i would. At first glance i couldn't tell if it was open, or still under construction. There was a  mass of people, just everywhere, and they weren't customers either. I'm not positive about food safety laws, as they tend to change periodically, but im almost positive that if your not in uniform, you shouldn't be around food. THe girls weren't wearing hats or nets and the male weren't either. 

My EXPERIENCE: When I walked in, i wasn't greeted with a hi, or a smile, instead i was confused as i couldn't tell who was working there and who was a customer. Then  guy greeted me and acted as if he was going to take my order, but instead told me that the guy next to him will. At that point i had already made up my mind on what i wanted to eat, it sounded so good...The order taker wasn't friendly at all. While he was about to take my order he was interrupted by two employees tying to clock in, which is fine i get it, they need to start working but he wasn't like it will just be a sec sorry for that or, what can i get started for you, no i was completely ignored. Then i proceded to ask what came on the burger, and if they could tell me if their sauce had pickles, considering that i am allergic to pickle, this was crucial information. The guy ignored my question the first time, i had  to ask twice more. After a brief explanation, I proceeded to order a mini cheeseburger with lettuce tomato, mayo and jalapenos and ketchup, he asked if i wanted onion, and i said yes grilled.  And an order of Garlic Fries.
*10 minutes later* 
I get my food, and it wasn't what i asked for, first of all, the bun was cold, it had their sauce on it, the onions weren't grilled, and there weren't any jalapenos. i go up to the counter to ask for some and they guy doesn't wash his hands and just grabbed some form the container...gross. Then i realized, i crap this is their sauce i cant eat this, so i take the burger back, and they make me a new one, cool thanks, i get my burger, they put the sauce in he side... i thought i said NO sauce,  the onions aren't grilled and the bun is still cold. There must be a language barrier. none the less i eat my burger. it was flavorful but WAY greasy...not to be confused with juicy. 
I wont be returning to this place, first impressions are everything. If i could give the owners a word of advice, if you promote a SUPER DUPER burger, make sure there is SUPER DUPER service as well. and while i think its great that most everything is compostable, its not enough to bring me back.Maybe try working out the kinks before opening to the masses,  like the broken computer, the non working beer on tap, oh and the customer service training.I will not be returning To this or any location. I know burgers, and this was not a good burger.
author: Zareth F.

description: FIrst time ive ever been here.  Staff was friendly.  Food was good and fresh.  It's just funny the money that's made over "organic everything" claims.  I get it, and everyone wants great food but im not immune to the fact that the "word" organic is all about the Benjamin's.  Yes, I would dine here again, but it is not the best by any stretch of the imagination.
author: Lorence L.

description: The kid spotted this place from the bus and we hopped off to try it  We thought it was really good.  My son had phased out of burgers but really liked this one. Garlic fries rocked. The kid liked the homemade pickles. The only thing that wasn't superb was the shake, but I think that's just a personal preference: I'm not into soft ice cream.
author: CR S.

description: The burger was fat and juicy but my fav part was the bun!  It was toasted to perfection and had just enough butter to make my heart melt.
author: Grace P.

description:
I really enjoyed the food here. The garlic fries and fresh strawberries milkshake, in particular, were fantabulous. The hamburgers were nice, tasty and big. I also loved the unlimited pickles. The food is priced reasonably (for SF). You won't walk away from this place feeling vaguely ripped-off, and thinking "omg, I just spent $20 on a meal, and I'm still hungry", like I did at Umami burger, for example. 
If I had to nitpick anything, I think it'd be the special sauce, which, as others have said, add nothing to the burgers except to make them seem greasier and messier.
author: L N.

description: Good veggie burger and milkshakes. Fries are ok; I prefer them a little thicker.
author: Kitzzy A.

description: Don't waste your time going here. The burgers are flavorless and drip grease- literally. The fries were cold and the cheese isn't melted. Overpriced for no flavor.
author: Shelly W.

description: Burgers are fantastic!  Made to order and everything is fresh....only reason they didn't get five stars is because I'm and onion ring aficionado and there aren't any on the menu.  The shakes almost make up for it though.  YUM
author: Dion W.

description: WOW really only 3 1/2 stars!  We were looking for an inexpensive place to eat dinner at around 8:30. Seriously was walking up and down the street, nothing sounded good and then BAM there it was Super Duper Burgers! I mean who wouldn't want to eat a "super duper" burger. It was busy, yet there were plenty of open seats. Fast and efficient. Free refills on fountain drinks. And the JUICIEST burgers ever! homemade pickles w/ a bit of a kick (located in a jar by the soda machine). And soft serve ice cream for dessert. Go there now! you will not be disappointed....
author: Cynthia R.

description: I literally just finished eating my burger from this joint. It was a very tasty 4 oz burger. The sauce that is included in the burger is quite flavorful and the garlic fries wasn't too bad either. I'm a bigger fan due to their exceptional customer service. I was about to bash them on yelp for having to wait 13 minutes for my burgers when everyone else was receiving theirs. (mind you, i only had 10 more minutes to eat my burger before going back to work) however, a very nice gentleman who saw the impatience on my face took my ticket and reimbursed me for my meal. "it's on the house!" Order #82 is truly grateful. Thank you and you'll be seeing me again!
author: Maria Kookie P.

description:
Very fresh, very tasty burgers.
However inside is bare and industrial so not a great place to meet for a chat with friends. Seating can be an issue for larger parties.
author: Mira J.

description: Tried this place yesterday for the first time. Every time I walk by here it is always busy! I ended up ordering the super burger combo with garlic fries. The burger looked small but it really did fill me up to the max. I am in love with the garlic fries; they are my favorite thing on the menu so far. The homemade pickles were delicious as well. I will be going back soon to try other things!
author: LaShea R.

description: decent burgers.  Simple menu.  Free delicious pickles with a little kick.  Friendly fast service.  FYI:  the "mini" burger is not mini & the "super duper" burger is TWO BEEF Patties.  The milkshakes are made with soft serve ice cream, which tastes just like soft serve ice cream so I am not a fan.
author: Melissa G.

description:
i went back to super duper this afternoon to give it another try.  i've changed my diet over the last few months and no longer eat meat, so i wasn't sure how what to expect of their vegetarian options (sometimes burger joints totally screw vegetarians by having no options available or a terrible, freeze dried, disgusting veggie patty).  i opted for no hummus and requested the cambazola cheese instead.  i was really surprised at how yummy the veggie burger tasted!  i also tried the chocolate dipped ice cream cone, which was HUGE by the way, and it was great.  

i was also much more pleased with the service.  it wasn't super busy when i got there, maybe about half full, but it got busier as i had lunch.  the staff seemed to be better equipped to handle situation than during my previous visits.  no one seemed confused or stumbling.  much smoother.  i'm glad to see that some of the kinks have been worked out and will be back at a later date to try the portobella burger.  yes, they have TWO options available for vegetarians here!
author: Anjanette M.

description: o stars 4 free burger day which wasn't crowded, and I  don't like everything on the burger.
author: Chris D.

description: Good, quick place to dine when you're in the Marina. People are in and out pretty quick so you can usually snag a seat. The food was just okay. Burger was standard, the bun was sub-par, and the fries were overpriced (almost $3 for a tiny bag of garlic fries?). I do like that they offer home-made pickles for free, but it still doesn't justify the prices.
author: Leily P.

description:
Pretty much just like FiveGuys but without the free peanuts. Typical burger spot but but nothing really super duper about their burgers. They get pretty messy but not like a good messy, more like a frustrating messy...like you just wanna hurry up and finish. 

On the plus side, the homemade pickles are pretty good. I don't usually eat pickles but I got up a few times to get some more. Also, their hand dipped soft serve fro yo is awesome. I made the mistake of getting a regular sized one and it melted faster than I could eat it. I think the kid sized one would be considered standard in other places.
author: JeF m.

description: Great atmosphere and a beautiful view of Chestnut and Pierce. Fun for people watching. Micros on tap and what an awesome berger. Mmmm damn good. Prices just right worth all of the 10 bucks for the combination.
author: Brad W.

description: This was a good place to go for a quick dinner.  I ordered the veggie burger and my bf order the chicken sandwich and a friend ordered the hamburger.  The veggie burger was amazing, bf said the chicken sandwich was great and the burger was also great!  We also ordered a side of fries which were tasty.  The menu was a little tricky and the food came out randomly and they yelled your name, which was a little intense.  Over all the food was good, the price was decent and I will go back.  Also they are open late which is nice!
author: Hillary B.

description: Asked if they could put some ketchup and mustard on my burger and they insisted I do it myself. Of course the mustard had to spray on to my pant leg for good measure.  Burger was okay though. Ice cream cone is the best thing they have going.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Wow. I had high hopes for Super Duper burger as it tractor beamed my vision on a hungry monday evening. Being one of the only restaurants on chestnut street with a decent amount of people in it, me and my friend said what the hell. It looked like a solid joint. Clean, simple, classic interior. Sharp, metallic looking furniture and signs. The place is fairly new, only open for about a month. The menu is fairly simple: burgers, fries and milkshakes. I ordered the double burger, not sure of the name though. I also ordered a basket of garlic fries. My order came out to a little over 10 dollars.
I pulled up a seat at the bar and watched the cooks making fries and grilling the hand pressed patties as I waited for my food. The food came quick. I unwrapped my burger. The bottom bun must have been taking a bath in the fry oil because that thing was soaked! I've never seen a greasier burger. You know when you have to dab the grease off of a pizza with a napkin because its so greasy? It was that greasy. At that point I would have put down the burger and just ordered a milkshake if I was willing to pay 6 dollars for one! The burger had no flavor to it. I make better cheeseburgers! I think everyone will agree that burgers have to be unique. Who can make an in n out other than in n out. If Super Duper cant make a better cheeseburger than I can make at home, then I aint eating there!
On a brighter note, They do make decent garlic fries....but I won't be back unless i hear the burger have gotten better. Go to in-n-out!
author: Hunter S.

description: I always love a good burger and this place doesn't make you feel unhealthy when you eat one of their tasty burgers. If they would just let down on the grease a little bit it would be a perfect 5 stars.
author: Luis C.

description: They toast 20 buns at a time and let them sit around for 20 minutes before serving them.  How hard is it to freshly toast a bun.  The chefs seem lazy.
author: Tbone J.

description: I like to get their portobello sandwich with cheese. $6 for a tasty, semi-healthy, quick lunch? No complaints here. (Could have used more napkins in the to-go bag, though.)
author: Sabrina V.

description: Ryan, manager, very kind and helpful-staff very friendly, cooks excellent
author: M M.

description: Beware of credit card cramming. I signed the credit card receipt and found a $3 tip had been added when I distinctly did not.
author: Reza H.

description: I don't usually like burgers.  In & Out animal style is the only burger I would eat, and this feels like high-end In & Out, the meat is surprisingly tasty, can't wait to go back!
author: A Z.

description: I had a mini cheeseburger with everything on it and a chocolate shake.  It was really good but I wish they would put more sauce on it.  Maybe next time, I have to ask for extra sauce.  The chocolate shake was very delicious.  I like the fact that everything is organic and farm fresh.  Definitely will go back.
author: Ammala B.

description: A bit salty but good nonetheless. Love the garlic fries but small portion.
author: Henry L.

description: This place is super duper! The burgers and garlic fries was delicious and it wasn't expensive!  The brown sugar lemonade was fresh and tasty.  They even homemade their own pickles.  Not to mention the service was excellent.  I will definitely be back soon.
author: Connie N.

description:
I'm unfortunately not a fan of fat.

The burgers are much too greasy. Large quantities of fat was oozing out of the patty, the bacon, the cheese and the butter on the bun. The only real flavor beyond grease was the bacon.

The fries tasted like they have been fried in old oil and were by far the least greasy part of the meal.

Needless to say I left over 50% of the burger and fries on the plate.
author: Fred D.

description: 5 stars really isn't enough.  I absolutely LOVE this place!!!  Their burgers are amazing, their garlic fries are to die for, and the price can't be beat.  I go in so much that the owner/manager gave me a free ice cream cone!  It is nice to be appreciated for your business.  The food here really is amazing - even compared to the other much more expensive burger places around the area.  Great food, great staff, highly recommend!! :)
author: Jackie V.

description: All organic or local and the prices are great.  Tasty.  Damn SF has some awesome burger joints.
author: D B.

description: Why??? I LOVE the financial district Super! This one had a NOT super burger :( Bad tomatoes, avocados weren't ready and burger was too greasy. Soooo sad as this is so close to me.
author: Katrina H.

description:
Super Duper? No Super POOPER. : (
I was hopeful this could be the burger of my dreams. I work right up the street, how fun a new burger joint is going in, mmmm lunch breaks. Well sorry but I will not be going back often if at all.  My probs with it were mainly the meat and bun. The meat was not primo cuts, it had weird bits of things in it I do not care to be chewing on.  I guess I am spoiled by good meat. Go to Real Foods and buy some organic chuck and make a burger at home. mmmm WAY BETTER. And the bun was too much hard white bread and not toasty enough. I do give them props for the "building of the burger". It was stacked nice, very awesome to the eye. And I only got the mini. I watched the cooks (who were working very hard) make this porno of a burger. Wish it would have tasted as good as it looked and smelled. OH well. I did think the soft serve cone was  fun and delicious. I will be back for that for sure. 

Oh and please the dipping sauces with the fries....poo poo
you could do sooo much better! And why no onion rings? : (


I was bummed by this burger
author: Talisha H.

description: This is one of my favorite hamburger places to go to! It has good meats and nice customer service and it has VERY good hamburgers! I always get the mini burger and it is really nice! I also get  milkshakes and ice cream. The adult size ice cream is very large; just the way I like it. Super Duper is delicious!!!!
author: Alexandra A.

description: 1 star for quick and good service, but the burger was not for me. If you like greasy, salty burgers then this is the place for you.  I got the double with cheese plain and an order of fries- meh.  I prefer In-n-out and Umami Burger.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Tasty burgers, non-greasy fries, and nice beers.  Friendly, helpful staff made the visit a pleasure.
author: Brian M.

description: You know the old saying "you don't know what you've got till it's gone"?  When I moved away from SF I knew there were a lot of things I'd miss, but I didn't count on a burger joint being one of them.  Well, I genuinely miss Super Duper's amazing garlic fries, their cookies and cream shakes, and delicious veggie burgers with avocado (yup -- I'm a veggie -- and still dreaming about this place).  The next time I'm back in SF, I'm DEFINITELY coming in to satisfy my Super Duper cravings!
author: Irene L.

description: Decent burger and fries.  Wasn't pow, knock our socks off.  Love the Strauss ice cream cones.  Will give them another shot when in the area.
author: Danny M.

description: Super delicious, juicy burger.  Garlic fries were amazing.  Everything was super fresh.
author: Allison B.

description: Burger was a little greasy, but what do you expect from a joint like this... didnt try the shakes, but I will certainly go down to 3 stars if I'm not impressed. Burger joints gotta have solid shakes! Garlic fries were B+ (coulda used more garlic)
author: MJ R.

description: Cheese on the garlic fries was great and the burger was super juicy.
author: Ricky K.

description: I've been several times and I'm never disappointed! These burger and the fixings are great! It's like going to a high end restaurant for a burger, same great quality burger or sandwich except they're cheaper and ready at almost the speed of fast food. On top of that the ambiance is great and service is friendly.
author: John H.

description: The burgers were really yummy! And the garlic fries and strawberry shake made it even better. I wish they made kids sized burgers but I will happily finish any leftovers my children leave behind.
author: Keromi K.

description: Chicken burgers loaded with everything with garlic fries..fresh , simple and delicious.
author: Y U.

description: Parking can be a challenge, but the burgers are superb.  It is probably the only burger I actively seek out besides In-N-Out.  The fresh pickles are excellent and the garlic fries are garnished extremely heavily.
author: Alan D.

description: OK, but certainly not worthy of the Super Duper name. Better burgers and fries are at McDonalds and Burger King, for half the price. No reason to go back.
author: Maurice G.

description: En par with M Burger in Chicago. The more you drink, the more you like. A bit expensive for what you get, but with the number of Generation Yers  dealing with toxic booze syndrome it will no-doubt remain a mainstay.
author: Mike B.

description: These are my favorite burgers in SF so far.  I love the self serve pickles, the perfectly cooked fries, the soft buns, and the flavorful burgers themselves.  I order mine with the spicy aioli they put on their chicken sandwiches - it goes so perfectly with the burger. My only criticism is their homemade lemonade - don't care for it.  But for burgers and fries - YUM YUM YUM.
author: Kristine S.

description: I don't know what these other Yelpers are talking about, but I think the service here is awesome.  Yea, the lines are long, but common, 6 dollars for a gourmet burger?  You also can't beat the garlic fries.  This place is usually packed, but for a good reason.  In my opinion the lines here move considerably fast.  The service here has been spot on every time I've come here, and I come here rather frequently since I like to stuff my face with artery clogging juicy double patty beef-o-liciousness... that, and I live rather close to this location.  Chestnut Yelpers don't like it very much when they don't have it their way.. I think they should loosen up a little because this place definitely deserves no less than 4 stars.
author: Darren H.

description: I had a mushroom burger and it was okay. I will go back and try something else if I'm ever in the area. The people who work here looked bored.
author: k h.

description: The burgers here are absolutely phenomenal. I never write reviews on yelp but this place definitely deserves some recognition. The cashiers were very nice and the service was lightning quick. The burger was juicy, the garlic fries were awesome, and the milkshake was perfect. Everything was decently priced and the fresh decor set a great tone for the meal. I will most definitely be coming back and I will recommend this restaurant to all of my friends for sure.
author: Mike Y.

description: Best veggie burger I have ever had. It tasted like it was made with real veggies (broccoli, onions, peppers) and was the patty was crisp. Also got the garlic fries which were amazing. Husband got the chicken sandwich and regular fries and liked both.
author: Kristen S.

description: Yum. Drunk/Sunday Funday food. Fries and vanilla shake. Money.
author: Lina L.

description: yummy burgers and fries!! and this is in a town with roam and umami down the street! only riff is the ice cream/shakes MORE CHOCOLATE PLEASE. thank you.
author: K K.

description: Cute, and great for a quick bite while running errands.  Awesome that there are vegan and organic choices.  the milkshakes are yummy!
author: Danielle B.

description: Place has pickle bar. No clear label if they are spicy or not.   They were and not good. Service cold. Food not great, saved by quality of ingredients.  GO to Roam burger instead
author: Dan W.

description: I am not a burger eater. In fact, if I weren't pregnant, I'd probably be ordering their portobello burger. Being that I was pregnant, their burger was the 2nd best I ever had. (First best of course is Kalbi Burger in L.A.) They know what well-done means - no pink meat. Rarely do restaurants comprehend that term. I got the super duper with cheese and a portobello patty, fries, and a chocolate shake. My oh my, it was greasy, juicy, and most important, scrumptious. I will be back.
author: Lisa F.

description: When it comes to burgers you definitely get what you pay for or otherwise make yourself. That being said this place has the "Best Burger for your Buck," at $6.50. Basic menu with build your own options.Free-formed 8oz patty very juicy, perfectly medium well cooked, and tasty on a fresh cut bun. Burgers are not cooked on open flame but are cooked on a griddle. (Charcoal and wood chips makes major taste difference to me.) Fries are nothing special, next time I will try the garlic fries. They make good milkshakes and have a good beer selection on tap. Nice, casual and busy place to grab a quick bite and people watch on Chestnut.
author: Trev D.

description: love there burger. none of that Fancy stuff like umami that kind of loses how a burger should taste like
author: Greg D.

description: I was just at Super Duper Burgers in Marina SF.  I ordered the mini burger with everything!  The burger was no where a mini burger, it was more like a 1/4 pounder, hey no complaints here!  The burger was juicy, very very flavorful!  I normally dunk my burger in ketchup due to the lack of taste, but with this Super Duper Mini burger, I didn't care for any condiments, no ketchup whatsoever! I inhaled that thing in less then 5 minutes!  Service was fast and efficient, staff were really nice and friendly.  The  food, place, staff, all deserve a 5 star!  I'll be back for you mini burger!!!!
author: Li C.

description: Great place if you want a greasy burger! Just got back from this place for lunch and went straight for the Imodium. Doesn't even come close to some of the other new burger joint that are popping up around the City.
author: Henri G.

description: So excited to see a new one of these...just increases my chances of being able to visit one more often!  My boyfriend and I hope to see them open more in the future.  As expected (having been a regular at the Castro location), they have the sweetest staff, and the food is so yummy.   Still my favorite burger in SF.
author: Kathleen S.

description: I went yesterday afternoon for a burger and fries.  The burger was heavily salted. uggh. The fries were over cook. i am shock that this chain can have two other restaurants in the city. I should have been smarter when they posted help wanted sign out in front of their store. oh the service is friendly, but the food is horrible. The owner of this place should have more quality control unless they using business strategy of hooter where they salt everything for customers to buy their dranks.
author: Stanley L.

description: Burgers were good if not a bit greasy. What earns its average review was the girl at the counter. Since she would not look up at me while I was ordering, she couldn't be sure when I was finished so she kept interrupting me with "is that it?" or "anything else?". When I ordered a "super duper" burger she took the order as a mini and kept insisting that's what I wanted. I said no, I wanted the full size. She then said, in a rather snotty tone, that it was two patties. I am a grown woman who was rather hungry at the time, I know what I was getting into! Anyway, my advice it to actually hire people who want to be there. No one looked happy to be working there. I get it, I've lived/ worked in the Marina for over 40 years and have worked with the public. It's not an easy place to work and folks around here are not always polite but you still need to put on a face when dealing with the public. Especially a new place. Good luck! Oh, the fries were ok...too garlicky for me. It was Friday, Black Friday...rough day for us retailers!!
author: Nicole C.

description: amazing burgers! super fresh. the meat was perfectly seasoned and really didn't need any ketchup or other condiment, though i did like the special sauce (i asked for it on the side). i like that i can order a small (4 oz) burger as that's all i need. i got bacon and cheese on mine, and lettuce, tomato and onions (grilled, by request). the fries were a bit eh -- they're like in-and-out fries. the soft-serve cone with a choco-dip brought me back to a *real* summer day on the boardwalk back east. sadly, it was just another foggy and grey summer day here in SF, but Super Duper made it a good one. great service, too!
author: m r.

description: Went here for ice cream with my nieces. It's supposed to be great - organic - blah blah blah. What I discovered was that the milk shakes taste terrible! My niece ordered one and they gave it to her an inch short of the top - I mean if I'm going to pay these prices then I want it full! It didn't matter anyway because it tasted terrible. After one sip my niece (I had a sip too) said -" this doesn't taste good - it doesn't taste like cookies and cream". After rolling his eyes the fellow at the counter agreed to switch it out for a basic cone. I had a cone with the chocolate covering - have you ever had peanut butter stuck on the roof of your mouth? This waxy awful chocolate is terrible - don't do it! The ice cream is nothing special either. So come here and you can pay a lot, get subpar food and workers with attitude or you can go to the frozen yogurt place down Chestnut - it's still pricey, but it tastes way better and they actually welcome you! Wow! Imagine that!
author: Mary M.

description: Updating my review...I am disappointed to have to do this. I come here ALL the time and although I've found the burgers to be slightly bland, the addition of chipotle aioli (instead of the super sauce) does the trick. Unfortunately, I've had a couple bad experiences. Two out of the last four times I went, I ordered everything on it, and they didn't put "everything on it" as advertised--because it happened the first time, I double checked the second time w. the girl saying everything on it, and then repeating each ingredient that was supposed to be included. The worst experience, especially being a regular, was when I came in one day and learned that they close at 2am--My friends and I specifically caught a cab home early to make it to Super Duper--get there at 1:50--10 minutes, yes! Wrong--we walk in, the manager says Sorry, we're closed. I said, well I know the sign says 3am but last time I was in here you mentioned you actually close at 2, so we came on time...I'm confused. He literally shrugged, turned and walked away without another word. I was completely shocked--I've never been treated like this in any establishment, let alone by the manager. You've lost my business.
author: Claire J.
